name: Agricultural Marketing Specialist 1
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 AGRICULTURAL MARKETING SPECIALIST I 

DEFINITION 

Under the supervision of the Chief, Bureau of Agricultural Development and Promotions, 
Division of Markets, New Jersey Department of Agriculture, plans, develops and implements
 innovative market development programs and activities for New Jersey agricultural products 
within the State, regionally and internationally: serves as the team supervisor and provides 
expert technical assistance to department personnel and to marketers of New Jersey 
agricultural products: handles market development for specialized procurement system (e.g.  
the military); performs the more complex liaison and coordination activities associated with 
market expansion and promotion efforts; does related work as required.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK 

Assists in the planning, development and implementation of public relations, promotions 
and publicity programs to bring about greater efficiency and effectiveness in the marketing 
of New Jersey agricultural products.

Serves as lead worker in providing highly technical expert marketing assistance to marketers 
of New Jersey agricultural products.

Provides professional market planning and development advice and assistance to Agricultural 
Commodity Promotion Councils and other commodity and producer groups in support of their 
market promotion and development programs.

Conducts consumer and retailer preference surveys concerning New Jersey agricultural 
products to determine when changes or new trends are occurring in the marketplace which 
will necessitate market development program alterations.

Plans and implements promotional and educational activities such as display and recipe 
contests, seminars and conferences, exhibits and trade shows which highlight to producers, 
consumers, retailers and others the benefits of purchasing and/or using New Jersey agricultural 
products.

Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility for 
effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or disciplining of 
employees.

Develops innovative market development and expansion programs for funding by various 
Federal and State, public and private sources to provide additional resources.

Assists in the planning, development and implementation of market development and 
merchandising programs with agricultural buyers in local, national and international market 
areas in order to develop new sales for New Jersey produced agricultural commodities.

Solicits the cooperation of producers, consumers, community, civic and government 
organizations in participating in agricultural promotion and market development programs 
which develop interest in and expand the sale of New Jersey agricultural commodities.

Serves as market development specialist in support of expanding the sale of New Jersey
agricultural products to the military and other specialized procurement systems.

Performs the more complex liaison and coordination activities associated with market 
expansion and promotion efforts which utilize mass media campaigns to promote the sale 
of New Jersey farm products.

Evaluates and prepares material for newspaper, magazine and outdoor advertising as well 
as for point-of-purchase, news releases and other printed material used in the promotion of 
agricultural products produced in New Jersey to increase their sale and use.

Reviews and prepares technical reports on the results of market surveys and other marketing
projects, and special events.

Develops and conducts market promotion and expansion programs in support of specialized 
agricultural outlets such as roadside markets, community markets and auction markets.

Represents the market development program and serves as division representative at meetings,
 conferences and seminars as assigned.

Assists the chief, in the assignment and instruction of subordinate staff, and oversees their
 performance on a project or assigned basis.

Drafts correspondence in the course of official duties.

Maintains the appropriate and essential market development and promotion files.

May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems used by the agency, office or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS 

EDUCATION 

Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, or Home 
Economics, Agricultural Economics, Agriculture, Agribusiness or Business Administration, 
including or supplemented by at least 12 credit hours in marketing.

Four years of professional experience in programs of promotion, marketing or public relations 
for agricultural products.

A Master's degree in any of the above subjects may be substituted for one year of the indicated
experience.

Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation 
of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the 
position.

 KNOWLEDGES AND ABILITIES 

Knowledge of the principles, methods and techniques of successfully marketing farm products.

Knowledge of modern public relations and publicity methods, procedures, techniques and 
materials and their utilization to improve farm product marketing.

Knowledge of market development and promotion techniques as they relate to the sale of 
agricultural products.

Knowledge of international trade: import restrictions, letters of credit, label clearance and export 
publications.

Ability to acquire thorough knowledge of the important farm products of New Jersey and the 
production and marketing practices used by producers and marketers in this State.

Knowledge of developments in agricultural products marketing in the United States and abroad 
in order to improve the marketing of products produced in New Jersey.

Knowledge of food distribution systems, its components and operating systems.

Knowledge of communications skills as used in marketing and promotion program.

Knowledge of supervision as it applies to serving as lead worker on special projects and 
assignments.

Ability to work effectively with a diverse mixture of agricultural industry representatives, including 
farmers, buyers, dealers, distributors, food processors and other groups.

Ability to prepare appropriate, attractive and useful publicity and promotional material used for 
point-of-purchase signs, price cards, advertising copy used in various media and various events.

Ability to assist in the planning and development programs to improve the marketing of New 
Jersey products.

Ability to assign, instruct and oversee the performance of other staff members.

Ability to conduct verbal and/or written consumer and retailer surveys.

Ability to conduct consumer promotional events.

Ability to prepare correspondence in connection with New Jersey marketing and promotion 
programs.

Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate and informative reports containing findings, conclusions 
and recommendations.

Ability to maintain the essential unit records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and information 
systems used by the agency, office or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to perform the 
duties of this position. American Sign Language or braille may also be considered as 
acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform the 
essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to their known 
limitations. If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer 
undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote54726SCNL27N/AR27-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 3/4/86

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, or Home Economics, Agricultural Economics, Agriculture, Agribusiness or Business Administration, including or supplemented by at least 12 credit hours in marketing.
A Master's degree in any of the above subjects may be substituted for one year of the indicated experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree, specifically a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Home Economics, Agricultural Economics, Agriculture, Agribusiness, or Business Administration, is absolutely required for this job. This requirement is reinforced by the stipulation of 12 credit hours in marketing within the degree program. Moreover, the role requires specialized knowledge and skills in marketing agricultural products, conducting market surveys, and developing promotional programs. The requirement for such a degree is reflective of the need for a strong foundational understanding of marketing principles, agricultural products, and economic factors relevant to the industry, which typically are covered in the specified educational programs. Although it is possible to substitute a Master's degree for one year of the required experience, the educational requirement itself is mandatory to qualify for the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Home Economics, Agricultural Economics, Agriculture, Agribusiness, or Business Administration, including or supplemented by at least 12 credit hours in marketing, is a requirement for the position. This constitutes a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree.

name: Unemployment Insurance Technician 4

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.
Possession of a Master's degree in Business or Public Administration or related area from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience in work involving various phases of social insurance such as disability, unemployment or workers compensation programs in a public or private agency

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of Unemployment Insurance Technician 4. The job description states that candidates can qualify through a combination of experience and education. Specifically, the requirements can be met with eight years of professional experience in relevant fields, or a bachelor's degree plus four years of relevant experience, or a master's degree plus three years of relevant experience. Therefore, sufficient professional experience may substitute for a higher educational degree, making it not an absolute requirement for the job.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description specifies requirements that could be barriers to applicants without a college or university degree. The requirements mention that applicants must possess either:

1. Eight (8) years of professional experience in work involving various phases of social insurance, such as disability, unemployment, or workers compensation programs in a public or private agency, OR

2. Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and four (4) years of the mentioned professional experience, OR

3. Possession of a Master's degree in Business or Public Administration or a related area from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of the mentioned professional experience.

While the first option allows for substituting educational qualifications with extensive work experience, the requirement of eight years of specific professional experience itself could be a significant barrier for applicants without a degree. Additionally, the equivalency provided for educational credentials further emphasizes the value placed on formal education, potentially discouraging those who do not have a degree or extensive work experience in the field.

name: Program Specialist 3

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

Possession of a master's degree from an accredited college or university in a Social/Human services specialty area, Public or Business Administration, Child Advocacy and Policy, or Child Advocacy and Policy with a concentration in Public Child Welfare; and two (2) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience in planning, monitoring, coordinating, implementing, modifying and/or evaluating a social or human services program

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The requirements specify that applicants must meet one of the following: seven years of professional experience in the relevant field; a bachelor's degree and three years of experience; or a master's degree in a related specialty and two years of experience. This indicates that extensive professional experience can substitute for a higher education degree, allowing individuals without a degree to qualify if they have sufficient relevant work experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description does not explicitly state barriers to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree. However, it suggests barriers through the following requirement: 

- Candidates must meet one of the following conditions: 
  1. Seven years of professional experience in relevant fields.
  2. A bachelor's degree and three years of relevant experience.
  3. A master's degree and two years of relevant experience.

The requirement implies that an applicant without a degree must have extensive professional experience to qualify, potentially making it difficult for those without higher education credentials to be considered.

name: Principal Drafting Technician
text:
Job Specification 14034 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 14034 

PRINCIPAL DRAFTING TECHNICIAN

  

DEFINITION


       Under the direction of an Engineer or other supevisor in a state
  department or agency, supervises the activities of a small drafting
  unit and personally performs the more difficult and complex drafting
  assignments; does related work as required.

  
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


       Organizes assigned supervisory drafting work, analyzes drafting
  assignments and problems and develops effective work methods.

       Supervises, assigns and instructs Drafting Technicians in the
  performance of their work.

       Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has
  responsibility for employee evaluations and for effectively
  recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or
  disciplinning of employees.

       Takes the lead in the preparation of drawings, plans, maps,
  alignments, tracing, charts and graphs of varying complexity.

       Supervises and when needed makes the field trips necessary to
  obtain needed data.

       Supervises and performs the more complex mathematical computations
  and checks those made by the drafting staff.

       Reviews drawings submitted by outside architects and/or engineers.

       Assists in the preparation of work plans and the formulation of
  operating procedures to implement and facilitate the work of the
  program or unit.

       Reviews shop drawings submitted by contractors.

       Prepares estimates of time and special materials for all work
  requests.

       Supervises the lettering of maps, charts, diagrams and other
  visual presentations of data.

       Supervises the making of paper tracings of maps in reduced scale,
  the assembling of certified copies of contracts, charts, maps and other
  materials, the plotting of field data, and the making of the required
  mathematical computations and calculations.

       Supervises the requisitioning, storing, issuing, recording and
  proper use and maintenance of unit drafting equipment, materials, tools
  and supplies.

       Informs supervisor of all outstanding and anticipated work details
  and jointly establishes work priorities.

       Prepares factual reports containing findings, conclusions and
  recommendations.

       Supervises the establishment and maintenance of essential records
  and files.

       May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
  and/or manual recording and information systems used by this agency,
  office or related units.

  REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

           Completion of technical high school or vocational courses in
  mechanical drawing, trigonometry and geometry.

       EXPERIENCE:

           Three (3) years of experience in drafting work, such as the
  preparation of drawings, tracings and maps.

           LICENSE:

               Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license
  valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than
  employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the
  position.

  KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

           Knowledge of the problems and techniques involved in the
  plotting and tracing of maps and diagrams and other drawings and in
  indicating thereon varied types of data.

           Knowledge of the accurate presentation of data in visual form
  including charts, maps, graphs, sketches, drawings and plans.

           Knowledge of the methods, procedures, techniques, tools,
  equipment and materials used in the preparation, reducing and enlarging
  of maps and other drawings and the pantographing of paper tracings.

           Knowledge of the proper use, adjustment, care and maintenance
  of drafting equipment, tools, materials and supplies.

           Ability to organize assigned supervisory drafting and other
  related work and develop effective work methods.

           Ability to understand, remember and carry out oral and written
  directions.

           Ability to prepare and supervise the preparation of accurate,
  neat and complete maps, drawings, diagrams, charts and plans.

           Ability to plot alignments from construction plans and to show
  needed information accurately in visual form.

           Ability to prepare pantographs and paper tracings from aerial
  photographs, to finish plans prepared by designers, and to ink titles
  on maps, plans and other drawings.

           Ability to letter quickly and neatly both free hand and with
  lettering templates.

           Ability to assign and instruct Drafting Technicians and Senior
  Drafting Technicians, and supervise the performance of their work.

           Ability to requisition, store, safeguard, record and supervise
  the proper use of drafting equipment, materials, tools and supplies.

           Ability to prepare factual reports.

           Ability to supervise the establishment and maintenance of
  essential records and files.

           Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or
  manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
  related units.

           Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
  English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American
  Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
  communication.

           Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as
  long as they can perform the essential functions of the job after
  reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If the
  accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue
  hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

  CODES:  R16-14034                    DDC                      03/29/94
          R18-14028

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Completion of technical high school or vocational courses in mechanical drawing, trigonometry and geometry.

alternativeQualifications: experience in drafting work
mechanical drawing
trigonometry and geometry coursework

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Principal Drafting Technician job, as the specified educational requirement is the completion of technical high school or vocational courses in mechanical drawing, trigonometry, and geometry. Additionally, the position requires three years of experience in drafting work, rather than a higher education degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly require a college or university degree. The education requirement specifies the completion of technical high school or vocational courses in mechanical drawing, trigonometry, and geometry. Therefore, there is no stated or suggested barrier to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree.

name: Practical Nurse
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 
 PRACTICAL NURSE
                         ALL JURISDICTIONS
 

 DEFINITION

 Under direction of a Registered Professional Nurse in a health care
 facility, performs the duties required to care for clients; carries
 out medical orders prescribed by a licensed physician that require an
 understanding of elementary nursing, but not the professional service
 outlined in the definition of professional nursing; does related work
 as required.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only. A particular position using this title may not perform
 all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties
 performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Assists in the physical examination of clients; takes and records
 temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure, and collects
 specimens for laboratory analyses.

 Examines client's eyes, ears, teeth, and bodies regularly to determine
 whether proper hygiene is carried out by nonprofessional resident care
 personnel.

 Administers first aid to clients in instances of sudden illness or
 accident until Registered Nurse or a physician arrives.

 Charts client care and treatment measures on the appropriate forms.

 Administers treatments under physician's orders.

 Assists with the set up of equipment used for oxygen therapy.

 Assists a Registered Professional Nurse in preoperative and post-
 operative care and specialized psychiatric treatment and treatments
 associated with developmentally disabled clients.

 Assists in the use of Foley catheters, colostomy irrigations and
 douches, tube feedings, and application of binders and bandages.

 Assists clients with braces and prosthetic devices.

 Performs prescribed isolation techniques.

 Dispenses medication as indicated; measures and administers liquid
 medication by mouth provided that no calculations or fractional doses
 are required; administers pills, capsules, and powders by mouth.

 Prepares and administers medication, including insulin, by
 subcutaneous hypodermic and intramuscular injections.

 Applies external medications to clients such as salves, ointments, and
 powders as specifically directed by a superior.

 Evaluates, on a continuing basis, the therapeutic value or the side
 effects of medications on clients.

 Accurately records individual dosages of medication administered.

 Observes clients closely for reaction to drugs, treatment, any other
 unusual conditions such as physical and/or emotional problems, and
 reports adverse reactions or problems to immediate supervisor.

 When instructed, administers prescribed medications orally and
 observes clients to ensure that they take their medication.

 Accounts for narcotics, barbiturates, and other accountable drugs
 before and after each shift.

 Counsels clients concerning their medications by utilizing medication
 fact sheets.

 May perform routine assigned nursing procedures, such as bathing,
 dressing and feeding clients; making beds and helps clients into and
 out of bed.

 Obtains client temperature, blood pressure, pulse, respiration, height
 and weight, and records results on client chart.

 Reports changes in temperature, pulse, respiration, and other client
 conditions to a Registered Professional Nurse or a physician.

 Collects urine, sputum, and other specimens from clients and labels
 containers to forward for laboratory analysis.

 Gathers information for the preparation of inventory records, such as
 amounts of drugs, medical and other supplies.

 Positions clients according to prescribed practices and the nursing
 care plan, and assists clients with simple exercises.

 Notifies the physician or supervisor as to any new condition of the
 client requiring medical attention.

 Requisitions, maintains, and accounts for medical supplies, tools, and
 equipment which must be kept ready for use within the treatment room
 of a resident living unit.

 Acts as a liaison between nonprofessional resident care personnel and
 medical and professional nursing staff regarding medication changes
 and clients symptoms or behavior changes.

 May instruct nonprofessional resident care personnel on their
 medically related job duties and follows up on their performance
 periodically.

 Assists with the admission, discharge, and transfer of clients.

 Interprets visitation rules and regulations to other staff, residents,
 members of clients' families, and visitors.

 Maintains accurate medical records within the scope of practice for a
 LPN.

 Contributes as a member of the health care team in the determination
 of treatment goals and participates and involves client in goal
 planning sessions.

 May teach client education classes in areas of physical health care,
 good grooming and hygiene, and personal appearance.

 Assists Registered Professional Nurse in carrying out other delegated
 work.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the agency,
 office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

           LICENSE:

      Possession of a valid registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse
 in New Jersey. Persons who possess the registration by waiver must
 have satisfactorily completed an approved refresher program.

      Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in
 New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
 mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the
 position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of practical nursing skills and techniques and their
 application to nursing care and treatment.

 Knowledge of first aid methods and techniques.

 Knowledge of immunization and TB testing methods, and other medical
 and laboratory procedures within the scope of practical nursing.

 Knowledge of the problems involved in providing care for the mentally
 ill, developmentally disabled, drug dependent, and medical, surgical,
 and/or geriatric clients.

 Knowledge of anatomy and normal healthy functioning of the human body.

 Knowledge of medications and their side effects; and the use of
 medication fact sheets.

 Knowledge of the symptoms, behavior changes, or other indications of
 the positive and/or negative effects of medication on clients and the
 methods used to observe these indications.

 Knowledge of the physical, mental, and emotional needs of the mentally
 ill, developmentally disabled, drug dependent, and geriatric
 residents/clients and of the methods to provide for their needs.

 Knowledge of therapeutic interventions such as remotivation
 techniques, activity of daily living programs, and reality
 orientation.

 Ability to read and interpret laws, rules and regulations and apply
 them to specific situations.

 Ability to organize assigned practical nursing work and develop
 appropriate work methods.

 Ability to assist, counsel, and instruct clients in areas relating to
 personal care and hygiene.

 Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships
 with physicians, Registered Professional Nurses, nonprofessional
 resident care staff, clients, and others associated with the facility.

 Ability to communicate client-related information between physicians
 or professional nursing staff and nonprofessional resident care
 personnel.

 Ability to assign and instruct Human Services Assistants, Cottage
 Training Technicians, Human Services Technicians, or other staff and
 verbally evaluate the performance of their work.

 Ability to perform all types of practical nursing work under the
 supervision of a Registered Professional Nurse.

 Ability to carry out preoperative and postoperative procedures.

 Ability to maintain accurate medical records.

 Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
 related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English
 sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign
 Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable form of
 communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
 they can perform the essential functions of the job after reasonable
 accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the accommodation
 cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship,
 such persons may not be eligible.

   This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote03844SN4015N/AH16-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions.MCK   06/28/2003

alternativeQualifications: Possession of a valid registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in New Jersey
Possession of a driver's license if necessary for the job

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree beyond a Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) license is not absolutely required for this job. The job specification clearly states that the primary requirement is the possession of a valid registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in New Jersey, implying that the necessary skills and knowledge for this role are acquired through LPN-specific education and training rather than a higher educational degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession of a valid registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in New Jersey.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly state any educational barriers related to a college or university degree. The primary requirement is possession of a valid registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in New Jersey. There is no mention of needing a college or university degree, thus there are no barriers in this regard.

name: Principal Community Program Specialist

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

Possession of a master's degree in the field of Social Work, Public or Business Administration, Education, Psychology, Nursing, or other related areas; and two (2) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience in program delivery experience in providing education, habilitative, or social services in programs for people with developmental disabilities.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job as it offers multiple pathways to meeting the qualifications. The job can be obtained through seven years of relevant professional experience without a degree. Alternatively, a bachelor's or master's degree combined with fewer years of professional experience can also qualify an applicant. This flexibility indicates that a degree is not an absolute requirement if the candidate has sufficient relevant experience in the field.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in NJ only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description presents a potential barrier for applicants without a college or university degree due to its requirements under the "REQUIREMENTS" section. It specifies that applicants must meet one of the following options: 

1. Seven years of professional experience in program delivery for people with developmental disabilities.
2. Possession of a bachelor's degree and three years of the specified professional experience.
3. Possession of a master's degree in specific related fields and two years of the specified professional experience.

The equivalency of thirty semester hour credits to one year of relevant experience may still pose a challenge for those without any formal college education to meet the experience requirement, depending on their work history.

name: Printing Operations Technician 4
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


PRINTING OPERATIONS TECHNICIAN

   JOB CATEGORY SUMMARY

   A position in this category typically analyzes printing requests;
   determines appropriate printing techniques; estimates the quantity
   of time, costs, materials or personnel for assignments; consults with
   vendors or contractors; provides technical advice to staff; sets up,
   operates, and adjusts copier machines.

   UNIQUE AND DISTINGUISHING TASKS OR CLASSIFICATION FACTORS

       NOTE: Unique and distinguishing tasks are shown only 
       for illustrative purposes and do not solely determine the level of a
       position within a job category.  Unique tasks pertain only to the
       job level identified; distinguishing tasks are performed with
       greater frequency or are of greater importance to the overall job
       level.

   Level 1

   A position at this level typically performs entry level tasks for the
   job category.

   Level 2

   A position at this level typically receives less direct supervision
   than positions at Level 1 and are permitted to exercise some
   independent judgment in carrying out their assignments.

   Level 3

   A position at this level typically plans, organizes and assigns the
   work of the organizational unit and evaluates employee performance and
   conduct, enabling the effective recommendation of the hiring, firing,
   promoting, and disciplining of subordinates.

   Level 4

   A position at this level typically plans, organizes and assigns the
   work of the organizational unit and evaluates the performance and
   conduct of first line supervisors, enabling the effective
   recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of
   subordinates.  Unique Tasks: Writes requests for proposals (RFPs)

   TASKS COMMON TO ALL LEVELS

       NOTE: The above Job Category Summary and following 
       examples of work are for illustrative purposes only.  Any one position may 
       not include all of the tasks listed, nor do the examples cover all of
       the duties which may be performed.

   Analyzes incoming print requests
   Reviews samples, such as blue-line, press, binding, typesetting or
   final

   Selects paper stock

   Determines appropriate printing techniques

   Recommends styles of printed materials

   Estimates necessary quantity of time, costs, materials or personnel for
   the accomplishment of assignments or goals

   Verifies that quantity and type of item ordered matches invoice

   Writes technical specifications for purchase of equipment, supplies and
   parts

   Examines documents for adherence to applicable laws and regulations

   Determines appropriate graphic arts techniques

   Writes technical, statistical or financial reports

   Determines when printing request should be sent to outside vendors

   Selects ink

   Adjusts stock levels for anticipated needs

   Verifies entered data against source documents

   Monitors the use of materials, equipment, parts or supplies

   Calculates rates, cost, fees, taxes or other amounts consistent with
   schedules, formulas or other established procedures

   Identifies problems with printing equipment

   Records the use of materials, equipment, parts or supplies

   Designs layouts of graphic or printed materials

   Obtains current price quotes for special purchases

   Informs individuals of procedures necessary for completion of forms or
   applications

   Provides technical advice to staff, peers or management

   Consults with vendors or contractors

   Interviews individuals for needed information

   Requests information from vendors on materials, equipment, parts or
   supplies

   Informs the responsible person or organization of difficulties,
   accomplishments, plans or goals

   Consults with outside agencies or individuals about information
   necessary for job assignments

   Operates copiers

   Adjusts copy machines for density and contrast

   Sets up copiers

   Corrects printing press problems such as tinting, scumming, streaks,
   slow drying or double images

   Manipulates (uses) various drafting equipment such as T-squares,
   compasses or triangles

   Operates cutting machines

   KNOWLEDGE. SKILLS AND ABILITIES

       COMMON TO ALL LEVELS

       Knowledge of printing techniques

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of copy preparation,
       composition and layout

       Knowledge of the types of paper stock

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing inks

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing equipment

       Knowledge of commercial printing plant operations

       Knowledge of procedures for operating cutting machines

       Knowledge of procedures for operating copiers

       Knowledge of record keeping procedures

       Knowledge of standard English grammar; for example, syntax,
       punctuation, verb agreement, or tense

       Knowledge of postal regulations regarding envelope and postcard
       size

       Knowledge of procedures for requisitioning materials, equipment,
       parts or supplies

       Knowledge of inventory control

       Knowledge of basic interviewing techniques

       Knowledge of layout procedures

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of graphic arts
       equipment

       Knowledge of bidding procedures

       Knowledge of principles and techniques of cost-benefit analysis

       Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide, using decimals,
       percentages and fractions

       Ability to establish goals and set priorities

       Ability to identify and resolve problems in the administration or
       coordination of programs, plans or projects

       Ability to make precise measurements

       Ability to determine whether products or services meet printing
       specifications

       Ability to correct printing press problems

       Ability to adjust copiers

       Ability to compare written or printed material for accuracy

       Ability to compare numerical material for accuracy

       Ability to perceive color differences

       Ability to collect data through questioning

       Ability to apply laws, rules or regulations to given situations

       Ability to summarize information in written form

       Ability to make appropriate inferences and deductions based on
       various types of source materials

       CHARACTERISTIC

       Level 3 and 4

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of supervision

       Ability to schedule and organize unit work activities and identify
       and resolve problems which arise

       UNIQUE AND DISTINGUISHING

       Unique

       Level 4

       Knowledge of warehousing procedures

       Distinguishing

       Level 4

       Knowledge of reimbursement programs and procedures

       Knowledge of principles and procedures of contract negotiation

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of program monitoring

       Knowledge of procedures for cleaning copiers

       Knowledge of public information principles and techniques

   MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

       REQUIRED FOR ALL LEVELS

       Completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training
       program in graphic and printing communications with course work
       including printing techniques, copy preparation, composition and
       layout, and graphic art.

       EXPERIENCE:

       Level 1

       Two (2) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.

       Level 2

       Three (3) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.

       Level 3

       Five (5) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.  
      
       Level 4

       Seven (7) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.  Three (3)
       years of the required experience shall have been in a supervisory
       capacity.

       SUBSTITUTION

       Level 1 and 2 - Applicants who do not possess the required
       education may substitute two (2) years of additional nonsupervisory
       experience.

       Level 3 and 4 - Applicants who do not possess the required
       education may substitute three (3) years of additional
       nonsupervisory experience.

   FOR MORE INFORMATION REGARDING JOB CATEGORIES, please 
   refer to the Job Specification Information Sheet available at the New Jersey 
   Department of Personnel or your agency's personnel office.

   Occupational Group:  Printing

   Occupational Family:  Printing Operations

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: For the position of Printing Operations Technician, a formal higher educational degree is not absolutely required. The job specification indicates that completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in graphic and printing communications is sufficient, with coursework in relevant areas such as printing techniques, copy preparation, composition and layout, and graphic art. Additionally, there are substitution clauses for experience in place of education, which allows applicants with relevant work experience to qualify for the position. Therefore, while specialized training is necessary, a higher educational degree is not mandatory for this job.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description lists "Completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in graphic and printing communications" as an educational requirement for all levels. While it does not explicitly require a college or university degree, it specifies the necessity for vocational or technical training, which could potentially be a barrier for those who do not have access to or have not completed such specialized education. There is a substitution option that allows additional experience in place of the required education, but it demands extra years of nonsupervisory experience. This could still pose a challenge for individuals lacking both the specialized training and the necessary experience.

name: Principal Clerk Stenographer
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


PRINCIPAL CLERK STENOGRAPHER

DEFINITION:

Under the general supervision of a supervisory official, performs complex 
stenographic and other related clerical work requiring knowledge and 
independent interpretation of department laws, regulations, policies, and 
procedures as well as the frequent exercise of independent judgment; may 
take the lead over the work of a clerical unit; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be 
listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Organizes assigned stenographic and other related clerical work; analyzes 
the problems which arise therein, and develops effective work methods.

Reviews, checks, and certifies reports, applications, forms, and other 
documents for correctness where difficult determinations are concerned.

May be required to take the lead over other clerical staff.

Takes lengthy and rapid dictation of a difficult, complex, and/or technical 
nature and transcribes the notes.

Transcribes dictation which is difficult to arrange and tabulate, including 
large and complex statistical tables.

Types technical, scientific, financial, statistical, and other statements and 
reports, correspondence, memoranda, payrolls, opinions, orders, bills, 
warrants, contracts, forms, specifications, case records, manuscripts, legal 
documents, decisions, and briefs from varied types of copy and/or recording 
equipment.

Prepares designated correspondence which may not be reviewed by 
a supervisor in accordance with established department regulations.

Processes requests for information in accordance with department policies.

Interviews callers at the office and schedules appointments.

Prepares the agenda of meetings; takes minutes of meetings, conferences, 
and hearings and transcribes them in authoritative form.

Briefs reports.

Assists in collecting material and editing speeches, reports, and articles.

Maintains essential records, reports, and files.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or 
related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Two (2) years of experience in taking and transcribing dictation. 

NOTE:  Successful completion of a clerical training program with a minimum 
of 700 classroom training hours or 30 semester hour credits in secretarial 
science from an accredited college or university may be substituted for 
one (1) year of experience as indicated above. Coursework must include 
keyboarding skills, methods and procedures; other courses may include, but 
not be limited to, office procedures, word processing, and business English.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of the problems encountered in organizing assigned clerical 
work and in developing effective work methods.

Knowledge of modern office and clerical methods, practices, routines, and 
equipment.

Knowledge of stenography, or stenotype, and of keyboarding.

Knowledge of approved English usage, correct spelling, sentence structure, 
and paragraphing.

Ability to take the lead, assign, and instruct other office/clerical staff.

Ability to comprehend and interpret department regulations and policies 
and apply them to specific situations in accordance with established procedures.

Ability to organize assigned stenographic and other related clerical work and 
develop effective work methods.

Ability to take difficult, complex, technical, and rapid dictation and to transcribe 
material which is difficult to arrange and tabulate.

Ability to do typing work from varied types of copy and/or recording equipment 
accurately, neatly, quickly, and in accordance with the requirements of the 
department.

Ability to prepare correspondence.

Ability to process requests for information in accordance with established 
procedures.

Ability to work effectively with associates, supervisory officials, and with those 
persons interested in or concerned with the work of the office.

Ability to take minutes of meetings, conferences, and hearings and transcribe 
them in authoritative form.

Ability to prepare reports.

Ability to maintain the essential records, reports, and files.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related 
units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communication English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign Language 
or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform 
the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. 
If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer 
undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote23824SC3514N/AA13-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 6/3/2023

alternativeQualifications: Two (2) years of experience in taking and transcribing dictation

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description for a Principal Clerk Stenographer in the State of New Jersey does not absolutely require a higher educational degree. The requirements specify two years of experience in taking and transcribing dictation. It mentions that completion of a clerical training program with a minimum of 700 classroom hours or 30 semester credits in secretarial science can substitute for one year of experience. The focus is on experience and competence, rather than a formal degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not list a college or university degree as a requirement for the position. Instead, it mentions that successful completion of a clerical training program or specific coursework in secretarial science from an accredited college or university may be substituted for one year of required experience. This implies that having specific vocational training or coursework could be a barrier for those without any college or university education, as they would need to have the requisite experience in taking and transcribing dictation without the benefit of substituting it with college coursework. However, no explicit degree requirement creates a firm barrier.

name: Principal Parole Counselor State Parole Board
text:
Job Specification 61751 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 61751 

PRINCIPAL PAROLE COUNSELOR STATE PAROLE BOARD

 

DEFINITION


 Under direction of a Hearing Officer 1, State Parole Board or other
 supervisory officer, supervises Parole Counselors and Senior Parole
 Counselors; reviews and maintains inmate case files, calculates parole
 eligibility dates and schedules parole hearings for State inmates
 housed in State and County correctional facilities; does other related
 duties.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only. A particular position using this title may not perform
 all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties
 performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Supervises and monitors Senior Parole Counselor and Parole Counselor
 caseloads at each institution to ensure compliance with State and
 Agency procedures, including the accurate and timely processing of
 cases.

 Supervises work operations and/or functional programs, and has
 responsibility for employee evaluations and for effectively
 recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting, and/or
 disciplining of employees.

 Performs complex mathematical calculations to determine parole
 eligibility dates for an assigned caseload of inmates; provides
 inmates their actual parole eligibility dates within 90 days of their
 admission to the State Prison.

 Reviews weekly computer-generated lists to determine which inmates are
 eligible for parole consideration and submits the names of eligible
 persons for publication to each County Prosecutor's office for review.

 Coordinates the Initial Parole Hearing process; certifies pre- parole
 packages for accuracy and completeness, schedules hearings and
 provides supportive services to the Hearing Officer.

 Reviews case material with the Hearing Officer I to prepare for Board
 Panel Hearings.

 Provides assistance to the Board Panel prior to and during panel
 hearings; prepares case files and other relevant materials, verifies
 that all pre-hearing processes have been completed, ensures that
 recording equipment is operational and, that the panel hearing
 proceeds according to State and Agency rules and regulations.

 Prepares cases for review by the Institutional Release Committee.

 Provides liaison between the State Parole Board and the New Jersey
 Department of Corrections.

 Conducts interviews at various stages of the parole process to provide
 information to inmates who may be eligible for parole; provides advice
 and assistance to inmates concerning parole eligibility and parole
 plans.

 Reviews and responds to inmate correspondence regarding the parole
 process.

 Maintains computer records and paper files.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the agency,
 office or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EDUCATION:

      Graduation from an accredited college or university with a
      Bachelor's degree.

      EXPERIENCE:

      Three (3) years of experience in the field of criminal
      justice, social work or related areas.

      NOTE: Applicants who do not possess the required education may
 substitute additional experience as indicated on a year-for- year
 basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits being equal to one (1)
 year of experience.

      NOTE: A Master's degree in Penology, Sociology, Criminal Justice,
 or Social Work, may be substituted for one (1) year of the indicated
 experience.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid
 in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
 mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the
 position.

 KNOWLEDGES AND ABILITIES

 Knowledge of the methods used to gather and analyze information.

 Knowledge of interview techniques.

 Knowledge of correction and parole methods and practices.

 Ability to perform complex mathematical calculations.

 Ability to interpret laws, rules and regulations and procedures and
 apply them to specific situations.

 Ability to review, analyze and interpret material or complex parole
 cases for preparation of reports and evaluations.

 Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships
 with those interested or involved in the work of the program.

 Ability to evaluate complex individual cases and identify problem
 areas.

 Ability to communicate with inmate populations.

 Ability to provide assignments and instruction to Parole Counselors,
 Senior Parole Counselors and support staff and to supervise the
 performance of their work.

 Ability to prepare correspondence and reports.

 Ability to establish and maintain essential records and files.

 Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office or
 related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English
 sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign
 Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
 communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
 they can perform the essential functions of the job after reasonable
 accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the accommodation
 cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship,
 such persons may not be eligible.

 CODE: 24/R24l - 61751           MCK            08/09/03

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree.
A Master's degree in Penology, Sociology, Criminal Justice, or Social Work, may be substituted for one (1) year of the indicated experience.

alternativeQualifications: additional experience as indicated on a year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits being equal to one (1) year of experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job description specifies that a Bachelor's degree is required, making a degree mandatory. However, it provides an alternative qualification path by stating that additional relevant experience can substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis, allowing individuals without a degree to qualify if they have sufficient experience. Therefore, both the degree is mandatory, but alternative qualifications are available.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: Based on the job description for the Principal Parole Counselor at the State Parole Board, a higher educational degree is not absolutely required, as candidates can substitute additional experience in criminal justice, social work, or related areas for the educational requirement. Specifically, an applicant who does not possess a Bachelor's degree can fulfill the requirement through equivalent experience on a year-for-year basis, with 30 semester hour credits equating to one year of experience. However, having a Bachelor's degree or a Master's degree in relevant fields could be beneficial, offering a structured educational background and potentially advantageous for competitive candidacy, but it is not mandatory if the candidate has sufficient relevant experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that the position requires graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree. However, there is a note that applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional experience on a year-for-year basis, with thirty semester hour credits being equal to one year of experience. This flexibility suggests that while a degree is initially mentioned as a requirement, there is an alternative pathway that considers professional experience in lieu of a formal degree. This could still pose a barrier for those who do not have the requisite amount of experience to substitute for the education requirement.

name: Printing Machine Operator 4
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


PRINTING MACHINE OPERATOR 4

DEFINITION:

Under the direction of a supervisory official in a State department, agency, 
institution, or in a local jurisdiction, supervises the work of the unit and 
performs other duties including the setup, operation, repair, and cleaning 
of various printing operation equipment such as offset presses, cutting 
machines, and digital printers (copiers); supervises the determination of 
appropriate printing material, printing techniques, and printing styles; 
reviews finished items; supervises staff and work activities; prepares and 
signs official performance evaluations for staff; does other related duties 
as required. 

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this 
job specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be 
listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has 
responsibility for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, 
demoting, and/or disciplining of employees.

Supervises the setup, operation, and adjustment of offset presses, plate 
makers, cutting machines, folding machines, stapling machines, collators, 
padding units, paper drills, electric punching machines, and/or binding 
machines.

Supervises the correction of printing press problems such as tinting, 
scudding, streaks, slow drying, and/or double images.

Mixes chemicals and/or other solutions.

Supervises the programing of digital printers (copiers), cutters, folders, 
numbering machines, and other finishing equipment that utilize intelligent 
interfaces.

Supervises the scanning of hard copy originals and conversion to usable 
digital formats.

Produces metal and polyester plates.

Supervises the correction of mechanical binding products such as folding, 
stapling, drilling, cutting, stitching, and/or padding.

Assembles (binds) books, booklets, and/or other printed materials.

Creates measured rule-outs assuring accuracy for trimming, folding, 
perforation, numbering and other finishing functions required for 
completion of final product.

Supervises the arrangement of materials, equipment, parts, and supplies 
for inventory control.

Modifies books and/or other printed materials.

Analyzes the more complex incoming print requests.

Selects paper stock and ink.

Identifies the more complex problems with printing equipment, graphics 
equipment, and/or binding equipment.

Determines appropriate printing techniques.

Establishes unit work procedures and priorities.

Verifies that quantity and type of item ordered matches invoice.

Proofreads material for accuracy.

Supervises the requisition of materials, equipment, parts, and/or supplies.

Adjusts stock levels for anticipated needs.

Recommends styles of printed materials.

Reviews samples, such as blue-line, press, binding, typesetting, and/or 
final samples.

Supervises the maintenance of files and records.

Computes numerical data by addition, subtraction, division, and 
multiplication.

Estimates necessary quantity of time, costs, materials, and personnel 
for the accomplishment of assignments or goals.

Designs layouts of graphic and/or printed materials, and produces 
Computer to Plate (CTP) film or plates for the operation of offset and 
digital printing equipment.

Determines appropriate graphic arts techniques.

Provides complex technical advice and information to staff, peers, and/or 
management.

Consults with staff members for identification of staffing or operational 
needs.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, 
or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Possession of a high school diploma or a GED.

EXPERIENCE:

Four (4) years of experience in the operation of printing press equipment 
and the development of printing techniques and styles. 

LICENSE:
 
Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of the principles and techniques of supervision.

Knowledge of the procedures for setting up, operating, adjusting, and 
cleaning offset presses, plate makers, folding machines, cutting machines, 
collators, stapling machines, digital printers (copiers), electric punching 
machines, binding machines, paper drills, and padding units.

Knowledge of printing techniques.

Knowledge of basic and advanced file formats used for digital printing.

Knowledge of the types of paper stock.

Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing equipment, graphic 
arts equipment, and printing ink.

Knowledge of the chemicals and solutions used in printing.

Knowledge of the procedures for producing metal and polyester plates.

Knowledge of the principles and techniques of copy preparation, 
composition, and layout.

Knowledge of the techniques for binding books, booklets, and other 
printed materials.

Knowledge of layout procedures.

Knowledge of filing and record keeping procedures.

Knowledge of the procedures for requisitioning materials, equipment, 
parts, and supplies.

Knowledge of established safety procedures and guidelines.

Knowledge of postal regulations regarding envelope and postcard size.

Knowledge of inventory control.

Knowledge of filing procedures.

Knowledge of the techniques of interpersonal communication.

Knowledge of current printing capabilities and their effective implementation 
to meet job requirements.

Ability to supervise assigned staff and plan, organize, and implement 
projects within the unit.

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide whole numbers, decimals, 
percentages, and fractions.

Ability to follow oral and written orders, directions, and plans.

Ability to perceive color differences.

Ability to correct printing press problems.

Ability to identify and correct problems with printing, binding, and 
graphic equipment.

Ability to make precise measurements.

Ability to determine whether products or services meet printing 
specifications.

Ability to communicate orally.

Ability to read with comprehension.

Ability to check numerical and printed material for accuracy.

Ability to convey information in an organized written format.

Ability to keep accurate records.

Ability to set up, operate, adjust, and clean offset presses, plate makers, 
folding machines, cutting machines, collators, stapling machines, copiers, 
electric punching machines, binding machines, paper drills, and padding 
units.

Ability to establish goals and set priorities.

Ability to convert pica and point to inches.

Ability to identify and resolve problems which arise.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related 
units.
 
Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform duties of this position.  American Sign Language 
or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication.
 
Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform 
essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.   
If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer 
undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

CODE:  22535   10/22/2022

The focus is on practical experience and specific knowledge related to the operation and supervision of printing equipment, rather than formal higher education.

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and two (2) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.
Possession of a master's degree; and one (1) year of the above-mentioned professional experience.
