This may serve as a barrier to those who have extensive relevant experience but do not have a formal degree because the structure equates 30 semester hour credits to one year of experience, inherently valuing formal education potentially equivalent to experience gained directly in the field.

name: Employment Counselor

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by six (6) semester hour credits in Non-introductory Sociology or Psychology or other field of study directly related to vocational counseling or workforce and career development, and nine (9) semester hour credits in the Behavioral Sciences, Statistics, or Non-Introductory Labor Market Information courses

Possession of a Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Psychology, Education, Social Work, Personnel Administration, Counseling, Student Personnel Services, or related fields, which shall have included a minimum of fifteen (15) semester hour credits outlined above

alternativeQualifications: Five (5) years of professional experience in career guidance or employment counseling, including or supplemented by specific credit requirements.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description outlines specific educational and experiential requirements that can be met through a combination of professional experience, bachelor's degree, or master's degree in related fields. This suggests that while a higher educational degree is not absolutely mandated, having a relevant degree or coursework can be a significant advantage. It appears that practical experience in career guidance or employment counseling coupled with relevant education can substitute for the requirement of a higher degree, indicating flexibility in how candidates can qualify for the position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description outlines a requirement where applicants must meet specific educational qualifications or a combination of experience and education. To qualify without a college or university degree, applicants need five years of relevant professional experience combined with specific semester-hour credits in certain disciplines such as Non-introductory Sociology, Psychology, Behavioral Sciences, Statistics, or Labor Market Information courses. This educational credit requirement may be a barrier to applicants who do not have a college or university degree and do not have these specific credits. Additionally, courses in Public Safety, Criminal Justice, Public Safety Administration, and Philosophy do not count toward the required credits, further limiting the options for meeting the educational criteria.

name: Emergency Response Specialist 2
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


EMERGENCY RESPONSE SPECIALIST  2

DEFINITION

Under the limited supervision of an Emergency Response Specialist 3, 
or other higher level supervisory official in the Emergency Management 
Program, Department of Environmental Protection, responds to 
emergencies for the purpose of assessing environmental impacts 
including hazardous substances, materials and chemical, biological, 
radiological, nuclear, explosive (CBRNE), acts of terrorism and acts of 
nature (hurricanes, snow, floods, droughts, etc.) as well as functioning as 
departmental On-Scene Coordinator and National Incident Management 
System (NIMS) Incident Command Representative during activation of the 
State Emergency Operations Center with other responding agencies; 
coordinates with other Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear, 
Explosive (CBRNE) teams as assigned; functions as the Departmental 
Incident Command representative within a general staff section; works 
independently to issue complete and comprehensive incident reports; 
provides emergency services for people, water, land, and structures 
within the State; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The following examples of work are for illustrative purposes 
only. A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed 
in this job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may 
not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Either working alone or as a member of a team, responds to emergencies 
on a 24 hour, 7 day a week basis.

Responsible for preparing timely and technically accurate reports 
regarding responses to discharges and/or releases of hazardous 
substances, (and) hazardous materials, chemical, biological or 
nuclear/radiological releases, and acts of nature (snow, floods, 
droughts, etc.) 

Handles the preparation of investigative and incident reports regarding 
environmental emergencies to assure compliance with State environmental 
laws and regulations.

Functions as the Department representative during activation of the 
State Emergency Operations Center and facilitates agency actions 
during emergencies of any type. Works under the limited supervision 
of the DEP's Emergency Response Coordinator.

Performs special projects related to the bureau's goals, missions 
and need.

Utilizes field monitoring equipment to assess environmental conditions 
for potential health and safety hazards, often in a hazardous environment.

Prepares evidence for use in court actions and hearings associated 
with the enforcement of federal, state and local environmental regulations.

During emergency situations, is responsible for maintaining and 
updating management as per established procedures and DEP's 
Centralized Communications Center -Trenton Dispatch as necessary.

Trained in the use of the National Incident Management System 
(NIMS) during emergencies.

Required to work under varying conditions.

Maintains a calm attitude during emergencies for the purpose of 
ensuring response action is taken without undue delay.

Prepares correspondence in the course of official duties.

Maintains essential records and files.

Will be required to learn and utilize various types of electronic 
and/or manual recording and information systems used by the 
agency, office or related State Agencies.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's 
degree in one of the physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical 
sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, 
or engineering.

NOTE:  Possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued 
by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land 
Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in engineering.

EXPERIENCE

Two (2) years of professional and/or technical experience involving 
emergency response field activities associated with environmental 
or atmospheric conditions which pose potential public health hazards 
and/or significant adverse environmental effects, especially those 
involving potentially acute hazards.

NOTE:  A Master's degree in a physical science, biological science, 
chemical science, environmental science, environmental studies, 
engineering, or public health may be substituted for one (1) year 
of experience.

LICENSE

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid 
in New Jersey.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Appointees will be required to carry a communication device and 
must be able to respond to emergencies on a 24 hour, 7 day a 
week basis.

Appointee must be capable of using assigned equipment and 
performing the essential functions of the position.

Appointees will be required to establish residence in a geographic 
region assigned area within six (6) months of permanent appointment 
as defined by the Element.

Appointees will be required to have completed the following Incident 
Command System (ICS) courses or equivalent Federal Emergency 
Management Agency (FEMA) approved courses: 

               ICS 100 ï¿½ Introduction to ICS
               ICS 200 ï¿½ ICS for Single Resources and Initial Action Incidents
               ICS 300 ï¿½ Intermediate ICS for Expanding Incidents
               ICS 400 ï¿½ Advanced ICS
               IS 700 ï¿½ National Incident Management System (NIMS), An Introduction
               IS 800 ï¿½ National Response Framework (NRF), An Introduction

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of the principles, techniques and methodologies utilized in 
emergency response field activities associated with environmental 
or atmospheric conditions which pose potential public health and/or 
environmental significance with particular emphasis on those involving 
potential acute hazards.

Knowledge of the relationship and coordination required at state, 
county and local levels as well as with other intra and interstate, 
and federal agencies concerned with or responsible for emergency 
response programs relating to the discharge and/or release of 
hazardous substances and hazardous materials and chemical, 
biological, nuclear/radiological releases.

Knowledge of the concepts and principles of environmental investigations 
and sampling techniques; and of the use and calibration of specific 
equipment and recording, measuring and testing devices used in 
monitoring and assessing environmental conditions during periods 
of emergency.

Knowledge of the use of a Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus 
and other personal safety equipment, and to direct its use.

Knowledge of the use, understanding and preparation of maps, 
charts and diagrams for incident responses, reports and courtroom 
exhibits.

Knowledge of and the ability to use the National Incident Management 
System and the ability to function as the department representative as 
either command or staff function as directed by Emergency Response 
Coordinator.

Knowledge of New Jersey and Federal laws and the rules, regulations, 
policies, procedures and standards of the Departmentï¿½s Emergency 
Management Element for all aspects of emergency response after a 
period of training.

Ability to acquire knowledge of the legal requirements and procedures 
for collecting samples and of their proper storage and transportation 
after a period of training.

Ability to read, interpret and apply the laws, rules and regulations 
relating to the environmental parameters of the State of New Jersey.

Ability to maintain a calm attitude during periods of stress and 
emergency for the purpose of ensuring response action is taken 
without undue delay.

Ability to prepare incident reports regarding environmental and/or 
atmospheric conditions which pose potential public health and/or 
environmental significance, especially those involving potential 
acute hazards.

Ability to follow established safety rules, precautions, policies and 
procedures in work assignments.

Ability to prepare clear, technically sound, accurate and informative 
reports containing findings, conclusions and recommendations.

Ability to communicate effectively. 

Ability to prepare clear, accurate and concise correspondence in 
the course of official duties.

Ability to maintain essential records and files.

Ability to learn and utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
office or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign 
Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms 
of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as  
long as they can perform essential functions of the job with 
or without reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation 
cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue  
hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote15863SC4E24N/AP25-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 3/5/2016

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, or engineering.

A Master's degree in a physical science, biological science, chemical science, environmental science, environmental studies, engineering, or public health may be substituted for one (1) year of experience.

alternativeQualifications: Possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job description for the Emergency Response Specialist 2 clearly states that a Bachelor's degree in specified science or engineering disciplines is required. Additionally, there are alternative qualifications such as holding a Professional Engineer's license, which can substitute for the Bachelor's degree in engineering. This illustrates that a degree or an alternative qualification is mandatory for the position, satisfying both conditions of DegreeRequirementStatus: the degree is mandatory, and alternative qualifications are acceptable.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is deemed necessary for the position of Emergency Response Specialist 2 as the job specification explicitly requires a Bachelor's degree in specific fields such as physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, or engineering. While a Professional Engineer's license can substitute for a Bachelor's degree in engineering, it underscores the need for specialized education in relevant disciplines. Moreover, the position involves complex responsibilities including emergency response, report preparation, and compliance with environmental laws, which require a solid foundation of knowledge and skills typically obtained through higher education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in engineering.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description presents several barriers to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree:

1. **Educational Requirement:** The position requires graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in specific fields such as physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, or engineering. This requirement alone poses a barrier for individuals who do not hold a college degree.

2. **Professional Engineer's License:** While there is an alternative path through the possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors as a substitute for a Bachelorâs degree in engineering, this also excludes those without a formal degree or professional licensing.

3. **Masterâs Degree Substitution for Experience:** An additional educational barrier exists in that a Master's degree in specified fields may substitute for one year of required experience, thereby favoring candidates with advanced degrees.

These specified requirements effectively prevent individuals without a college or university degree from being eligible for the position.

name: Chief Central Reprographics And Printing Control
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


   CHIEF, CENTRAL REPROGRAPHICS AND PRINTING CONTROL

   JOB CATEGORY SUMMARY

   A position in this category typically supervises the work of other
   employees; authorizes purchases of equipment, supplies or services;
   approves terms of negotiated contracts, contract agreements, contract
   modifications, or letters of agreement; examines documents for
   adherence to applicable laws and regulations; reviews bids for
   acceptance or rejection; monitors the efficiency and effectiveness of
   programs or services; consults with vendors and contractors; promotes
   the development of agency or statewide services.

   CHARACTERISTIC TASKS

       NOTE: The above Job Category Summary and following examples of work
       are for illustrative purposes only. Any one position may not
       include all of the tasks listed, nor do the examples cover all of
       the duties that may be performed.

   Plans, organizes, and assigns the work of the organizational unit and
   evaluates employee performance and conduct, enabling the effective
   recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of
   subordinates

   Authorizes purchase of equipment, supplies or services

   Examines documents for adherence to applicable laws and regulations

   Monitors the efficiency and effectiveness of programs or services

   Writes letters and technical, statistical, financial, or narrative
   reports

   Plans workshops, seminars, lectures, exhibits and demonstrations

   Develops program or agency guidelines

   Recommends policy on provision of services

   Approves terms of negotiated contracts, contract agreements, contract
   modifications, or letters of agreement

   Reviews bids for acceptance or rejection

   Interprets statistical information

   Determines when printing requests should be sent to outside vendors
   Informs the responsible person or organization of difficulties,
   accomplishments, plans or goals

   Consults with vendors or contractors

   Meets with groups at seminars, public meetings, or conventions as a
   representative of the agency

   Addresses policy-making committees; for example, division heads

   Promotes the development of statewide services

   CHARACTERISTIC KNOWLEDGE. SKILLS. AND ABILITIES

   Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing equipment

   Knowledge of bidding procedures

   Knowledge of principles and techniques of supervision

   Knowledge of principles of report writing

   Knowledge of employee performance evaluation procedures

   Ability to synthesize facts to reach logical conclusions

   Ability to apply laws, rules or regulations to given situations

   Ability to establish goals and set priorities

   Ability to identify and resolve problems in the administration or
   coordination of programs, plans or projects

   Ability to schedule and organize work activities for others

   MININIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

       Graduation from an accredited college with an associate's degree or
       the completion of 60 college credits.

       EXPERIENCE:

       Eight (8) years of experience in work involving the procurement of
       printing equipment, supplies or services, which will have included
       four (4) years of supervisory experience.

       SUBSTITUTION

       Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute
       two (2) years of additional nonsupervisory experience.

   FOR MORE INFORMATION REGARDING JOB CATEGORIES, please refer to the Job
   Specification Information Sheet available at the New Jersey Department
   of Personnel or your agency's personnel office.

   Occupational Group:  Printing

   Occupational Family: Printing Administration

     Level      Title Code    Title Reference      Effective: 7/24/93
       1          41497       65030201(C) NL 12       M-29
       1          61074       65040801(C) NL 12       &-29

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college with an associate's degree or the completion of 60 college credits.
Graduation from an accredited college with an associate's degree or the completion of 60 college credits.

alternativeQualifications: Two (2) years of additional nonsupervisory experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: This job requires graduation from an accredited college with an associate's degree or the completion of 60 college credits, but allows for substitution of two years of additional nonsupervisory experience for those who do not meet this educational requirement. This suggests that a higher educational degree is not absolutely required, as significant experience in the field can compensate for the lack of formal education beyond an associate's degree. Therefore, practical experience in the procurement of printing equipment, supplies, or services, particularly in a supervisory capacity, is valued as much as a formal educational degree.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description lists a minimum requirement of "Graduation from an accredited college with an associate's degree or the completion of 60 college credits." However, it also provides a substitution option: applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute two (2) years of additional nonsupervisory experience. This substitution option mitigates the barrier of not having a college degree, allowing those without formal higher education to qualify based on their work experience.

name: Principal Transportation Analyst

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience in the monitoring, evaluation, and maintenance of a regional traffic and/or transportation program or system with responsibility for the planning, development and implementation of emergency management measures

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The requirements state that applicants can fulfill the criteria either with seven years of relevant professional experience or with a bachelor's degree combined with three years of relevant professional experience. This indicates that extensive experience in the field may compensate for the absence of a formal degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description provides two pathways to meeting the qualification requirements: 

1. Seven (7) years of professional experience in the relevant field.
2. A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of the relevant professional experience.

The requirement suggests that those without a college or university degree can still be considered if they have the requisite amount of professional experience. Therefore, there does not appear to be a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree as there is an option for them to qualify based on experience alone.

name: Senior Biologist
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


SENIOR BIOLOGIST, MOSQUITO CONTROL
											
DEFINITION:

Under the general supervision of a higher-level Biologist or other supervisory 
officer in the Department of Environmental Protection, performs the technical, 
biological and ecological tasks involved in the planning, development and 
review of mosquito control activities; does other related duties as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this 
job specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be 
listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Prepares contract specifications to obtain aircraft services and purchase 
pesticides, coordinates preparations with other agencies as required.

Examines pesticides and pesticide formulations, and reviews new air spray 
techniques.

Reviews and analyzes air spray data to determine its effect on mosquito 
populations.

Reviews and assesses the development of pesticide resistance in mosquitoes; 
investigates the effects of air spray activities on non-target organisms.

Reviews and evaluates program contract development and performance.

Reviews Federal, State and Local government facility requirements and 
contractual aircraft service facility requirements.

Inspects the aircraft facilities of agencies submitting bids for air spray 
service contracts.

May meet with mosquito control personnel of other agencies to assist in 
the planning, organization, and implementation of air spray operations.

Conducts training of seasonal employees utilized to monitor and identify 
mosquito populations, their stages of development, and their breeding 
habitats.

Provides advice and information on mosquito control regulations and 
practices.

Identifies suspected violations of pesticide application regulations.

Coordinates mosquito control activities with those of the other municipal 
and private mosquito control or pesticide application programs.

Provides mosquito control information regarding pesticide legislation, 
labeling, certification, training and licensing.

Prepares clear, sound, accurate, and informative reports.

May conduct training on pesticide application and other areas related to 
mosquito control.

When required, provides testimony and acts as a witness for the State 
at hearings and/or in court.

Compiles, tabulates, and analyzes various types of technical air spray 
program data.

Prepares correspondence.

Maintains records, reports and files.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office or 
related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorï¿½s 
degree in one of the Biological sciences.

EXPERIENCE:

Two (2) years of experience in entomological or bio-chemical research, 
or in the application of entomological or bio-chemical principles to field 
investigations or chemical control of insect populations, one (1) year of 
which shall have been specific to mosquito populations.

NOTE:  A Masterï¿½s degree in Biology or Entomology may be substituted 
for one (1) year of experience.

LICENSE: 

Possession a Certified Pesticide Applicator, Commercial license in the 
appropriate categories, issued by the NJ Department of Environmental 
Protection.

Appointees will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDE AND ABILITIES: 

Knowledge of biological principles.

Knowledge of the principles of entomology.

Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of mosquito control.

Knowledge of pesticides and their application and of pesticide equipment.

Ability to read and interpret laws, rules and regulations and apply them to 
specific situations.

Ability to conduct surveys, and to collect and evaluate data.

Ability to review and assess mosquito control activities.

Ability to coordinate mosquito control activities with those of other units 
and organizations.

Ability to provide advice and information on mosquito control regulations 
and practices.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with 
other mosquito control personnel.

Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate and informative reports, 
containing findings, conclusions and recommendations.

Ability to maintain records and files.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office or related 
units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand and communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign 
Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of 
communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform 
the essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation.  If the 
accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer 
undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote01753OMosquito ControlSCNE22N/AP22-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 6/3/2023

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the Biological sciences.
A Master's degree in Biology or Entomology may be substituted for one (1) year of experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: For the position of Senior Biologist, Mosquito Control, a higher educational degree, specifically a Bachelor's degree in one of the Biological sciences, is absolutely required as per the job specification. Additionally, a Master's degree in Biology or Entomology is considered advantageous, as it may substitute for one year of required experience. This educational prerequisite is fundamental due to the technical and biological nature of the job, which involves planning, researching, and implementing mosquito control activities. The role demands a solid understanding of biological principles, entomology, and the application of chemical control measures, all of which are generally gained through formal education in the biological sciences.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession a Certified Pesticide Applicator, Commercial license in the appropriate categories, issued by the NJ Department of Environmental Protection.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description contains a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. The specified requirement is "Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorâs degree in one of the Biological sciences." This explicitly states that a Bachelor's degree is necessary for the position, creating an obstacle for those without such educational qualifications.

name: Administrator Office Of Mosquito Control
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


ADMINISTRATOR OFFICE OF MOSQUITO CONTROL

DEFINITION

Under the administrative direction of the Assistant Director, Division of Fish and 
Wildlife, or other supervisory official, manages the Office of Mosquito Control 
Coordination within the Department of Environmental Protection and serves as 
the Executive Secretary of the New Jersey State Mosquito Commission; plans, 
develops, reviews and directs New Jersey's mosquito control programs; supervises 
staff and work activities.  Prepares and signs official performance evaluations for 
subordinate staff; does other related duties as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification. 
Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

After consultation with the divisionï¿½s fiscal officer, controls the obligation and 
expenditure of all funds; audits and maintains ledgers of office accounts; 
develops and prepares yearly budget requests for the Office of Mosquito 
Control Coordination.

Reviews, analyzes, evaluates and keeps current with state laws and regulations 
regarding mosquito control, pesticides and pesticide applications, stream 
encroachment, drainage and the environment.

Keeps current with latest scientific developments in the areas of biology, 
entomology, toxicology, vector and general pest control.

Manages the work operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility 
for employee evaluations and for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, 
promoting, demoting, and/or disciplining of employees.

Reviews and evaluates county and state mosquito control programs.

Cooperates with and assists county mosquito control agencies, the State Mosquito 
Control Commission, the State Agricultural Experiment Station, State Department 
of Health and Senior Services and Agriculture, as well as other State and Federal 
agencies to develop and implement environmentally sound procedures and 
techniques of mosquito control in the areas of water management, chemical and 
biological control.

Provides consultation, advice and recommendations on mosquito control and 
entomological questions.

Cooperates with county, State and Federal agencies to prepare and distribute 
written and audio-visual material for the public and communications media 
including: projection supplies, radio and television support announcements, 
news releases, pamphlets and literature to inform, educate and/or train 
professional workers and the public in mosquito control measures.

Consults with the Office of Epidemiology and Consumer Health Services, 
Department of Health and Senior Services, regarding vector-borne diseases.

Helps counties in the coordination and implementation of appropriate county 
mosquito vector surveillance and abatement efforts in cooperation with the 
Department of Health and Senior Services and the NJ Agricultural Experiment 
Station.

Analyses incidents of mosquito-borne diseases in humans, wildlife and 
domestic animals, and reports the information to appropriate State, county 
and local agencies.

Prepares and directs preparation and distribution of reports on mosquito-related 
problems and control.

Represents the Department at meetings, conferences, boards and groups 
involved with mosquito control and containment programs.

Cooperates with and assists various department programs, the U.S. Army Corps 
of Engineers, and the Federal Aviation Administration in the review and approval 
of applications for pesticide use and water management for mosquito control.

Develops, coordinates and evaluates various state-funded mosquito-control 
research projects.

Prepares budget requests for the State Commission; attends budget hearings; 
plans, develops and prepares requests for capital improvements for major 
equipment purchase, water management projects and facility construction and 
improvements.

Schedules State Commission meetings and field trips, and prepares meeting 
agendas; prepares and distributes minutes of State Commission meetings; 
prepares, processes and distributes State Commission Annual Reports.

Obtains and relays State policies and regulations to the members of the State 
Commission, in cooperation with the Attorney General's Office and other State 
agencies.

Oversees the State Commission funded Mosquito Air Spray Program; evaluates 
program efficiency, coordinates program participation, aerial spraying contracts, 
and Service bids and program budget.

Directs special studies, investigations and facility inspections for aerial 
applications of pesticides for mosquito control; and conducts and/or directs 
the review of related State and Federal laws and regulations.

Supervises the operational and fiscal aspects of the State Mosquito Control 
Commission's Equipment Program including inspection of owned and leased 
equipment, bids for purchase and repair, and budget requests; oversees the 
use of equipment, identifies equipment needs and provides recommendations.

Plans, develops and administers Statewide water management projects for 
mosquito control including evaluation of project proposals, engineering strategies, 
budget request, biological impacts, field inspection of project sites, review of 
associated government water management permits, preparation of final contracts 
and budgets, and direction of contracted field personnel performing water 
management activities for compliance with State and Federal regulations.

Plans, coordinates and administers all State Commission-supported projects, 
programs, professional services and research investigations and services 
including Vector Surveillance, Statewide Programs, Air Spray Technology, 
and Water Management for Mosquito Control Projects.

Prepares and processes all State Commission contracts and agreements; controls 
the obligation and expenditure of all professional services and research funds; and 
prepares final reports on all state-funded projects.

Directs and coordinates the activities of personnel assigned to various professional 
services and State Mosquito Control Commission-supported research.

Prepares and/or supervises the preparation of correspondence.

Supervises the maintenance of records, reports and files.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in 
one of the biological sciences or Natural Resource Management including six (6) 
credits in Entomology.

EXPERIENCE:

Five (5) years of experience in entomological or bio- chemical research or in the 
application of entomological principles to field investigations and/or chemical 
control of insect populations, four (4) years of which shall have been specific to 
mosquito populations, two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory 
capacity.

NOTE:  A Master's degree in one of the Biological Sciences of Natural Resource 
Management including or supplemented by six (6) credits in Entomology may 
be substituted for one (1) year of non-supervisory experience.

NOTE:  A Doctorate degree in Entomology or Biology may be substituted for 
two (2) years of non-supervisory experience.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only 
if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform 
essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of the biological principles.

Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of mosquito control.

Knowledge of the principles of entomology.

Knowledge of pesticides, their application, and pesticide equipment.

Knowledge of the methods used to collect and analyze data.

Knowledge of insect vectors and vector borne diseases.

Knowledge of the methods used to develop, implement and evaluate mosquito 
control programs.

Ability to coordinate activities of a statewide insect control program with other 
counties and municipalities.

Ability to supervise assigned staff and plan, organize and implement projects 
within the unit.

Ability to interpret laws, rules and regulations and apply them to specific situations.

Ability to plan, develop and evaluate and administer water management project 
proposals for mosquito control.

Ability to develop and evaluate mosquito research projects, and adapt control 
and eradication methods to environmental concerns.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative work relationships with those interested 
in or involved with the mosquito control program.

Ability to develop and prepare contract proposals, budget requests; and to manage 
the obligation and expenditure of program funds.

Ability to conduct field surveys and studies.

Ability to address lay and professional groups at conferences and meetings 
regarding issues.

Ability to prepare and supervise the preparation of reports and correspondence.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently 
to perform duties of this position. American Sign Language or Braille may also be 
considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform essential 
functions of the job after reasonable accommodation. If the accommodation cannot 
be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may 
not be eligible.
