educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences or Natural Resource Management including six (6) credits in Entomology.

A Master's degree in one of the Biological Sciences of Natural Resource Management including or supplemented by six (6) credits in Entomology may be substituted for one (1) year of non-supervisory experience.
A Doctorate degree in Entomology or Biology may be substituted for two (2) years of non-supervisory experience.

alternativeQualifications: An additional year of non-supervisory experience with a Master's degree
Two years of non-supervisory experience with a Doctorate degree

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job description specifies a requirement for a Bachelor's degree in the biological sciences or Natural Resource Management with credits in Entomology, indicating that a degree is mandatory. The fact that a Master's or Doctorate degree can substitute for some non-supervisory experience suggests that higher education can serve as an alternative qualification to partially fulfill the experience requirements, rather than replace the mandatory degree requirement. Hence, while the degree itself is mandatory, having higher qualifications affects the required experience rather than serving as a complete alternative to the degree requirement.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job of Administrator Office of Mosquito Control requires a higher educational degree because it explicitly states that candidates must have a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences or Natural Resource Management, including six credits in Entomology. The possession of advanced degrees like a Master's or Doctorate in relevant fields can substitute for certain amounts of required experience, demonstrating the integral role that specialized education plays in fulfilling the job's responsibilities. Additionally, the job involves complex tasks such as analyzing entomological data, coordinating statewide mosquito control programs, and developing research projectsâtasks that likely require expertise typically gained through higher education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies a requirement for graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences or Natural Resource Management, including six (6) credits in Entomology. This educational requirement poses a barrier to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree. Additionally, the substitution notes for a Master's or Doctorate degree for certain years of experience further emphasize the significance of formal education qualifications in the selection process.

name: Legal Liaison
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


   LEGAL LIAISON
   
   DEFINITION

   Under general guidance of the Director, Office of UI-DI Finance, this
   single incumbency title acts as a liaison between the division and
   the department's Office of Regulatory Services in receiving,
   formulating, and transmitting requests for legal advice on behalf of
   the agency; on behalf of the Director, signs judgments, certificates
   of debt, warrants of satisfaction, writs of execution, releases of
   liens, proofs of claims, and waivers of statute of limitations as per
   enabling legislation for the replaced title; does related work as
   required.

   NOTE:  The definition and examples of work for this title are for
   illustrative purposes only. A particular position using this title
   may not perform all duties listed in this job specification.
   Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

   EXAMPLES OF WORK:

   Recommends to the Director when requests for legal advice from the
   Attorney General's Office are necessary or appropriate.

   In consultation with the Office of Regulatory Services, provides
   guidance as to the nature and substance of the various statutes and
   regulations covering the responsibilities of the division.

   Works with the department's Office of Regulatory Services and Office
   of Legislative Liaison to assist in drafting proposed regulations,
   legislation, and amendments in accord with the policy objectives of
   the division subject to restrictions applicable to nonattorneys.

   Reviews settlement agreements recommended to the Director by the
   Chief Auditor and in appropriate cases the Attorney General's Office
   prior to submission to the Office of Administrative Law.

   Reviews proposed rule changes prepared by the Regulations Committee
   and provides advice and/or support to division management in
   consultation with the Office of Regulatory Services.

   Assists the Director's staff in preparation of proposed legislation
   in consultation with the Office of the Legislative Liaison; reviews
   for the Director comments and fiscal analysis prepared by other staff
   regarding proposed legislation.

   Signs on behalf of the Director judgments, certificates of debt,
   warrants of satisfaction, writs of execution, releases of liens,
   waivers of statute of limitations, and proofs of claims.

   On behalf of the Director serves as liaison with County Sheriffs'
   Offices for UI collection activities, and assists in collection
   activities which could include procedures for identification of
   assets subject to execution.

   Reviews informal audit redeterminations for the Director or Chief
   Auditor to determine that they are consistent with Department of
   Labor policy and past practice.

   Reviews penalty abatements where abatement requested exceeds $5,000,
   and makes recommendations concerning the amount to be abated.

   Reviews requests to enter into agreement with the division for access
   to tax information and data, particularly requests for access to wage
   reporting data base; drafts agreement as required.

   Reviews requests for tax data relative to confidentiality
   restrictions.

   Reviews bankruptcy cases in consultation with the Attorney General's
   Office to determine if liability exists to the department.

   Reviews cases being considered for referral for criminal prosecution
   and consults with appropriate personnel from the Attorney General's
   Office.

   Prepares correspondence in the course of official duties.

   Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
   manual recording and computerized information systems used by
   the agency, office, or related units.

   REQUIREMENTS:

        EDUCATION:

         Graduation from an accredited law school with Juris Doctor (J.D.) 
   or a Bachelor of Laws (L.L.B.) degree.

        EXPERIENCE:

          Seven (7) years of comprehensive professional and/or
   administrative experience, or a combination thereof, in the review of
   legislative and/or general unemployment, or disability insurance
   types of administrative appeals.

        LICENSE:

         Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid
   in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than
   employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of
   the position.

   KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

   Knowledge of federal laws relative to the programs of the department.

   Knowledge of the laws of New Jersey relating to the several program
   areas administered by the department.

   Knowledge of the techniques involved in reviewing proposed
   legislation and in evaluating its effects on the present operations
   of the department including necessary policy and procedural changes
   enacted.

   Ability to develop and implement a consistent policy in
   interpretation of the various legal matters of concern to the
   department.

   Ability to direct the work program of a professional hearings and
   review staff accustomed to acting as an appellate tribunal of last
   resort.

   Ability to engage in independent research and analysis of opinions,
   writings, and proposed legislation.

   Ability to prepare drafts of tentative legislation affecting the
   department.

   Ability to develop appropriate rules and regulations and statements
   of policy and procedures and to evaluate recommendations for changes
   thereto.

   Ability to work effectively with subordinates and the principal
   officials of the department and of other departments including the
   Attorney General's and Governor's Offices.

   Ability to direct the preparation of extensive correspondence.

   Ability to prepare reports and summaries based on data, information,
   and records maintained.

   Ability to direct the establishment and maintenance of essential
   records and files.

   Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
   recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
   related units.

   Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English
   sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign
   Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
   communication.

   Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
   they can perform the essential functions of the job after reasonable
   accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the
   accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer
   undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 
This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote61601SNNL98N/A&98-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 1/6/1996

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited law school with Juris Doctor (J.D.) or a Bachelor of Laws (L.L.B.) degree.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is absolutely required for this job as it specifically states the requirement for graduation from an accredited law school with a Juris Doctor (J.D.) or a Bachelor of Laws (L.L.B.) degree. This requirement is essential due to the nature of the responsibilities, which involve reviewing legal matters, interpreting legislation, and working closely with the Attorney General's Office and other legal entities. The position demands a comprehensive understanding of legal concepts and the ability to perform complex legal analysis, which necessitates a law degree.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The primary barrier for applicants without a college or university degree in this job description is the requirement for "Graduation from an accredited law school with Juris Doctor (J.D.) or a Bachelor of Laws (L.L.B.) degree." This explicitly requires a law degree, which necessitates having completed undergraduate education as a prerequisite for law school admission. Therefore, without a university degree, an applicant would not meet the educational requirements specified for this position.

name: Safety Service Patrol Shift Supervisor
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


SAFETY SERVICE PATROL SHIFT SUPERVISOR

DEFINITION

Under the direction of a Supervisor Safety Service Patrol or other 
designated supervisor in the Department of Transportation, functions 
as a first-line field supervisor over a team of at least three Safety 
Service Patrol Operators and/or Apprentices in a geographical area 
during an assigned shift; delegates assignments and appraises 
performance of staff involved in clearing highways of incidents which 
includes: transportation accidents, assistance of disabled motorists, 
removal of debris, tagging abandoned vehicles; does related work as 
required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in 
this job specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may 
not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Functions as a first-line field supervisor over a team of at least three 
Safety Service Patrol Operators and/or Apprentices in a geographical 
area during an assigned shift, delegates assignments and appraises 
performance of staff.

Sets a good example in communication with the public, providing 
courteousness and empathy, particularly in stressful and traumatic 
situations.

Contacts the Central Dispatch Unit's (CDU) Communications Operators 
for all incidents providing accurate information and requesting additional 
assistance as required.

Uses appropriate traffic control techniques, as outlined in the NJDOT 
Safety Manual and the NJDOT Work Zone Safety Set Up Guide, to 
close lanes during an incident.

Assists law enforcement officer in duties relating to traffic control situations, 
and maintains traffic control in accordance with the NJDOT Safety Manual 
and the NJDOT Work Zone Safety Set Up Guide.

Prioritizes and control situations until released by a supervisor, incident 
commander, or until the incident clears.

Responsible for assisting disabled motorists, along a designated section 
of roadway, by changing a flat tire, providing fuel, performing minor repairs, 
jump starting a vehicle, providing directions, or calling for additional 
assistance (Police, Fire, Medical, Maintenance, Environmental).

Acts as NJDOT liaison to the incident commander, during transportation 
incidents, until relieved by higher level supervision.

Instructs Safety Service Patrol (SSP) Apprentices, Safety Service Patrol 
Operators and other employees in the use and operation of tow trucks in 
clearing state owned roadways.

Directs SSP Operators and SSP Apprentices to provide appropriate traffic 
control during incidents in accordance with the NJDOT Safety Manual and 
the NJDOT Work Zone Safety Set Up Guide.

Instructs SSP Apprentice, SSP Operators in the use and operation of 
roadside field deployable intelligent transportation system equipment 
including truck and/or trailer mounted message signs, highway advisory 
radios, and portable cameras.

Ensures SSP personnel provide traffic queue information to Statewide 
Traffic Management Center (STMC) and/or Traffic Operations South 
(TOC) on transportation related incidents.

Instructs SSP Apprentice, SSP Operators, and other employees in the 
maintenance of clear State owned roadways.

Takes the lead in the use of handheld/mobile computer devices.  

Ensures all information collected from the Safety Service Patrol 
operators and apprentices is captured correctly and downloaded 
into a central database which is able to provide routine reports.

Responsible for performing routine checks of all SSP operators/apprentices 
by reviewing reports from the automatic vehicle location (AVL) system 
for driver location, speed, start/stop times and other pertinent measurable.

Plans, organizes, and assigns work of the unit and evaluates employee 
performance and conduct, enabling the effective recommendation of 
the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of subordinates.

Reviews incident reports from the shift, for completeness and legibility.  
Any corrections are brought to the attention of the technician.

Reports the performance of each technician on the shift to the Safety 
Service Patrol Supervisor.  (Examples include assist disabled motorists, 
tag abandoned vehicles, respond to accident scenes, assist at cleanup of 
non-hazardous spills, assist with car fires, remove debris, report suspicious 
activities, report damage to state property and prepare an incident report 
of any assist.)

Responsible for informing the SSP Supervisor of vehicles not in service 
during the shift for compilation of required vehicle downtime.

Provides traffic queue information to the Statewide Traffic Management 
Center (STMC) and/or Traffic Operations South (TOC) on a regular 
basis, also provides estimated durations for transportation related incidents.

Operates and utilizes all Safety Service Patrol vehicle and equipment or 
uses in the clearing state owned roadways.

Performs snow removal in their SSP facilities as necessary.

In the absence of a Safety Service Patrol Operator, may be required 
perform the duties of the operator.

In the absence of the Safety Service Patrol Supervisor, may perform 
duties of the position when necessary.

Responsible for the inventory of all equipment and materials utilized 
by the patrol and ordering equipment and materials when necessary.

Attends specialized training courses relevant to Emergency Service 
and subsequently conducts training with the technicians.

In the absence of an Safety Service Patrol Operator, may perform 
required duties of the driver.  

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, 
or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

Three (3) years of experience in the assistance of disabled motorists, 
minor repairs of vehicles, and maintaining clear roads for vehicle flow.

Appointees must be certified in the Incident Command System 
(ICS 100 and 200).

LICENSE

Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey.  

Appointees are also required to possess a valid Commercial Driver's 
License (CDL) and applicable endorsement for the class and type of 
vehicle being operated.

The responsibility for ensuring that employees possess the required 
motor vehicle license, commensurate with the class and type of vehicles 
operated, rests with the Appointing Authority.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of NJDOT Safety Manual and Manual on Uniform Traffic 
Control Devices, as well as the NJDOT Work Zone Safety Set Up 
Guide.

Knowledge of types of motor vehicles and their operation.

Knowledge of the tools and equipment in the minor repair of disabled 
vehicles, including jump starting dead batteries, providing a small amount 
of gas, and changing tires.

Knowledge of the procedures for the competent, safe, and efficient 
operation of vehicles.

Ability to prepare factual reports.

Ability to maintain essential records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or 
related units.

Ability to read, writes, speak, understand, or communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American 
Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable 
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long 
as they can perform essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be 
made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, 
such persons may not be eligible.

            
This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote10319SC4017N/AR18-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 1/24/2015

alternativeQualifications: Three (3) years of experience in the assistance of disabled motorists, minor repairs of vehicles, and maintaining clear roads for vehicle flow.
Certified in the Incident Command System (ICS 100 and 200).
Driver's license valid in New Jersey.
Commercial Driver's License (CDL) and applicable endorsement for the class and type of vehicle being operated.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: This job does not explicitly require a higher educational degree. It requires three years of relevant experience, specific certifications in the Incident Command System (ICS 100 and 200), and a valid driver's license with a Commercial Driver's License (CDL) for the class and type of vehicle being operated. The focus is on practical experience, certifications, and road safety knowledge, which suggests that a higher educational degree is not absolutely necessary for this position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey. Appointees are also required to possess a valid Commercial Driver's License (CDL) and applicable endorsement for the class and type of vehicle being operated.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: State of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description for the "Safety Service Patrol Shift Supervisor" position does not explicitly mention barriers to hiring applicants who do not have a college or university degree. It primarily focuses on experience and specific certifications, such as experience in assisting disabled motorists, performing minor vehicle repairs, and maintaining clear roads for vehicle flow. Additionally, certifications in the Incident Command System (ICS 100 and 200) and possession of a valid driver's license and Commercial Driver's License (CDL) are required. There is no mention of a requirement for a college or university degree.

name: Senior Inspector Plant Industry
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification



SENIOR INSPECTOR, PLANT INDUSTRY (BIOLOGICAL CONTROL) 

DEFINITION

Under the limited direction of a supervisory officer in the Division of Plant Industry, 
Department of Agriculture, performs field work of considerable difficulty related to 
biological control of plant pests (insects, weeds and diseases); performs related 
work as required.

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification.  
Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Inspects forest, ornamental and agricultural crops in order to determine the presence, 
extent, and cyclic population trends of plant insect, disease, weed pests and biological 
control agents using recommended inspection procedures.

Plants and maintains field plots of certain agricultural commodities using commercial 
farm machinery or equipment in order to implement biological control programs of plant 
insect, disease and weed pests.

Assists in the selecting release sites and performs the field work involved in the release 
of and evaluates the effectiveness of biological control agents of plant pests.

Determines appropriate and effective pesticides to be utilized and applies chemical 
and/or biological pesticides on field plots using backpack and/or tractor driven sprayers 
in order to control plant insect disease and weed pests.

Determines appropriate and effective pesticides to be utilized and applies chemical 
and/or biological pesticides on field plots using backpack and/or tractor driven sprayers 
in order to control plant insect disease and weed pests.

Conducts inspection, reports on the finding and makes recommendations for biological 
control of plant pest problems as reported by farmers and other in to satisfy the needs of 
the agricultural community.

Conducts and coordinates seasonal surveys of plant insects, diseases and weeds 
injurious to farm crops, forests, nursery and ornamental plantings and established 
and/or released biological control agents of those pests in order to monitor the pest 
and biological control agent populations using recommended survey procedures, maps, 
and equipment as directed by the program objective.

Assists county and local government officials and supervises approved vendors in plant 
insect and disease suppression or eradication programs in order to reduce pest 
populations using ground or aerial pesticide application equipment as directed by law or
program objectives.

Performs the field work involved in the collection of specimens of plant, insect, disease
 pests and biological control agents in order to make accurate identification of pests 
and control agents using recommended collecting techniques.

Organizes and assigns the field work of Inspectors, Plant Industry (Biological Control), 
in order to develop effective work methods.

Provides guidance and instructions to inspectors, Plant Industry (Biological Control).

Act as liaison between the Division of Plant Industry and local and/or county government 
officials in matters of cooperative pest suppression programs involving biological control
as directed.

Prepares written reports of inspection, collections, surveys and pest control activities 
in order to provide a reliable basic for management decisions.

Coordinates the reporting procedures of Inspectors, Plant Industry (Biological Control)
 in order to effectively document the activities of his/her assigned crew when required.

Maintains essential record and files for future reference.

May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office or related units.


REQUIREMENTS:

EXPERIENCE:

Two (2) years of experience in the planting, inspecting and spraying of agricultural plants 
and the operating of heavy duty spray and farm equipment, one (1) year of which 
shall have been in biological pest control work in a large scale plant pest control program.


LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if 
the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform 
essential duties of the position.

Appointees may be required to acquire registration as a Certified Regulatory 
Pesticide Applicator from the Department of Environmental Protection during the
working test period.


KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Considerable knowledge of the type of forest, ornamental and agricultural crops 
grown in the Northeastern United Statesï¿½ in order to readily identify pests 
encountered during inspections.

Considerable knowledge of the theories and principles involved in the biological 
control of plant pests.

Considerable knowledge of field inspection and survey techniques in order to 
representatively sample populations of plant pests and biological control agents.

Considerable knowledge of the operation, and the ability to perform simple routine 
maintenance on mechanized farm equipment or machinery as: trucks with manual 
transmission, trailers (non-articulate), tractors, sprayers, combines, and soil 
preparation and planting implements in order to plant and maintain field plots
 of certain agriculture commodities.

Considerable knowledge of conventional and no-till farming practices.

Considerable knowledge of map reading, compass usage, and field measurements 
in order to effectively conduct a field survey of plant, pest and biological control agent
 populations.

Considerable knowledge of pesticide application apparatus, materials, and techniques
 used to control plant pest populations effectively and in such a manner as not to 
endanger the health and safety of the human, plant or animal populations.

Considerable knowledge of specimen collection techniques and procedures in order
 to maintain collected specimens in the satisfactory condition for future examination.

Basic knowledge of mathematics in order to calculate sums, differences, products, 
areas, averages, and percent of the whole.

Ability to operate, maintain and repair various types of farm equipment and machinery.

Ability to operate, maintain and repair various types of farm equipment and machinery.

Ability to lift and carry loads of fifty pounds.

Ability to carry and operate for extended periods of time a backpack type sprayer 
equipped with a hand powered pneumatic pump.

Ability to learn quickly from oral and written instruction and from demonstrations.

Ability to perform field work quickly and accurately.

Considerable ability to prepare detailed written reports and analysis on inspections
 containing findings, conclusions and recommendations.

 Ability to work independently and with others in a courteous and cooperative manner.

Ability to maintain essential records and files in a neat and organized fashion so 
that they may be understood by others.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems used by the agency, office or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to
 perform the duties of this position. American Sign Language or braille may also be 
considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform 
the essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to their 
known limitations. If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the 
employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote02402CBiological ControlSCNE15N/AI15-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 12/05/86

alternativeQualifications: Two (2) years of experience in the planting, inspecting and spraying of agricultural plants and the operating of heavy duty spray and farm equipment, one (1) year of which shall have been in biological pest control work in a large scale plant pest control program.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The requirements focus on specific experience: two years in planting, inspecting, and spraying of agricultural plants, with at least one year in biological pest control work. While considerable knowledge of biological control theories and farm equipment is needed, these can be acquired through on-the-job experience and training rather than formal education. The job emphasizes practical abilities over academic qualifications, indicating that relevant experience is prioritized over holding a degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees may be required to acquire registration as a Certified Regulatory Pesticide Applicator from the Department of Environmental Protection during the working test period.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly require a college or university degree; however, it does require specific experience: two years in planting, inspecting, and spraying of agricultural plants and operating heavy-duty spray and farm equipment, with one year in biological pest control work in a large-scale plant pest control program. This experience requirement could be a barrier to those who lack formal education but have acquired relevant knowledge and skills through other means, as it emphasizes specific work experience. Additionally, the knowledge requirements, such as considerable knowledge of theories and principles involved in biological control of plant pests, might suggest a need for formal education or training, even if not explicitly stated as a degree requirement.

name: Printing Operations Technician 2
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


PRINTING OPERATIONS TECHNICIAN

   JOB CATEGORY SUMMARY

   A position in this category typically analyzes printing requests;
   determines appropriate printing techniques; estimates the quantity
   of time, costs, materials or personnel for assignments; consults with
   vendors or contractors; provides technical advice to staff; sets up,
   operates, and adjusts copier machines.

   UNIQUE AND DISTINGUISHING TASKS OR CLASSIFICATION FACTORS

       NOTE: Unique and distinguishing tasks are shown only for
       illustrative purposes and do not solely determine the level of a
       position within a job category.  Unique tasks pertain only to the
       job level identified; distinguishing tasks are performed with
       greater frequency or are of greater importance to the overall job
       level.

   Level 1

   A position at this level typically performs entry level tasks for the
   job category.

   Level 2

   A position at this level typically receives less direct supervision
   than positions at Level 1 and are permitted to exercise some
   independent judgment in carrying out their assignments.

   Level 3

   A position at this level typically plans, organizes and assigns the
   work of the organizational unit and evaluates employee performance 
   and conduct, enabling the effective recommendation of the hiring, firing,
   promoting, and disciplining of subordinates.

   Level 4

   A position at this level typically plans, organizes and assigns the
   work of the organizational unit and evaluates the performance and
   conduct of first line supervisors, enabling the effective
   recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of
   subordinates.  Unique Tasks: Writes requests for proposals (RFPs)

   TASKS COMMON TO ALL LEVELS

       NOTE: The above Job Category Summary and following 
       examples of work are for illustrative purposes only.  Any one position may 
       not include all of the tasks listed, nor do the examples cover all of
       the duties which may be performed.

   Analyzes incoming print requests
   
   Reviews samples, such as blue-line, press, binding, typesetting or
   final

   Selects paper stock

   Determines appropriate printing techniques

   Recommends styles of printed materials

   Estimates necessary quantity of time, costs, materials or personnel for
   the accomplishment of assignments or goals

   Verifies that quantity and type of item ordered matches invoice

   Writes technical specifications for purchase of equipment, supplies and
   parts

   Examines documents for adherence to applicable laws and regulations

   Determines appropriate graphic arts techniques

   Writes technical, statistical or financial reports

   Determines when printing request should be sent to outside vendors

   Selects ink

   Adjusts stock levels for anticipated needs

   Verifies entered data against source documents

   Monitors the use of materials, equipment, parts or supplies

   Calculates rates, cost, fees, taxes or other amounts consistent with
   schedules, formulas or other established procedures

   Identifies problems with printing equipment

   Records the use of materials, equipment, parts or supplies

   Designs layouts of graphic or printed materials

   Obtains current price quotes for special purchases

   Informs individuals of procedures necessary for completion of 
   forms or applications

   Provides technical advice to staff, peers or management

   Consults with vendors or contractors

   Interviews individuals for needed information

   Requests information from vendors on materials, equipment, 
   parts or supplies

   Informs the responsible person or organization of difficulties,
   accomplishments, plans or goals

   Consults with outside agencies or individuals about information
   necessary for job assignments

   Operates copiers

   Adjusts copy machines for density and contrast

   Sets up copiers

   Corrects printing press problems such as tinting, scumming, streaks,
   slow drying or double images

   Manipulates (uses) various drafting equipment such as T-squares,
   compasses or triangles

   Operates cutting machines

 KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES

       COMMON TO ALL LEVELS

       Knowledge of printing techniques

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of copy preparation,
       composition and layout

       Knowledge of the types of paper stock

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing inks

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of printing equipment

       Knowledge of commercial printing plant operations

       Knowledge of procedures for operating cutting machines

       Knowledge of procedures for operating copiers

       Knowledge of record keeping procedures

       Knowledge of standard English grammar; for example, syntax,
       punctuation, verb agreement, or tense

       Knowledge of postal regulations regarding envelope and postcard
       size

       Knowledge of procedures for requisitioning materials, equipment,
       parts or supplies

       Knowledge of inventory control

       Knowledge of basic interviewing techniques

       Knowledge of layout procedures

       Knowledge of the types and characteristics of graphic arts
       equipment

       Knowledge of bidding procedures

       Knowledge of principles and techniques of cost-benefit analysis

       Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide, using decimals,
       percentages and fractions

       Ability to establish goals and set priorities

       Ability to identify and resolve problems in the administration or
       coordination of programs, plans or projects

       Ability to make precise measurements

       Ability to determine whether products or services meet printing
       specifications

       Ability to correct printing press problems

       Ability to adjust copiers

       Ability to compare written or printed material for accuracy

       Ability to compare numerical material for accuracy

       Ability to perceive color differences

       Ability to collect data through questioning

       Ability to apply laws, rules or regulations to given situations

       Ability to summarize information in written form

       Ability to make appropriate inferences and deductions based on
       various types of source materials

       CHARACTERISTIC

       Level 3 and 4

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of supervision

       Ability to schedule and organize unit work activities and identify
       and resolve problems which arise

       UNIQUE AND DISTINGUISHING

       Unique

       Level 4

       Knowledge of warehousing procedures

       Distinguishing

       Level 4

       Knowledge of reimbursement programs and procedures

       Knowledge of principles and procedures of contract negotiation

       Knowledge of the principles and techniques of program monitoring

       Knowledge of procedures for cleaning copiers

       Knowledge of public information principles and techniques

   MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

   EDUCATION:

       REQUIRED FOR ALL LEVELS

       Completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training
       program in graphic and printing communications with course work
       including printing techniques, copy preparation, composition and
       layout, and graphic art.

       EXPERIENCE:

       Level 1

       Two (2) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.

       Level 2

       Three (3) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.

       Level 3

       Five (5) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.  
       
       Level 4

       Seven (7) years of experience in work involving printing and
       graphic art techniques, layout, equipment, and supplies.  
       Three (3) years of the required experience shall have been 
       in a supervisory capacity.

       SUBSTITUTION

       Level 1 and 2 - Applicants who do not possess the required
       education may substitute two (2) years of additional nonsupervisory
       experience.

       Level 3 and 4 - Applicants who do not possess the required
       education may substitute three (3) years of additional
       nonsupervisory experience.

   LICENSE

   Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
   New Jersey only if the operation of a  vehicle, rather than employee 
   mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

alternativeQualifications: two (2) or three (3) years of additional nonsupervisory experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job specification for a Printing Operations Technician outlines both education and experience requirements. It mandates the completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in graphic and printing communications, which signifies that a degree or equivalent formal education is strictly required. Furthermore, there is a provision for substituting this educational requirement with additional work experience for certain levels. This substitution option confirms that while a degree is mandatory, alternative qualifications through work experience are recognized as an acceptable substitute. Therefore, both statements about the degree requirement status are affirmed: a degree is mandatory, but there are alternative qualifications.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The minimum educational requirement for all levels is the completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in graphic and printing communications. However, there are provisions for substitution where experience can replace the educational requirement. For Level 1 and Level 2 positions, two additional years of nonsupervisory experience can substitute for the required education. For Level 3 and Level 4 positions, three additional years of nonsupervisory experience can substitute for the required education. This indicates that relevant work experience can be an alternative to formal education in fulfilling the job requirements.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies a "Completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in graphic and printing communications" as a minimum education requirement for all levels. While it does not explicitly require a college or university degree, it does necessitate formal specialized training in the field, which might be a barrier for those without such credentials. However, there is an option to substitute additional nonsupervisory experience in place of the education requirement, which somewhat mitigates this barrier.

name: Chief Bureau Of Biological Pest Control Laboratory
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


CHIEF BUREAU OF BIOLOGICAL PEST CONTROL LABORATORY


DEFINITION

Under the direction of the Director, Division of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture, plans and 
manages the laboratories and field operations for the mass production of biological agents and 
supervises field evaluations, recommending control measures for forests, crop pests and other 
pests of agricultural commodities; provides technical laboratory services for Bureaus within the 
division; does related work as required.

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  A particular position 
using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely, all duties 
performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Plan, organize and directs the work program of the Biological Pest Control Laboratory in providing 
services to determine efficiency of biological pesticides used for plant pest control.

Supervises the propagation and dissemination of biological agents such as insect parasites, 
predators, entomogenous fungi, viruses and protozoa used in the biological control of plant pests.

Plans for development of new rearing techniques utilizing biological agents in order to increase 
production and provide more effective control of plant pests.

Plans and supervises field surveys to ascertain the extent of infestations by insect pests and plant 
diseases and recommends appropriate control measures. Evaluates the effectiveness of agents of 
natural control including the parasites of pests in orchards, farms and forests.

Plans and directs the laboratory testing, investigation and evaluation of various biological and 
chemical substances such as juvenile hormones, sex pheromones and growth inhibitors to 
determine the feasibility of incorporating them into the integrated pest management system.

Supervises laboratory tests to determine the degree of efficiency of biological control agents on 
various insect pests.

Approves the distribution of biological agents maintained in the laboratory to other agencies in 
order to get wide dissemination and use of parasites.

Supervises the examination and reports on plant pests submitted to laboratory for identification.

Directs the development of operating methods and procedures concerning the regulatory actions 
of the bureau.

Gives appropriate assignments and instructions to laboratory, clerical and field employees and 
supervises the performance of the work.

Provides professional advice and assistance to county, municipal, State, Federal and private 
agencies on plant pest problems in order to coordinate the proper control measures.

Conducts large scales field test of new biological technologies for practical field application and 
public implementation.

Participates in cooperative pest management programs involving federal, State, and private 
agencies so that there is a unified approach to common problems.

Develops the Bureau plan of work and annual budget requests; establishes Bureau operating 
standards and procedures, give appropriate assignments and instruction to bureau personnel and 
evaluates work performances; makes recommendations for program and organizational 
improvement to the Director.

Manages the Bureau operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility for effectively 
recommending the hiring, firing, promotion and/or disciplining of employees.

Organizes and conducts training programs for professional and technical staff.

Prepares technical correspondence, bulletins, circulars, statistical data and reports in order to 
more effectively evaluate the results of the biological control program.

Prepares and presents programs explaining the functions of the Plant Laboratory to interested 
groups and individuals.

Supervises the establishment and maintenance of Plant Laboratory records and files in order to 
have findings and recommendations available when needed.

May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems used by the agency, office or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:


EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorï¿½s degree in Plant Science or 
Biological Science.

EXPERIENCE:

Five (5) years of professional experience in laboratory and/or field work rearing and distributing 
beneficial insects, and other biological agents used in an integrated (chemical and biological) 
agricultural pest control programs two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

NOTE: A Masterï¿½s degree in either biological or plant science may be substituted for one year of 
the indicated non-supervisory experience.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation 
of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Thorough knowledge of plant pest parasite taxonomy (classification) as it relates to mass rearing 
techniques.

Thorough knowledge of the methods and techniques of insect parasite rearing and the distribution 
of beneficial parasites and pathogens, including the determination of the results of such 
distributions.

Thorough knowledge of the problems, methods, procedures and materials used in determining 
damage done by plant pests.

Thorough knowledge of plant pests of economic significance to the United States agricultural 
interests.

Considerable knowledge of entomology and horticulture.

Considerable knowledge of pheromones, juvenile hormones, growth inhibitors, pesticides and 
other chemical substances which can be utilized in the integrated (chemical and biological) pest 
control strategy.

Considerable knowledge of management principles, policies, procedures and theories.

Ability to plan, organize and direct the staff of a biological control laboratory of agricultural pests.

Ability to acquire wide knowledge of State Laws rules and regulations and departmental policies 
and procedures concerning plant parasites and pests found to be destructive in New Jersey.

Ability to assign, instructs, and manages the work performance of Plant Laboratory employees.

Ability to collect, analyze and interpret data relating to control of plant pests.

Ability to comprehend, analyze and interpret basic laws, rules and regulations.

Ability to perform microscopic examinations of suspected bee diseases to determine the need for 
enforcement of control measure in bee colonies within the State.

Ability to work closely with other Bureaus within the Division of Plant Industry in developing a 
coordinated program by furnishing needed technical services.

Ability to keep abreast of current trends in literature relating to biological control.

Ability to work cooperatively with agricultural official of other states and the United States 
Department of Agriculture.

Ability to work effectively with farm groups, nurseryman, and other in carrying out phases of 
entomological activities.

Ability to speak before professional, civil, business, and other groups concerning regulatory or 
control programs of the Bureau.

Ability to prepare or supervise the preparation of technical correspondence and clear, technically 
sound, accurate, and informative reports on the regulatory and control programs of Bureau concern 
including findings, conclusions, and recommendations.

Ability to prepare and implement program plans, budgets and management reports.

Ability to supervise the maintenance of essential records, reports, and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording information systems 
used by the agency, office or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to perform the 
duties of this position. American Sign Language or braille may also be considered as acceptable 
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform the essential 
functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the 
accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such 
persons may not be eligible.



This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote02477SCNL31N/AM31-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 6/27/85

A Masterï¿½s degree in either biological or plant science may be substituted for one year of the indicated non-supervisory experience.

A Master's degree can substitute for one year of required non-supervisory experience, suggesting that while a Master's is not mandatory, it is beneficial and reduces experience requirements. Therefore, a higher degree such as a Master's is not absolutely required but is advantageous for meeting the job qualifications.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description contains a barrier to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree. The education requirement specifies that candidates must have graduated from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in Plant Science or Biological Science. This requirement poses a barrier for individuals without a college or university degree.

name: Section Chief Health Care Facility

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

Possession of a Master's degree from an accredited college or university in psychology, social work, nursing, rehabilitation, chaplaincy, creative arts therapy, occupational therapy, physical therapy, speech and/or hearing therapy or related therapeutic field; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.
Possession of a Doctoral degree from an accredited college or university in one of the indicated areas; and two (2) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience managing a clinical, therapeutic, rehabilitative, or professional services program in a psychiatric hospital, large mental health facility or social services agency for the mentally ill.
A certification as a therapist from a national certifying agency in Occupational, Creative Arts, Music, Recreation, Art, Dance or Movement Therapy.
A license valid in New Jersey to practice physical therapy, speech/language pathology, or audiology.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The requirements specify that an applicant can qualify with a significant amount of relevant professional experience aloneâspecifically, eight years of experience managing a clinical, therapeutic, rehabilitative, or professional services program in a relevant setting. Alternatively, a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree in relevant fields can reduce the required years of experience accordingly. Therefore, a degree is not mandatory if an applicant can demonstrate substantial relevant experience.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description outlines specific requirements that may present barriers for applicants without a college or university degree. These include:
- The preference for candidates to fulfill one of the specified educational and experience combinations, such as:
  - Eight years of professional experience managing relevant programs without a degree.
  - Possession of a bachelor's degree and four years of relevant experience.
  - Possession of a master's degree and three years of relevant experience.
  - Possession of a doctoral degree and two years of relevant experience.
- The potential for a certification or license from a national certifying agency or valid license in New Jersey to substitute one year of professional experience. 

Applicants without a degree must rely solely on the requirement of eight years of professional experience, which could be restrictive if they do not have such extensive experience.

name: Accounting Assistant
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


ACCOUNTING ASSISTANT

          (ALL JURISDICTIONS)

  DEFINITION

 Under direction performs preliminary accounting work involved 
 in preparing financial records and in maintaining an accounting
 system; does other related duties.

 NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only. A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Under close supervision, performs preliminary and routine
 accounting work involved in auditing accounts.

 Make routine inspections of varied financial transactions and
 records to ensure that concerned regulations and accounting
 procedures are observed.

 May assist in compiling financial and other statements and
 reports using basic data.

 Make preliminary investigations, examinations, and audits of
 books and financial records, and assists in the preparation of
 reports.

 May assist in preparing routine accounting and statistical
 tabulations.

 Performs preliminary work involved in auditing and recording
 expense invoices, and assists in the preparation of audits and
 edits, reports of cost, and other financial summaries and
 statements.

 May assist in preparing routine accounting reports.

 Maintains records and files

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by 
 the agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

  EDUCATION:

 Satisfactory completion of at least sixty (60) semester hour
 credits at an accredited college or university including a
 minimum of twelve (12) semester hour credits in accounting
 courses.

 NOTE: Satisfactory completion of twelve (12) semester hour
 credits in accounting courses at an accredited college or
 university and two (2) years of experience in phases of auditing
 and accounting operations may be substituted for the required
 education.

 NOTE:  In local government, possession of a valid certificate 
 as a Certified Municipal Finance Officer issued by the New Jersey 
 Department of Community Affairs, Division of Local Government 
 Services, may be substituted for the educational requirement.

 LICENSE:

 Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license
 valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather
 than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential 
 duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of the work involved in the general fields of
 accounting and auditing.

 Ability to learn principles, procedures, and techniques used 
 in accounting work and to apply these to specific situations.

 Ability to perform mathematical computations accurately and 
 with reasonable speed.

 Ability to learn various business machines commonly used 
 in accounting and auditing work.

 Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, 
 office,  or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate 
 in English sufficiently to perform duties of this position.  
 American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered 
 as acceptable forms of communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as
 long as they can perform essential functions of the job with 
 or without reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation 
 cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue 
 hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote50451CC351412A13-This job specification is for state and local government use.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 6/11/2014

alternativeQualifications: two (2) years of experience in phases of auditing and accounting operations
valid certificate as a Certified Municipal Finance Officer issued by the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs, Division of Local Government Services

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description for the Accounting Assistant position requires either partial higher education with specific accounting coursework or relevant experience. Specifically, candidates must have completed at least 60 semester hour credits at an accredited college or university, including a minimum of 12 credits in accounting courses. Alternatively, completing 12 accounting credits along with two years of experience in auditing and accounting can substitute for this educational requirement. Therefore, a complete higher educational degree is not absolutely required, as practical experience or a relevant certification (such as a Certified Municipal Finance Officer) can fulfill the requirement instead.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) or equivalent authority in New Jersey

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description has a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree, as it requires:

- Satisfactory completion of at least sixty (60) semester hour credits at an accredited college or university, including a minimum of twelve (12) semester hour credits in accounting courses.
  
However, there are alternative qualifications that can be considered as a substitute for this educational requirement, which include:

- Satisfactory completion of twelve (12) semester hour credits in accounting courses at an accredited college or university and two (2) years of experience in phases of auditing and accounting operations.

- Possession of a valid certificate as a Certified Municipal Finance Officer issued by the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs, Division of Local Government Services (applicable in local government), may be substituted for the educational requirement.

name: Director Office Of Planning
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification
00680


DIRECTOR OFFICE OF PLANNING 

DEFINITION

Under the direction of the Director, Division of Mental Health and Hospitals, 
plans, develops and implements a continuing community-based mental 
health planning process; serves as the Chief planning officer for the Division 
of Mental Health and Hospitals; consolidates and centralizes all divisional 
planning requirements mandated under State and Federal legislation; 
updates the State Plan for Mental Health Services; does other related duties.

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only. 
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this 
job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Develops and upholds goals, objectives, and strategies for all divisional mental 
health services.

Recommends and prepares for executive management new legislation and
changes to the legislation.

Develops State standards for county reception (prescreening) services; directs 
the formulation of county plans to provide such services; develops a fiscal plan 
to implement such services.

Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility 
for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting and/or disciplining of 
employees.

Coordinates the planning process of a community mental health center as 
established in the S.P. for Mental Health Services, as mandated by the Special 
Health Revenue Act (P.L. 94-63).  

May develop CMHC inventory, need survey, standards, and specialized services 
to select target groups as these relate to the entire spectrum of the Mental Health 
Delivery System.

Coordinates community care programs.

Coordinates the regulatory functions of the health system agencies, especially 
the review and approval authority of the HSAï¿½s overall applications for federal 
assistance under P.L. 94-63.   

Assists County mental health administrators in the preparation of annual county plans.

Assists State and County psychiatric hospitals in the preparation of long range 
facility utilization plans as mandated by the Health Care Administration Board 
under N.J.S.A. 26:2H-12.

Maintains close liaison with organizational units in areas concerning 
administrative policies, procedures and rules and regulations pertaining to the 
department's activities.

Prepares and directs the preparation of official correspondence and detailed 
reports containing findings, recommendations, and conclusions.

Directs the establishment of essential records and files.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Masterï¿½s degree in 
Social Work, Sociology, Public Administration, City and Regional Planning, or 
other related field in the social or behavorial sciences. 

EXPERIENCE:

Five (5) years of planning experience in the fields of Health and/or Welfare.

LICENSE:

Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid
in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of the program planning methods.

Knowledge of State and Federal laws, rules, and regulations relating to Mental Health

Knowledge of planning process as it relates to departmental rules, regulations, 
and procedures

Knowledge of management principles and techniques

Knowledge of the methods used to gather and analyze data

Ability to organize and execute designated planning projects 

Ability to identify and analyze planning problems

Ability to analyze, and interpret basic law and regulations and apply them to 
specific situations

Ability to supervise the activities of staff

Ability to provide professional advice and guidance on planning matters

Ability to speak with officials and groups and explain planning projects

Ability to prepare correspondence in the course of official duties

Ability to prepare clear, technically sound, accurate, and informative planning 
reports, studies, and surveys containing findings, conclusions, and 
recommendations.

Ability to oversee the maintenance of records, reports, maps, plans, and files.

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently 
to perform duties of this position.  American Sign Language or Braille may also 
be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can 
perform essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made 
to their known limitations.  If the accommodation cannot be made because it 
would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

CODES: 32/M32 - 00680                 MCK                      12/24/05

Possession of Master's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Management or other relevant field
