However, having a bachelor's or master's degree can reduce the number of years of required experience, indicating that while a higher educational degree can be beneficial, extensive professional experience can serve as an alternative qualification.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description outlines a requirement for either a combination of professional administrative experience and education equating to a certain number of semester hour credits or possession of a bachelor's or master's degree with specific years of professional experience. These requirements could pose a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree, as a bachelor's or master's degree is specifically mentioned as a criterion for eligibility alongside experience. Without meeting these educational criteria, applicants may have to rely solely on their professional experience to qualify, which could limit their eligibility if their experience is not extensive enough.

name: Building Services Coordinator 3
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


BUILDING SERVICES COORDINATOR 3

DEFINITION

Under general supervision of a supervisory official in a state department, 
institution, or agency, supervises and evaluates the activities of the unit 
and is responsible for the environmental and operational needs (office
layouts, alterations, decorating, telephone facilities, telecommunications's 
requirements, and so forth) for the division or the department at all locations 
throughout the state; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The definition and examples of work for this title are for illustrative 
purposes only. A particular position using this title may not perform all duties 
listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job 
may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Works directly with Commissioner's personal staff, Assistant Commissioners, 
and/or Division Directors on their environmental and operational needs, 
office layouts, alternations, decorating, telephone facilities, communication's 
requirements, and so forth.

Is responsible for general maintenance of field offices and Central Office 
buildings.  Resolves all emergencies that may arise such as heating and 
air conditioning breakdown, roof damage, flooding, electrical problems, 
burglaries, and parking problems.

Acts as liaison between the department, institution, or agency, and the 
Division of Building and Construction on all engineering and architectural 
work that may be required by the department, institution, or agency, 
throughout the state.

Acts as liaison between the Building Management and Budget and 
Accounting on all fiscal matters relating to environmental and operational 
needs of the department, institution, or agency.

Approves all requests and supervises the site inspection and preparation 
of all telephone orders for the department, institution, or agency.

Schedules periodic field trips when necessary to resolve construction 
problems.

Is responsible for installing and maintaining local office computer terminal 
equipment, including data lines and related circuitry.

Supervises  the work operations and/or functional programs and has 
responsibility for employee evaluations and for effectively recommending 
the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or disciplining of employees.

Approves completed work in field offices and arranges for payment of 
contractors.

Acts as liaison between the department, institution, or agency, the Division
of Telecommunications, and the vendors  in all  communication matters.

Supervises the cost estimating function for telecommunication equipment 
and installation thereof for the buildings and offices throughout the state to 
procure necessary fundings and for budget preparation purposes.

Supervises the maintenance of lease, correspondence, and blueprint 
files for field locations and the Central Office buildings; revises blueprints 
when necessary.

Assigns and instructs clerical employees in the building maintenance unit 
and field offices and supervises the performance of their work.

Prepares  correspondence and reports for  the Commissionerï¿½s, or the 
representativeï¿½s signatures. 

Supervises necessary research prior to the preparation of budget requests 
for rents, alterations,  computer equipment, and related matters.

Prepares clear, sound, accurate, and informative reports which define the 
problems, establish the facts, draw valid conclusions, and make suitable 
recommendations.

Supervises the maintenance of essential files.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, 
or related units.

REQUIREMENTS

EXPERIENCE

Four (4) years of experience in property maintenance, including scheduling, 
coordinating, and expediting alteration, renovation, and repair work, and 
vendor management, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory 
capacity.

LICENSE

Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of methods and procedures used in the inspection of physical 
plants, including determining the adequacy of heating, lighting, ventilation, 
air conditioning, and sanitary facilities.

Knowledge of the interpretation of blueprints, drawings and specifications, 
and the evaluation of technical data.

Knowledge of legal terminology used in the interpretation of lease contracts, 
bonding, insurance, and related matters.

Knowledge of the interpretation of the National Safety Code, local city 
fire codes, and the Senate Bills promulgating barrier free facilities for the 
handicapped.

Knowledge of supervisory techniques and practices. 

Ability to supervise preparation of reports for Director, Assistant Director, 
and Bureau Chief.

Ability to meet and confer with state officials to determine agency 
communications requirements.

Ability to help develop procedures, techniques, and instructional material 
for the proper use of building facilities and systems.

Ability to supervise research prior to the preparation of budget requests 
for rents, alternations, heavy equipment, and related items.

Ability to resolve construction problems with contractors in the field and 
involving emergencies that may arise in the Central Office buildings and/or 
field offices throughout the state such as heating and air conditioning 
breakdown, roof damage, flooding, burglaries, electrical problems, and 
parking.

Ability to organize assigned work and develop appropriate work methods.

Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate, and informative reports which 
define the problems, establish the facts, draw valid conclusions, and 
make suitable recommendations.

Ability to supervise the maintenance of essential records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign Language 
or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as 
they can perform essential functions of the job with or without reasonable 
accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made because it would 
cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

This job specification is applicable to the following title code(s) whichare different work week or work month and/or variants of the job class title:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote40203SC3520N/AS19-40208SC4020N/AS21-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 2/6/2016

alternativeQualifications: Four (4) years of experience in property maintenance, including scheduling, coordinating, and expediting alteration, renovation, and repair work, and vendor management, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Building Services Coordinator 3 position. The job specifications emphasize experience over formal education, requiring four years of relevant experience in property maintenance, renovation, and vendor management, with at least one year in a supervisory role. Knowledge of specific areas, such as interpreting blueprints, legal terminology related to lease contracts, and safety codes, can be acquired through experience rather than a higher educational degree. The focus is on practical abilities and the capability to manage and resolve diverse operational and environmental issues rather than academic qualifications.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly mention a requirement for a college or university degree, indicating that the lack of such a degree might not be a direct barrier. However, the position requires four years of experience in property maintenance, including a year in a supervisory capacity. This level of specific experience could be a potential barrier for individuals who might not have a degree but also lack the requisite experience, potentially affecting candidates who have less formal work experience typically gained through education pathways.

name: Director Of Clinical Nutrition
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification



DIRECTOR OF CLINICAL NUTRITION

DEFINITION

Under general direction has responsibility for coordinating, directing, 
and evaluating the services provided by all nutritionists of lower grade; 
provides consultation to institutions in correcting deficiencies and meeting 
federal, state and departmental standards; serves as an advisor to the 
Department and high level Division Directors regarding programs for the 
Department; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The definition and examples of work for this title are for illustrative 
purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not perform all 
duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties performed 
on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Coordinates and/or supervises the professional activities of nutritionists 
of lower grade throughout the Department.

Coordinates implementation of the Department's nutrition program in 
context to the overall departmental health plan and budget.

Formulates the Department's nutrition program policies.

Analyzes data, summarizes conclusions, and utilizes these in 
administrative decision making.

Coordinates evaluation of nutrition program activities to establish 
the validity of program objectives and the effectiveness of programs, 
operational policies, and procedures in accomplishing these objectives.

Coordinates investigation and preparation of detailed recommendations 
relating to proposed expansion, continuation or elimination of 
programmatic needs and functions as well as positions and groups of 
positions.

Advises administrators on nutrition program plans, policy requirements, 
staffing recommendations, and organizational structure of nutrition 
departments.

Prepares a policy and procedure manual for use by personnel 
delivering nutrition services.

Serves as the representative for nutrition services on the Department's 
policy making and administrative team.

Interprets federal and State standards and assists institutional 
nutrition service departments in clarifying objectives and procedures 
for compliance.

Provides leadership and assists in the development and presentation 
of training programs for professional staff of Nutrition and Food Service 
Departments.

Confers with physicians, administrators, and Central Office professional 
staff regarding institutional program needs.

Serves as a resource person to provide up-to-date information in the 
area of normal and clinical nutrition.

Reviews requests for the hiring, transfer, and promotion of clinical 
nutritionists, and provides recommendations for the use of the 
Supervising and clinical nutritionists.

Coordinates activities of clinical nutritionists within State institutions, 
and serves as consultant when requested for State and county nutrition 
programs.

Promotes effective public relations.

Prepares clear, accurate reports containing findings, facts, and 
recommendations.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
office or related units.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION	

A Doctorate in Nutrition with a graduate course in Food, Biochemistry, 
Physiology, Biostatistics and Community Nutrition.

EXPERIENCE

Five (5) years of full-time professional experience in the field of 
Nutrition or Dietetics, at least three (3) years of which must have 
been as a Nutritionist in an administrative, consultative, or supervisory
capacity in the State, federal, or community nutrition program.

CERTIFICATION:

NOTE: Appointees must possess a current and valid Certification as 
a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) 
issued by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics.

LICENSE

Appointee will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license valid in 
New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee 
mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of the current science and practice of Nutrition and 
of the standard of practice in Clinical Nutrition.

Knowledge of policies, procedures, standards, and regulations 
basic to health care facilities.

Knowledge of training aids, methods, and practices used in 
professional-level training programs.

Ability to assimilate a broad spectrum of information in order to 
conceptualize relevant elements of program management.

Ability to implement plans and execute decisions.

Ability to use a problem solving approach to decision making, 
while considering the impact of alternative solutions.

Ability to interpret, evaluate, and utilize pertinent, current research 
related to nutritional care.

Ability to compile or develop educational materials and to present 
formal and informal nutrition education for professionals.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships 
with those interested or involved in the work of the unit.

Ability to maintain essential records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office or 
related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American 
Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as 
they can perform the essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made 
because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
may not be eligible.

 
This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote61451SCNL32N/A&32-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 7/27/2013

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: A Doctorate in Nutrition with a graduate course in Food, Biochemistry, Physiology, Biostatistics and Community Nutrition.
A Doctorate in Nutrition with a graduate course in Food, Biochemistry, Physiology, Biostatistics and Community Nutrition.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is absolutely required for the position of Director of Clinical Nutrition. The educational requirement specified is a Doctorate in Nutrition with graduate coursework in areas like Food, Biochemistry, Physiology, Biostatistics, and Community Nutrition. Additionally, five years of relevant professional experience in Nutrition or Dietetics is needed, with at least three years in an administrative, consultative, or supervisory role within a nutrition program. Furthermore, a valid Certification as a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) issued by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics is required. These requirements highlight the necessity of advanced education and specialization in the field of nutrition for this role.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess a current and valid Certification as a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) issued by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies a requirement for a Doctorate in Nutrition, which is a significant barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Additionally, there is a requirement for at least three years of experience as a nutritionist in an administrative, consultative, or supervisory capacity in a relevant program, which could also be a barrier for those without a higher education degree as it may be more challenging to obtain such experience without one. Furthermore, the job requires certification as a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN), which typically also requires a degree.

name: Principal Biologist
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 PRINCIPAL BIOLOGIST (TRANSPORTATION) 

DEFINITION

Under the direction of a Supervising Engineer or other supervisor officer in the
Environmental Control Section, Bureau of Quality Control, Department of 
Transportation, supervises and/or makes field investigations and surveys and 
performs the more complex studies on the surface waters in terms of biological 
environment for use in transportation studies, correlates data from observations 
and review of existing scientific literature for inclusion in transportation related 
technical Water Quality Reports; does related work as required.

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Supervises and/or performs the field investigations required to evaluate the quality
of surface water in terms of the total biological environment for use in transportation
related environmental studies.

Supervises and/or performs the correlations of data from observations and review of 
existing scientific literature and prepares clear, sound, accurate, and informative 
biological reports on assigned studies and investigation, including findings, 
conclusions and recommendations for inclusion in transportation related technical 
Water Quality Reports.

Assigns, instructs and participates in the collecting and analyzing of benthic samples 
to determine pre and post-construction conditions of various aquatic environments. 
Erects, instructs and performs laboratory and field studies of samples collected from 
streams, lakes, impoundments, estuaries, ocean waters, ground water, domestic and 
industrial wastewaters to determine the quality of such water and the effects of actual or 
potential pollutants upon the aquatic biota.

Direct and prepare wildlife population estimates.

Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility for
effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or disciplining of 
employees.

Identifies fish and aquatic plant species.

Collects records and analyzes limnological data.

Reviews scientific and other literature on the methods for water pollution control or in 
controlling undesirable biological conditions.

Supervises and/or performs surveys of estuarine bio tapes designed to inventory existing populations.

Supervises the requisitioning, safeguarding, recording and proper use of equipment, 
materials and supplies used in biologic investigation.

Supervises the maintenance of essential records and files.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorï¿½s degree in biological 
science.

EXPERIENCE:

Three (3) years of professional experience in the study of aquatic or benthic organisms, 
one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

 NOTE: A Masterï¿½s degree in Biological Science may be substituted for one year
of experience.

 NOTE:  A doctorate in Biological Science may be substituted for the three years 
of indicated experience.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the 
operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential 
duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Thorough knowledge of biometrics and methods and procedures used in performing 
biological studies of surface water, wastewaters, and potable water supplies as related 
to transportation projects.

Ability to acquire thorough knowledge of environmental laws and the administrative 
techniques involved in planning and supervising the biologic phases of water quality 
report preparation.

Thorough knowledge of estuarine population dynamics.

Ability to acquire thorough knowledge of the functions of other related state, interstate 
and Federal agencies, and academic, public and private groups.

Ability to supervise the work operations and/or functional programs and has responsibility
 for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or disciplining of employees.

Ability to identify fish, invertebrates and aquatic plants.

Ability to supervise and/or prepare sound, accurate and informative reports on biologic 
investigations containing finding, conclusions and recommendations.

Ability to determine practical methods necessary to resolve biologic problems of water 
pollution that may arise from transportation related construction activity.

Ability to meet and work with official agencies of government, the academic sector and 
the general public with respect to Bureau programs.

Ability to present factual data as a witness for the State and to give testimony under oath 
in court and at hearing.

Ability to supervise and maintenance essential records and files.

Ability to supervise and/or plan aquatic biologic studies, surveys, inventories and 
investigations.

Good health and freedom from disabling physical and mental defects which would 
impair the proper performance of the required duties or which might endanger the health 
and safety of oneself or others.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to 
perform the duties of this position. American Sign Language or braille may also be 
considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform 
the essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to their 
known limitations. If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause 
the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote01744CTransportationSC4E25N/AR26-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 3/26/79

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorï¿½s degree in biological science.
A Masterï¿½s degree in Biological Science may be substituted for one year of experience.
A doctorate in Biological Science may be substituted for the three years of indicated experience.

alternativeQualifications: Master's degree substituting for one year of experience
Doctorate degree substituting for three years of experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation:
The job description for the Principal Biologist (Transportation) position requires applicants to have a Bachelor's degree in biological science, indicating that a degree is mandatory for this role. The requirement is not just a mere preference but a formal educational requirement.

However, the job description also outlines alternative qualifications that can offset some of the experience requirements. Specifically, a Master's degree in Biological Science can substitute for one year of the necessary professional experience, and a Doctorate in Biological Science can substitute for three years of the required experience. These provisions demonstrate that alternative qualifications are recognized and can compensate for the experience component of the job requirements. Therefore, both the requirements of a mandatory degree and the acceptance of alternative qualifications are supported by the job description.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job, as the minimum requirement is a Bachelor's degree in biological science. However, a Master's degree or a Doctorate in Biological Science can substitute for some or all of the required experience. This enhances qualifications but is not mandatory for consideration for the position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies a requirement for graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in biological science, which acts as a barrier to hiring applicants who do not possess a college or university degree. Additionally, the option to substitute a Master's degree or a doctorate for experience also implies the necessity for advanced degrees, further solidifying the educational barrier.

name: Administrative Analyst 1

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by twenty-one (21) semester hour credits in any combination of Accounting, Business Administration, Economics or Finance courses
Possession of a master's degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics or Finance

alternativeQualifications: Five (5) years of professional experience in work involving fiscal analyses and evaluation, budgeting, and management operations in government, business, and/or a management consulting firm, including or supplemented by twenty-one (21) semester hour credits in any combination of Accounting, Business Administration, Economics or Finance courses

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as there are multiple pathways to qualify. Applicants can meet the requirements through a combination of professional experience and relevant education or through holding a bachelor's or master's degree in specified fields such as Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, or Finance. A degree can be advantageous, particularly a master's degree, but substantial relevant professional experience can also fulfill the requirements.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description requires applicants to have either five years of professional experience in relevant work involving fiscal analyses, budgeting, and management operations, including or supplemented by 21 semester hour credits in specific courses, or a bachelor's or master's degree in specific fields with additional experience requirements. This implies a barrier to those without a college or university degree, as they must have significant professional experience and supplementary educational credits to qualify.

name: Director Of Budget And Fiscal Analysis
Director Of Quality Assurance
text:
Job Specification 00619 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 00619  

DIRECTOR OF QUALITY ASSURANCE

  

DEFINITION


       Under direction of the Chief Executive Officer, at a psychiatric
  facility in the Department of Human Services, has responsibility for
  developing and managing all components of the institutional quality
  assurance system and administrative supervision of Program Evaluation,
  Utilization Review, Risk Management, Pre-Accreditation Review, Medical
  Records, Management Information System, Discipline Standards, and
  Professional Growth and Development; performs related duties as
  required.

  
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


       In a staff capacity with the Chief Executive Officer and in close
  collaboration and cooperation with the Assistant Hospital Administrator
  and Clinical Director and/or Medical Director, is responsible for
  developing, implementing, and monitoring a quality assurance program in
  conformity with regulations of Titles 5: 18: 19 of Public Law 89-97 and
  amendments thereto; Titles 20: 45: and JCAH Standards, P.S.R.O.
  regulations, division, department, and hospital policies.

       Develops, implements, and monitors a facilitywide Quality
  Assurance Program that incorporates essential elements of the above
  functional areas.  The incumbent is responsible for developing and
  updating a Quality Assurance Plan in accordance with accreditation
  standards of JCAH, HHS, and the State of New Jersey.

       Establishes required linkages with the administrative, clinical,
  medical, and social rehabilitation components of the program.  Through
  an executive level committee including representatives of major
  clinical staff, the incumbent is responsible for assuring that
  executive level staff are fully involved and knowledgeable of the
  objectives of the plan that relate to their areas of responsibility.

       Quality Assurance activities include, but are not limited to, the
  following:  Utilization Review Program, over and under utilization of
  services and facilities; Program Analysis Services Systems (PASS),
  qualitative evaluation and monitoring of human services programs in
  keeping with the principles of normalization; Psychiatric medical audit
  systems, including a high quality retrieval system; Individual Care
  Reviews related to Morbidity/Mortality, Medical Records Deficiencies,
  Risk Management Program (Safety Program, liability claims, therapeutic
  programs) and other programs and committees.

       Develops, maintains, and disseminates complete and current
  information on all internal and external policies, rules, and
  regulations related to the various types of Medicaid and JCAH surveys
  and performance of the Utilization Review, Program Evaluation,
  Professional Growth and Development, Discipline Standards, and Medical
  Records functioning.  The incumbent serves as arbiter, standards
  reviewer, resource, and consultant to top level administrative and
  clinical staff on matters related to these areas.

       Is responsible for, or coordinates and monitors all facilitywide
  work plans related to Medicaid, JCAH, and Division of Mental Health
  Services surveys.  The incumbent works with appropriate staff to
  interpret plans, establish deadlines, and assure that such deadlines
  are met.

       Coordinates and monitors all facilitywide plans of corrections
  related to survey findings of Medicaid, JCAH, Federal Department of
  Health and Human Services (HHS), the Departments of Health and Human
  Services, and the Bureau of Standards and Inspections of the Division
  of Mental Health Services.  The incumbent works with appropriate
  program, support, regional, and central office staff to develop such
  plans, monitor their implementation, and ensure that the surveying
  bodies are apprised of the corrective action taken.

       Coordinates staff development and integration of staff training
  programs with the facility Quality Assurance Program.  Where Residency
  Training Programs exist, the incumbent is responsible for coordinating
  closely with the Medical Director to assure that the needs of the
  Residency Training Program are fully met.

       Plans, organizes, and assigns the work of the organizational unit
  and evaluates employee performance and conduct, enabling the effective
  recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of
  subordinates.

       Is responsible through the discipline heads for the establishment
  and monitoring of professional standards for patient care and service,
  that quality treatment is provided, and that professional standards are
  met.

       Is responsible for the privileging and credentialing process
  consistent with clinical staff rules and regulations/by-laws in
  conjunction with the Clinical/Medical Director(s).

       Maintains hospital and clinician performance indices which are
  utilized and incorporated into the clinical privileging process.
  Ensures development and implementation of corrective action through a
  staff education program, policy development and through recurrent
  evaluations.

       Recommends to the Chief Executive Officer the appropriate
  structure and membership of quality assurance committees, including
  Utilization Review, Medical Records, Accreditation and other such
  committees as shall be deemed necessary.

       Annually assesses the Quality Assurance Plan, reviews it, makes
  necessary modifications, and develops written criteria which will be
  used to measure compliance with achieved goals and to assess areas of
  noncompliance or problems.  Takes necessary action in response to
  problems to include education and training policy development, staff
  utilization, plant and equipment changes, and/or adjustment of
  professional provisions.

       Develops a quality assurance program which will identify problems
  together with a mechanism for setting priorities for investigative and
  objective analysis through the use of specification standards and
  adequate sampling.

       Prepares, coordinates, implements, and monitors all facilitywide
  plans of correction related to survey findings, problems analysis
  reports, safety and incident issues.  The incumbent works with
  appropriate program, support, regional, and central office staff to
  develop such plans, monitors their implementation, and ensures that the
  surveying bodies are apprised of the corrective action taken.

       Trains clinicians and support personnel in quality assessment
  techniques including criteria development, data retrieval and display,
  data analysis, preparation of problem analysis reports, and
  confidentiality of quality assurance data.  Coordinates these
  activities with staff development and training programs to assure the
  integration of staff training programs with the Quality Assurance
  Program.

       Assists department heads in investigating problems, determining
  action, and preparation of analysis reports.

       Monitors discipline standards for patient care and services to
  ensure that quality treatment is provided and that professional
  standards are met, and ensures development and implementation of
  corrective action through staff education program and policy
  development and evaluations.

       Supervises and coordinates the Quality Assurance activities of the
  Quality Assurance Committee and gives direction and guidance to members
  of other departments, units, sections, services, and disciplines in
  relation to Quality Assurance.  Establishes the Data Collection System
  or the Quality Assurance Activities of the Quality Assurance Plan and
  ensures that they are congruent with other data/ computer/retrieval
  systems within the facility organization and the division and the
  Department.  Develops any specific systems needed for the Quality
  Assurance function within the facility.

       Serves as a resource in Quality Assurance techniques, theories,
  standards, criteria, regulations, and provides Quality Assurance
  information, research, or resources as requested and required.

       Supervises and coordinates the Quality Assurance activities of the
  Quality Assurance Steering Committee and gives direction and guidance
  to members of other departments, units, sections, services, and
  disciplines in relation to Quality Assurance mandates.  Establishes a
  Data Collection System to support the information needs of Quality
  Assurance activities and ensures that it is congruent with other
  data/computer/retrieval systems within the facility organization, and
  the division and the department.  Develops specific systems needed to
  support the Quality Assurance function within the facility.

       Assures that facility goals, objectives, standards and policies
  and procedures are congruent with those standards and requirements of
  the accreditating, approving, governing, and/or reviewing bodies
  relative to the best possible patient care and the Quality Assurance
  Plan.

       Is responsible for developing a system to monitor all Quality
  Assurance Activities within the facility and is responsible for the
  implementation of the monitoring system as it relates to the Table of
  Organization and the administrative, supervisory, clinical, and
  organizational structure of the facility.

       Directs the establishment and maintenance of essential records.

       Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
  and/or manual recording and computerized information system used by the
  agency, office, or related units.

  REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

           A Doctoral degree from an accredited college in a mental
  health discipline, Public Health Administration, or Hospital
  Administration.

                                    or

           A valid license to practice medicine in the State of New
  Jersey.

       EXPERIENCE:

           Five (5) years of experience in mental health-related
  research, teaching, or the provision and/or administration of mental
  health services, including two (2) years of supervisory experience.

                                    and

           Two (2) years experience in human services quality assurance
  programs consisting of some of the following areas:  program
  evaluation, utilization review, accreditation compliance, discipline
  standards, medical records, professional growth and development
  service, standards compliance or their equivalent.

           NOTE: A Master's degree from an accredited college in a
  mental health discipline, Public Health Administration, or Hospital
  Administration supplemented by two (2) additional years of experience
  in mental health related research, teaching, or the provision and/or
  administration of mental health services may be substituted for the
  Doctoral degree.

       LICENSE:

           Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license
  valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than
  employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the
  position.

  KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

       Knowledge of the principles and procedures required to perform
  quality assurance in Mental Health systems.

       Knowledge of the laws, regulations, responsibilities, standards,
  policies, and programs of state mental health and quality assurance
  systems after a period of training.

       Knowledge of modern program evaluation practices including the
  establishment and monitoring of a thorough and effective management
  information system.

       Knowledge of and the ability to establish quality assurance
  standards consistent with JCAH, HHS, and State Department of Health,
  and Department of Human Services mandates after a period of training.

       Knowledge of utilization and review and medical records
  requirements, and the ability to organize staff to implement new and
  improved plans.

       Knowledge of the laws, rules, regulations, responsibilities,
  standards, policies, and programs of the federal mental health and
  quality assurance systems.

       Ability to supervise a staff in quality assurance, in establishing
  and monitoring a management information system, and in performing both
  long and short range planning.

       Ability to analyze and interpret basic laws and regulations and to
  apply these to specific problems.

       Ability to make comprehensive based policy decisions affecting the
  operations of a psychiatric hospital and the Division of Mental Health
  Services.

       Ability to plan and supervise the conduct of needed surveys,
  studies, and investigations, and to prepare and supervise the
  preparation of reports.

       Ability to establish and maintain cooperative work relationships
  with federal, state and local officials, physicians, and the
  representatives of local health, welfare, education, and civic groups.

       Ability to give speeches before lay and professional groups, and
  to prepare required written material.

       Ability to compose detailed correspondence and to prepare clear,
  sound, accurate, and informative reports on mental health programs.

       Ability to direct the establishment and maintenance of essential
  records and files.

       Ability to conduct workshops, study groups, and other training
  activities in quality assurance.

       Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or
  manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
  related units.

       Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
  English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American
  Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
  communication.

       Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
  as they can perform the essential functions of the job after reasonable
  accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If the accommodation
  cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such
  persons may not be eligible.

  CODES:  M33-00619                  ECK                     5/23/95

alternativeQualifications: A valid license to practice medicine in the State of New Jersey

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation:
The job description clearly states the education requirements for the Director of Quality Assurance position, specifying either a Doctoral degree in a relevant discipline or a valid license to practice medicine in New Jersey. It also allows for a substitution of a Master's degree with additional experience for the Doctoral degree. This indicates that a specific level of formal education is mandatory, reflecting that the degree requirement is not only preferred but essential, thus aligning with the definition of a mandatory degree requirement.

Simultaneously, the job description includes a provision that substitutes a Doctoral degree with a Master's degree given additional experience. This provision exemplifies that alternative qualifications, in the form of experience, are acceptable in place of the stated formal education requirement. Hence, both the mandatory degree requirement and the potential for alternative qualifications being considered are evident from the job description.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: For the position of Director of Quality Assurance at a psychiatric facility in the Department of Human Services, a higher educational degree is absolutely required. The job requires a Doctoral degree from an accredited college in a mental health discipline, Public Health Administration, or Hospital Administration. Alternatively, a valid license to practice medicine in the State of New Jersey can substitute for the educational requirement. In addition, the role requires specialized experience in mental health-related fields, supervision, and human services quality assurance programs. The advanced educational background ensures that candidates possess the necessary theoretical knowledge, ability to develop and manage complex systems, and credibility in the mental health or medical fields.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: A valid license to practice medicine in the State of New Jersey.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that the position requires either a Doctoral degree from an accredited college in a mental health discipline, Public Health Administration, or Hospital Administration, or a valid license to practice medicine in the State of New Jersey. Alternatively, a Master's degree may be accepted if supplemented by additional experience. These educational requirements present a barrier to applicants who do not have a college or university degree.

name: Secretarial Assistant 1
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


SECRETARIAL ASSISTANT 1, NON-STENOGRAPHIC

DEFINITION:

Under supervision, provides secretarial, administrative and clerical support to an 
assigned assistant division director, bureau chief, or organizational equivalent; types 
correspondence and reports, prepares letters on routine matters, provides requested 
information to internal and external customers, maintains a schedule of appointments 
and the daily engagement calendar of the executive official; utilizes various information 
systems for daily work assignments used by the agency, office, or related units; does 
other related duties as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  A 
particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

NOTE:  Appointments may be made to positions requiring bilingual skills.

12505C - Bilingual in Spanish and English
SPECIAL SKILL
Applicants must be able to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in Spanish 
and English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.

24531C - Bilingual in Spanish and English
SPECIAL SKILL
Applicants must be able to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in Spanish 
and English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.

24531G - Bilingual in Spanish and English
SPECIAL SKILL
Applicants must be able to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in Spanish 
and English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Organizes assigned secretarial and administrative clerical work and develops effective 
work methods.

Types correspondence, reports, and recommendations of a confidential nature.

Reviews, sorts, and routes incoming correspondence.

Prepares letters on routine matters which may or may not be reviewed or signed by 
the executive official.

Obtains pertinent material from files and/or other sources; puts it into usable form 
for the review and use of the executive official.

Provides requested information to division personnel, representatives of state, local, 
and other groups, organizations, and agencies, and to the public in accordance with 
established policy.

May interview callers at the office.

Maintains a schedule of appointments and the daily engagement calendar of the 
executive official.

Prepares meeting agendas; types meeting minutes from notes or recording equipment.

Make arrangements for speaking engagements, travel, and for meetings, conferences, 
and hearings.

Maintains mailing lists and makes necessary revisions.

Prepares statistical and other reports.

Maintains confidential personal correspondence and other records and files, including 
a follow-up file.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EXPERIENCE:

Three (3) years of experience in secretarial and administrative clerical work.

NOTE:  Successful completion of a clerical training program with a minimum of 700 
classroom training hours or thirty (30) semester hour credits in secretarial science from 
an accredited college or university may be substituted for one (1) year of the experience 
indicated above. Course work must include typing skills, methods, and procedures; other 
courses may include, but not be limited to, office procedures, word processing, and 
business English.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the 
operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential 
duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of secretarial, clerical, and other office routines, procedures, and practices, 
and their application to specific situations.

Knowledge of basic computer applications.

Knowledge of commonly used data processing and office applications.

Ability to read and interpret department regulations, programs, standards, and 
procedures.

Ability to accurately type correspondence and reports.

Ability to act as confidential secretary to an executive official.

Ability to organize secretarial work, sometimes of a confidential nature.

Ability to use correct English, to spell correctly, and to use correct sentence and 
paragraph structure.

Ability to communicate with visitors, schedule appointments, and process requests 
for information in accordance with established procedures.

Ability to prepare statistical and other reports.

Ability to prepare correspondence.

Ability to multitask.

Ability to learn, understand, and readily adapt to the computer systems used by 
the agency.

Ability to create mail merges, PowerPoint presentations for daily assignments.

Ability to maintain confidential, follow-up, and other records and files.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently 
to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign Language or Braille may also 
be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform essential 
functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation 
cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code(s) whichare different work week or work month and/or variants of the job class title:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote12505CNon StenographicSC4016N/AA17-24531CNon-StenographicSC3516N/AA15-24531GNon-Steno/Bilingual In Spanish & EngSC3516N/AA15-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 11/21/2020

alternativeQualifications: Three (3) years of experience in secretarial and administrative clerical work

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job requires three years of experience in secretarial and administrative clerical work. However, completion of a clerical training program or thirty semester hours in secretarial science from an accredited college or university can substitute for one year of experience, but it is not mandatory to have a degree. The focus is on relevant experience and skills, such as typing, office procedures, and computer applications.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description includes a note that allows for a substitution of one year of the required experience with either a clerical training program with a minimum of 700 classroom training hours or thirty semester hour credits in secretarial science from an accredited college or university. While this does not completely bar candidates without a degree, it suggests that having college education in secretarial science could be advantageous in fulfilling the experience requirement. This could pose a barrier for applicants who do not have a college degree or have not completed a clerical training program.

name: Contract Administrator 3

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a master's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Public Health, Public or Hospital Administration or Social Work

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience involving contract/grant work, project financing, construction management, financial administration, social services administration, and/or budget and management operations of a government or business entity, at least two (2) years of which shall have involved responsibility for some aspect of contract/grant work administration.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: Based on the job description, a higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the position of Contract Administrator 3. The job requires a combination of professional experience and education. Individuals can qualify with eight years of professional experience related to contract/grant work, construction management, or financial administration, including two years of specific responsibility in contract/grant work administration. Alternatively, candidates with a bachelor's degree can qualify with four years of the required experience, and those with a relevant master's degree can qualify with three years of experience. Therefore, the position allows for equivalent combinations of education and experience, meaning a higher degree is not mandatory if sufficient professional experience is present.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description includes several potential barriers for applicants who do not have a college or university degree:

1. Experience Requirement: Applicants must have eight years of professional experience in relevant fields, which is relatively high and may exclude those who have gained experience through less traditional routes.

2. Education Requirement: Possession of a bachelor's or master's degree can substitute for a portion of the required experience, which advantages those with higher education qualifications over those without.

3. Professional Experience: The type of "professional experience" required involves specialized knowledge and authority to act independently, which may be harder to acquire without formal education.

These requirements suggest that while it is possible to qualify for the position through experience alone, the emphasis on professional experience and the ability to substitute education for some of that experience could pose a barrier for those without a college or university degree.

This implies that a higher educational degree, specifically a bachelor's degree, is not absolutely required for this job, as equivalent work experience can also satisfy the requirements.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description presents a potential barrier for applicants without a college or university degree, as it requires either five years of professional experience in workers compensation, negligence, or claims investigation, or possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university combined with one year of professional experience. This requirement inherently prioritizes candidates with higher education by giving them a pathway to qualify with less professional experience, which could be seen as an obstacle for those who might have relevant experience but lack a degree.

name: Emergency Response Specialist 4
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


EMERGENCY RESPONSE SPECIALIST  4
	
DEFINITION

Under general supervision of a Bureau Chief or higher level supervisory 
official in the Emergency Management Program, Department of 
Environmental Protection, responds to emergencies for the purpose 
of assessing environmental impacts including hazardous substances, 
materials and chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, explosive 
(CBRNE), acts of terrorism and acts of nature (i.e.: hurricanes, snow, 
floods, droughts, etc.) as well as functioning as departmental On Scene 
Coordinator and National Incident Management System (NIMS) Incident 
Command Representative during activation of the State Emergency 
Operations Center with other responding agencies; supervises staff in 
the course of official duties; assists with administering and supervising 
grants and budget expenditures; during emergency response has authority 
to authorize expenditures from the New Jersey Spill Fund; as representative 
for DEP, coordinates with other State, County and Local governmental 
agencies for emergency response planning; coordinates with other chemical, 
biological, radiological, nuclear, explosive (CBRNE) teams as assigned; 
responsible for representing the Bureau on various committees to plan and 
explain DEP policies and procedures in regards to Emergency Response; 
functions as the Departmental Incident Command representative at the 
Command/General staff level during emergencies; is responsible for the 
issuance of complete and comprehensive incident reports; provides emergency 
services for people, water, land and structures within the State; supervises staff 
and work activities; prepares and signs official performance evaluations for 
subordinate staff; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The following examples of work are for illustrative purposes only. A 
particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Under the general direction of a higher level supervisor responds to, 
administers, and/or supervises responses to emergencies on a 24 hour, 
sever (7) day a week basis.

Supervises the work operations and has the responsibility for employee 
evaluations and for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, 
demoting and/or disciplining of employees.

Supervises the preparation of timely and technically accurate reports 
regarding responses to discharges and/or releases of hazardous substances, 
hazardous materials, (and) chemical, biological, nuclear, radiological, explosive, 
and acts of nature (i.e. snow, floods, droughts, etc.)

Functions as the Department representative during activation of the State 
Emergency Operations Center and facilitates agency actions during 
emergencies of any type.  Works under the direction of the DEP's Emergency 
Response Coordinator.

Supervises the completion of investigative and incident reports regarding 
environmental emergencies to ensure compliance with State environmental 
laws and regulations; and may review and evaluate incident reports of 
Emergency Response Specialists of lower rank.

Utilizes and/or supervises the utilization of field monitoring equipment to 
assess environmental conditions for potential health and safety hazards, 
often in a hazardous environment.

Prepares and/or supervises the preparation of evidence for use in court 
actions and hearings associated with the enforcement of federal, state 
and local environmental regulations.

Supervises the training of Emergency Response Specialists for each 
assigned task.

During emergency situations, (is) responsible for maintaining and updating 
management as per established procedures and DEP's Centralized 
Communications Center-Trenton Dispatch as necessary.

Maintains a calm attitude during emergencies for the purpose of ensuring 
response action is taken without undue delay.

Participates in and supervises the development and oversight of unit budget 
including grants and expenditures.

Participates in and supervises meetings, hearings, conferences, seminars, 
training sessions and other gatherings associated with assigned duties.

Trained in the use of the National Incident Management System (NIMS) 
during emergencies.

Required to work under varying conditions.

Prepares and/or supervises the preparation of correspondence in the 
course of official duties.

Maintains and, as required, supervises the maintenance of essential 
records and files.

Will be required to learn and to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office or 
related units.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's 
degree in one of the physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical 
sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, 
or engineering.

NOTE:   Possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued 
by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land 
Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in engineering.

EXPERIENCE

Five (5) years of professional and/or technical experience involving 
emergency response field activities associated with environmental 
or atmospheric conditions which pose potential public health hazards 
and/or significant adverse environmental effects, especially those 
involving potentially acute hazards, two (2) years must have been in 
a supervisory capacity with direct supervision of staff.

NOTE:  A Master's degree in a physical science, biological science, 
chemical science, environmental science, environmental studies, 
engineering, public health, may be substituted for one (1) year of the 
non-supervisory experience.

LICENSE

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
New Jersey. 

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Appointees will be required to have completed the following Incident 
Command System (ICS) courses or equivalent Federal Emergency 
Management Agency (FEMA) approved courses: 

               ICS 100 ï¿½ Introduction to ICS
               ICS 200 ï¿½ ICS for Single Resources and Initial Action Incidents
               ICS 300 ï¿½ Intermediate ICS for Expanding Incidents
               ICS 400 ï¿½ Advanced ICS
               IS 700 ï¿½ National Incident Management System (NIMS), An Introduction
               IS 800 ï¿½ National Response Framework (NRF), An Introduction

Appointees will be required to carry a communication device and must be 
able to respond to emergencies on a 24 hour, 7 day a week basis.

Appointees will be required to establish residence in a geographic region 
assigned area within six (6) months of permanent appointment as defined 
by the Program. 

Appointee must be capable of using assigned equipment and performing 
the essential functions of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of the principles, techniques and methodologies utilized in 
emergency response field activities associated with environmental or 
atmospheric conditions which pose potential public health and/or 
environmental significance with particular emphasis on those involving 
potential acute hazards.

Knowledge of New Jersey and Federal laws and the rules, regulations, 
policies, procedures and standards of the Departmentï¿½s Emergency 
Management Program for all aspects of emergency response after a 
period of training.

Knowledge of the relationship and coordination required at state, county 
and local levels as well as with other intra and interstate, and federal 
agencies concerned with or responsible for emergency response 
programs relating to the discharge and/or release of hazardous substances, 
(and) hazardous materials, and chemical, biological or nuclear/radiological 
releases.

Knowledge of the concepts and principles of environmental investigations 
and sampling techniques; and of the use and calibration of specific 
equipment and recording, measuring and testing devices used in monitoring 
and assessing environmental conditions during periods of emergency.

Knowledge of supervisory techniques.

Knowledge of the use of a Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus and other 
personal safety equipment and direct its use.

Knowledge of the use, understanding and preparation of maps, charts and 
diagrams for incident responses, reports and courtroom exhibits.

Knowledge of and the ability to use the National Incident Management System 
(NIMS) and the ability to function as the department representative as either 
command or staff function as directed by Emergency Response Coordinator.

Ability to acquire knowledge of the legal requirements and procedures for 
collecting samples and of their proper storage and transportation after a 
period of training.

Ability to read, interpret and apply the laws, rules and regulations relating 
to the environmental parameters of the State of New Jersey.

Ability to maintain a calm attitude during periods of stress and emergency 
for the purpose of ensuring response action is taken without undue delay.

Ability to organize technical and supervisory work, and develop appropriate 
work methods for assigned emergency response program area.

Ability to prepare incident reports regarding environmental and/or atmospheric 
conditions which pose potential public health and/or environmental significance, 
especially those involving potential acute hazards; and the ability to review and 
evaluate incidents reports of other Emergency Response Specialists.

Ability to effectively implement and follow established safety rules, precautions, 
policies and procedures in work assignments.

Ability to assist in the training of other Emergency Response Specialists.

Ability to prepare and/or supervise the preparation of clear, technically sound, 
accurate and informative reports containing findings, conclusions and 
recommendations.

Ability to communicate effectively. 

Ability to prepare and/or supervise the preparation of clear, accurate and 
concise correspondence in the course of official duties.

Ability to maintain and/or supervise the maintenance of essential records 
and files.

Ability to supervise assigned staff and plan, organize, and implement 
projects within the unit.

Ability to learn (and) to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office or related 
units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign 
Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms 
of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
they can perform essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made 
because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote15875SCN430N/AS31-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 3/5/2016

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, or engineering.

A Master's degree in a physical science, biological science, chemical science, environmental science, environmental studies, engineering, public health, may be substituted for one (1) year of the non-supervisory experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree, specifically a Bachelor's degree in fields such as physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, public health, or engineering, is required for this job. This education provides foundational knowledge necessary to assess environmental impacts and manage emergencies involving hazardous substances and acts of nature. The degree equips professionals with methodological skills and technical expertise critical for emergency response roles. Additionally, a Professional Engineer's license can be substituted for an engineering degree, highlighting the necessity for specialized technical knowledge. Therefore, the requirement of a higher educational degree is deemed necessary for fulfilling the responsibilities of this position effectively.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession of a valid Professional Engineer's license issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in engineering.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description includes a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Specifically, it requires graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in specified fields, such as physical sciences, biological sciences, chemical sciences, environmental sciences, environmental studies, public health, or engineering. This requirement may prevent individuals without a degree from being considered for the position. Additionally, while there is a note that a valid Professional Engineer's license can substitute for the Bachelor's degree in engineering, this substitution also involves a professional qualification that typically follows a degree. Therefore, the educational requirement is a barrier for applicants lacking a college or university degree.

name: Laboratory Technician
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


LABORATORY TECHNICIAN

                         ALL JURISDICTIONS
 
 DEFINITION:

 Under direction of a supervisory official, does and assists  with
 laboratory   technical  work  in  a  chemical,   bacteriological,
 venereal disease control, animal industry, hospital, institution,
 research,  forensic,  or  other laboratory;  does  other  related
 duties as required.

 NOTE: The  examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes  only.  A particular position using this title  may  not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Receives,  unpacks,  and  opens specimens containing  Conococcus,
 Vincent=s  Angina, malaria, diphtheria, and other  organisms  and
 materials, and puts samples into various media according to  type
 of organisms suspected.

 Gives assignments and instructions to laboratory service workers,
 senior  laboratory  service  workers,  or  other  nonprofessional
 workers, and supervises the performance of their work.

 Sets  up  tubes  with  various dilutions of serums  for  possible
 undulant fever, typhus, tularemia, and other suspected infections
 with their specific antigens.

 May  assist  in all procedures involved in making required  tests
 and analyses.

 Makes smears and stains specimens of sputum preparatory to
 the microscopic examination of such specimens.

 Prepares racks with proper media for use in testing water,  milk,
 sewage, and various other types of samples.

 May prepare culture media, reagents, stains, and stock solutions.

 Pipettes or pours correct dilution or other medium into each tube
 or dish and, after proper incubation period, makes a reading  to
 determine total count.

 Determines total solids in water, sewage, and other samples and
 suspended  solids  in  sewage  samples  by  means  of  analytical
 balance.

 Makes complete  tests  for bacillus coli to determine possible
 contamination and pollution of water.

 Makes agglutination tests for brucellosis.

 Prepares blood specimens for serological examinations
 for syphilis, virological  tests, and for  agglutination tests
 for bacterial infections.

 Stains blood smears for opsonocytophagic tests and blood
 differential counts.

 Makes complete  blood counts, Widal tests,  blood  sedimentation
 tests, and bleeding and coagulation timing tests.

 Prepares reagents necessary for  Mazzini and Kahn tests for
 syphilis and makes such tests.

 Makes  technical analyses of samples of waters to determine their
 chemical content and qualities.

 Inoculates animals and makes autopsies.

 Makes basal metabolism, vital capacity, tuberculin, Patch, and
 Schick tests.

 Makes urinalyses.

 Receives, preserves, dehydrates, imbeds, blocks, cuts, and stains
 specimens  taken  at  autopsies and operations  for  histological
 sections and staining.

 Makes  spinal  fluid  examinations  including  leukocyte  counts,
 Mogushi's globulin tests, and Lange=s colloidal gold tests.

 Makes  blood, throat, and urine cultures, and cultures of various
 transudates and exudates.

 Prepares reports.

 Helps maintain records and files.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual  recording and information  systems used by
 the agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

 EDUCATION:

 Successful completion of 60 semester hour credits from an accredited 
 college or university which shall have included 24 semester hour credits 
 in the biological and/or physical sciences.

 NOTE:  Successful completion of a certificate program in Clinical 
 Laboratory Technology may be substituted for the above education.

 NOTE:  Applicants who do not possess the required credits or 
 certificate in Clinical Laboratory Technology may substitute two (2) years 
 of experience as a technician in a public health, hospital, clinical, or research 
 laboratory performing bacteriological, chemical, histological, serology, and/or 
 virological tests.

 LICENSE:

 Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
 New Jersey  only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than  employee
 mobility,  is necessary  to perform essential duties of the
 position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of chemistry, bacteriology, serology, or other field of
 knowledge involving extensive laboratory analyses.

 Knowledge of laboratory equipment, reagents, and techniques.

 Ability to analyze routine laboratory problems, organize assigned
 work, and develop effective work methods.

 Ability  to  make  varied routine laboratory analyses  of  varied
 types in accord with standard and prescribed procedures.

 Ability  to  observe precautions and to do the precise,  accurate
 work required in receiving, identifying, labeling, analyzing, and
 shipping samples.

 Ability  to  use  laboratory equipment, utensils, materials,  and
 supplies  in  such  a  manner as to avoid  unnecessary  breakage,
 deterioration, and loss.

 Ability to maintain records and files.

 Ability  to  utilize various types of electronic  and/or   manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office,  
 or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate  
 in English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.
 American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered  
 as acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they
 can perform essential functions of the job with or without reasonable 
 accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made because it 
 would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be 
 eligible.
