mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description for a Laboratory Technician in the State of New Jersey outlines specific educational requirements. It states that successful completion of 60 semester hour credits from an accredited college or university, including 24 semester hour credits in biological and/or physical sciences, is required. However, there are alternate pathways to fulfill this requirement. A certificate program in Clinical Laboratory Technology may be substituted for the education requirement. Additionally, applicants without the required credits or certificate can qualify by having two years of experience as a technician in a relevant laboratory setting. Therefore, a higher educational degree is not absolutely necessary as long as the applicant meets the required credits, holds a certificate, or has the requisite laboratory experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description requires either successful completion of 60 semester hour credits from an accredited college or university, including 24 semester hour credits in the biological and/or physical sciences, or a certificate in Clinical Laboratory Technology. However, it does offer a substitution option for those who do not possess the required credits or certificate, allowing for two years of relevant experience as a technician in a public health, hospital, clinical, or research laboratory. While this substitution provides an alternative pathway for those without a college or university degree, the requirement of two years of specific experience could still present a barrier for applicants who do not meet this criterion.

name: Secretary Of Agriculture
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE


DEFINITION:

Subject to applicable laws and in conformity with the rules, regulations, policies and 
standards of the State Board of Agriculture and, under the direction of the Governor, is 
responsible for administering Department of Agriculture regulatory, service and promotion 
functions.

The Secretary of Agriculture organizes, directs and supervises the eight divisions of the 
Department of Agriculture responsible for the following activities:

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only. A particular 
position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely,
all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

DIVISION OF ADMINISTRATION: 

Develop and present annual budget requests to provide staff and support for the attainment of 
Department objectives.

Maintain fiscal control though appropriate accounting procedures as required by the State 
Treasurer, Department policies, and Federal government standards when Federal funds are
involved.

Maintain a personnel program in accordance with Department of Civil Service policies and 
appropriate for Department of Agriculture requirements.

Provide general service programs including purchasing; property management, duplicating and 
data processing.

Administer the State Board of Agriculture Federal Loan Fund, which provides farm ownership and 
operating loans to qualified New Jersey residents.

DIVISION OF ANIMAL HEALTH:

Establish and maintain appropriate staff and methodology for the detection, control and/or 
eradication of diseases which are of economic importance to the livestock industry or 
transmissible to humans.

Enforce provisions of the Federal Wholesome Meat Act which requires the licensing and 
inspection of all meat and poultry meat slaughterers and processors to prevent the sale of 
unwholesome meat and meat products.

DIVISION OF AGRICULTURE CHEMISTRY:

Provide for the registration, inspection, qualitative and quantitative analyses of livestock feedstuffs, 
fertilizers, pesticides and liming materials to assure that consumers receive guaranteed contents.

DIVISION OF INFORMATION:

Compile and disseminate producer and consumer information concerning Department programs, 
New Jersey farm products and such other data considered of interest to the general public.

Advise and assist in the management and development of agricultural fairs, shows and exhibitions 
which provide educational opportunities for consumers, competitive shows for the improvement of 
livestock and crops, youth activities for vocational students and 4-H Club members, or industry 
promotion.
 
Coordinate the installation and maintenance of all State agency exhibits at the New Jersey State 
Fair.

DIVISION OF MARKETS:

Maintain farm product inspection programs to provide shipping point, terminal market, and platform 
inspections for the movement of those products under United States Department of Agriculture or 
New Jersey official grade standards.

Maintain a fresh egg inspection program to insure that consumers receive the grade and quality 
standard stated by the vendor.

Provide managerial assistance to cooperatives organized under New. Jersey statutes

Administer special farm commodity programs including the collection of taxes and the conduct of 
promotion and advertising campaigns.

Seek to expand market demands for New Jersey farm products through quality improvement 
programs at the producer level and continuous liaison with trade and government agencies using 
such products.

Compile and issue crop estimates, supply and price data to inform grousers, buyers and 
consumers, and so aid in orderly and efficient marketing.

Enforce the licensing and bonding laws concerning. Brokers, of perishable commodities.

DIVISION OF DAIRY INDUSTRY:

Compile appropriate economic data required to establish price and quality standard regulations to 
assure consumers a wholesome and adequate supply of milk,

Perform such investigations and inspections required to assure the orderly marketing of milk.

DIVISION OF PLANT INDUSTRY:

Establish and maintain appropriate staff and methodology for the detection and control of insect 
pests and diseases which threaten crops, forests, shade and ornamental plants.

Establish and maintain seed and plant certification programs to provide quality plant stock.

Provide for the registration, inspection, quantitative and qualitative analyses of seeds offered for 
sale in New Jersey to insure that the purchaser receives the varieties and. germination guaranteed.

DIVISION OF RUAL RESOURCES:

Maintain a program to provide technical assistance for conservation of the soil and water for 
agricultural purposes; for the installation of flood control and watershed projects; and to reduce 
sedimentation in New Jersey water supplies.

Conduct development of the State Soil Survey, an inventory of soil types and classes, for use by 
planners and engineers.

In cooperation with the Department of Community Affairs and the Department of Conservations 
and Economic Development, provide agricultural information to be used for the development of 
rural resources.

Conduct economic studies concerning agricultural production, marketing, and land use.

* * * *

The Department of Agriculture staff presently includes 240 permanent, 70 part-time and about 60 
seasonal employees. In addition, it annually recruits and supervises about 30 seasonal employees 
for the New Jersey Agricultural Society which serves as an agent of the Department to provide fruit 
and vegetable inspection services at processing plants.

The Department budget now totals about $4 million including State appropriations, 5 Federal 
funds, and 5 commodity tax accounts.

By virtue of his post, the Secretary of Agriculture is a member and must attend regular meetings of 
the following boards, commissions and authorities:

FOR THE GOVERNOR: 

Cabinet
Committee for Economic Opportunity
Advisory Committee on Rural Poverty 
Committee on Farmland Assessment
Interdepartment Committee on Encephalitis 
Interdepartment Committee on Pesticides

NATIONAL: 

National Advisory Committee, Agricultural Marketing Act 
National Advisory Committee for Meat Inspection
National Association of State Departments of Agriculture

STATE: 
Board of Managers, New Jersey Agricultural Experiment Station
New Jersey Apple Industry Council
New Jersey Asparagus Industry Council
New Jersey Migrant Labor Board
New Jersey Poultry Products Promotion Council
New Jersey. Public Health Association, Executive Board 
New Jersey Public Market Commission
New Jersey State 4-H Advisory Board
New Jersey State Soil Conservation Committee 
New Jersey Sweet Potato Commission
Rural Advisory Council
White Potato Industry Council of New Jersey

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothFalseExplanation: Based on the job description provided, there is no mention of a mandatory degree requirement or alternative qualifications for the position of Secretary of Agriculture. The job specification focuses on the responsibilities and functions of the role, such as organizing divisions, maintaining programs, and participating in committees, but does not state academic qualifications or alternative credentials needed for the role. Therefore, both DegreeRequirementStatus.isDegreeMandatory and DegreeRequirementStatus.hasAlternativeQualifications are determined to be False.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The position of Secretary of Agriculture requires a high level of expertise and leadership to administer and oversee various divisions within the Department of Agriculture. This role involves complex responsibilities such as budget development, fiscal management, enforcement of laws, coordination of agricultural programs, and participation in multiple boards and committees at state and national levels. Although the job description does not explicitly state that a higher educational degree is required, the nature and scope of work suggest that a thorough understanding of agricultural sciences, public administration, and regulatory processes is necessary. A higher educational degree would provide the foundational knowledge and analytical skills necessary for effective leadership and decision-making in this multifaceted role, making it highly beneficial if not implicitly required.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly list educational requirements, such as a college or university degree, for the position of Secretary of Agriculture. Therefore, there are no stated barriers related to not having a college or university degree.

name: Deaf And Hard Of Hearing Specialist Trainee

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of bachelorâs degree from an accredited college or university including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester hour credits in courses related to deafness and/or hearing loss

alternativeQualifications: Four (4) years of professional experience relevant to the position

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job description allows for a combination of relevant professional experience instead of a degree. While a bachelor's degree with specific coursework related to deafness and hearing loss is one way to meet the job requirements, individuals can also qualify by having four years of professional experience relevant to the position. Therefore, the emphasis is on either practical experience or academic qualifications, allowing for flexibility in meeting the job requirements. Additionally, specific certifications in interpreting and proficiency in American Sign Language are more critical for effectively performing the job duties.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess a National Associate of the Deaf Certificate (NAD), Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf Certificate (RID), National Interpreter Credentials (NIC) or similar certification may be required.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description presents several pathways to qualify for the position, potentially allowing applicants without a college or university degree to be considered. Specifically, it states that applicants must meet either a professional experience requirement or possess a bachelor's degree related to deafness and/or hearing loss. The experience requirement is "four (4) years of professional experience relevant to the position," which offers an alternative to having a degree. Therefore, there are no explicit barriers for applicants without a degree as long as they meet the professional experience requirement.

name: Clinical Laboratory Evaluator 1
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification
01783


CLINICAL LABORATORY EVALUATOR 1

DEFINITION

Under the direction of a supervisory official in the Department 
of Health and Senior Services, surveys, reviews, evaluates 
and documents the performance of licensed or certified clinical 
laboratories and/or blood banks performing testing of bodily 
specimens in such specialties as: clinical chemistry, 
clinical microbiology (bacteriology, mycobacteriology, 
virology, mycology, parasitology), hematology, immunology, 
cytology, and toxicology including radiobioassay procedures; 
does other related duties as required.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Visits private/public/hospital laboratories and/or blood banks 
throughout the state to evaluate the performance of laboratory 
tests and the collection, processing, storage and distribution of 
blood and provide consultation in all matters relevant to improving 
the quality of performance of laboratory tests and protecting the 
health and safety of blood donors and recipients in accordance 
with established program policies and state and federal statutes, rules 
and regulations.

Ensures participation of clinical laboratories and/or blood banks 
in approved programs and evaluates the testing of proficiency 
specimens and performance to determine compliance with state and 
federal rules and regulations.  

Evaluates the quality assurance plans and activities of clinical laboratories 
and/or blood banks to determine that provisions are in place and are 
monitored at established frequencies in order to ensure the accuracy
and reliability of test results and the health and safety of blood donors 
and recipients.

Reviews quality control programs that are in daily use within the various
clinical laboratory or blood bank procedures to assess compliance with 
applicable state and federal requirements.

Evaluates qualifications of laboratory or blood bank personnel and 
performance of clinical laboratories and blood banks to ensure compliance 
with federal/state standards.

Ensures that check sample production is timely/accurate and meets standards 
set forth in state and federal rules and regulations for the operation of clinical 
laboratories and blood banks.

Maintains detailed and accurate reports/records pertaining to all
work performed in various laboratories and/or blood banks.

Prepares clear, technically sound, accurate, and informative
reports of investigations/inspections.

Prepares correspondence in the course of official duties.

Reviews laboratory or blood bank records to ensure that the laboratory 
or blood bank has verified the manufacturerï¿½s performance 
specifications or established performance specifications for each test system.

Maintains close surveillance on all relevant literature, trends
of  thought,  and  new  developments  in  the  field  of  medical
technology and blood banking.

 Maintains records, reports, and files.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

 EDUCATION:

 Graduation from an accredited college or university with a
 Bachelorï¿½s degree in Medical Technology or a biological or
 chemical science which shall have included at least sixteen (16)
 semester hour credits in chemistry, sixteen (16) semester hour
 credits in the biological sciences, and three (3) semester hour
 credits in mathematics.

 NOTE: Possession of the qualifications of a   Medical
 Technologist as required under Federal Medicare Regulations
 Subpart M Part 405:1315, Chapter 3, Title 20 of the Code of
 Federal Regulations for coverage of services of independent
 laboratories or under NJAC 8:44-2.6 may be substituted for the
 above education.

 EXPERIENCE:

 Two (2) years of experience as a medical technologist in
 specialties including but not limited to chemistry, microbiology,
 hematology, immunology, and cytology in a private/public/hospital
 clinical   laboratory   which shall   have   included   training
 responsibilities.

 NOTE: A Masterï¿½s degree in Medical Technology or related
 field   may   be substituted for one (1) year of indicated
 experience.

 LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license
valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather
than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties
of the position.

American Society of Clinical Pathology (ASCP) certification as a 
medical technologist may be required for federally funded positions.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of principles of bacteriology, clinical chemistry,
serology, parasitology, cytology, hematology, mycology, and other
scientific fields of knowledge involving extensive laboratory
analyses/techniques    and    use    of    standard    laboratory
equipment/supplies/reagents.

Knowledge of existing federal and state regulations pertaining to  clinical
laboratories and/or blood banks and the ability to evaluate compliance to 
such standards after a period of training.

Knowledge of the purpose of varied tests routinely performed in a
clinical laboratory.

Knowledge   of the function and use of clinical laboratory
equipment in various specialties.

Knowledge of precautions to be taken in shipping/receiving all
types of specimens including procedures for
preserving/identifying such specimens.

Ability to detect errors in laboratory performance as a result of
onsite visits or review of proficiency test results.

Ability to analyze technical medical laboratory  problems,
organize assigned work, and develop effective work methods.

Ability to provide technical assistance to individuals and groups
of professional/paraprofessional laboratory or blood bank employees.

Ability to review laboratory and/or blood bank analyses/tests of varied
types in accord with standard and prescribed procedures.

Ability to prepare clear, scientifically sound, and accurate laboratory   
reports of tests/analyses containing findings, conclusions, and
recommendations.

Ability to maintain laboratory reports, records, and files.

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in
English   sufficiently to perform duties of this   position.
American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as
acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
as  they  can  perform  essential  functions  of  the  job  after
reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.   If
the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the
employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

CODES: 22/P22 - 0l783                 MCK                    04/30/05

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorâs degree in Medical Technology or a biological or chemical science
A Masterâs degree in Medical Technology or related field may be substituted for one (1) year of indicated experience.

alternativeQualifications: Qualifications of a Medical Technologist as per Federal Medicare Regulations or NJAC 8:44-2.6

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is required for this position as it specifies a Bachelor's degree in Medical Technology or a related biological or chemical science with specific credit requirements in chemistry, biological sciences, and mathematics, as well as qualifications as a Medical Technologist under federal Medicare and state regulations. Additionally, experience and possibly further certifications such as ASCP may be needed, indicating that the role demands a substantial educational background in the relevant scientific and medical fields to adequately fulfill its responsibilities.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription:
Appointees will be required to possess a driverâs license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

American Society of Clinical Pathology (ASCP) certification as a medical technologist may be required for federally funded positions.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description includes a requirement for a Bachelor's degree in Medical Technology or a related biological or chemical science with specified semester hour credits in certain subjects. While there is an alternative qualification mentioned (possession of the qualifications of a Medical Technologist as required under specific federal or NJ regulations), the primary education requirement presents a barrier to applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Additionally, there is a preference for a Master's degree as it may substitute for one year of required experience, which could further disadvantage those without higher academic credentials.

name: Right Of Way Research Analyst
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


RIGHT OF WAY RESEARCH ANALYST

DEFINITION

Under the direction of a Supervising Right of Way Research Analyst
 in the Department of Transportation, performs legal research in 
connection with right of way acquisition and prepares all documents 
pertaining thereto; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative 
purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not perform 
all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely, all duties 
performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Under supervision, prepares all legal documents pertaining to the 
acquisition of real property by means of condemnation, such as: 
complaints, lis pendens, declaration of taking, order for payment 
into court and for possession, order to show cause, and order for 
judgment and appointing commissioners.

In cases where a complaint requires an amendment, prepares notices 
of motion to amend the complaint, the amendment to the complaint, 
consent orders, stipulations, amended declarations of taking, amended 
lis pendens, order allowing amendment of the complaint.

In cases where settlement is reached by agreement, prepares an 
affidavit for withdrawal of funds on deposit with the Clerk of the Superior 
Court, together with an order allowing the withdrawal; when required, 
draw warrants to discharge a lis pendens of record.

Corresponds with attorneys and property owners when not represented 
by attorneys, in writing and discussion by telephone, or in person.

Effects liaison with the Title Bureau concerning title matters and with 
Department engineers concerning engineering matters.

Effects liaison with the Manager for coordination and documentation 
on sensitive cases.

Files legal documents with the court and with the County Clerk's office 
in the appropriate county.

Prepares all documents for an action in Specific Performance and 
prepares cases for trial as determined necessary by the Attorney 
General's office.

Prepares any and all necessary pleadings relating to possessory actions.

Transfers complete files to the Attorney General's office for litigation.

Prepares copies of complaints and related documents for service upon 
all parties and interests named in the complaint; transmits copies to the 
Title Bureau for service by Process Servers.

Works with the Office of the Attorney General in Department legal 
matters and prepares material for use in litigation in conjunction with 
the Office of the Attorney General.

Prepares and files affidavits of service.

Prepares publications for location of owners to be advertised in 
newspapers; prepares and files affidavits of inquiry into location 
of unknown owners.

Prepares correspondence.

Prepares clear, technically sound, accurate, and informative reports.

Maintains essential records, reports and files. 

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION

Graduation from an accredited law school. 

EXPERIENCE

Four (4) years of professional experience in the preparation of 
documents pertaining to the acquisition of right of way, which 
shall have included study and experience in legal research.

LICENSE

Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee 
mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of the practices and procedures of Right of Way 
acquisition and of the Right of Way organization and highway 
work flow.

Knowledge of the sources, documents, methods, and procedures 
involved in the acquisition of real property by means of condemnation.

Knowledge of the methods and procedures for filing documents with 
courts and county clerks' offices.

Ability to organize and complete research and related projects 
concerned with the acquisition of real property.

Ability to comprehend, analyze and interpret basic law, regulations, 
and procedures.

Ability to locate and brief court decisions, precedents, opinions, 
legal citations, and other legal material.

Ability to determine the compliance of Department procedures with 
those established by courts of law.

Ability to prepare material for hearings, reviews, determinations, 
and use in court.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships 
with those interested or involved with the work of the unit.

Ability to collect, interpret, and present information and data.

Ability to draft correspondence.

Ability to prepare clear, legally sound, accurate and informative 
reports containing findings, conclusions and recommendations.

Ability to maintain essential records and files.

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position. American Sign 
Language or braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of 
communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they 
can perform essential functions of the job with or without reasonable 
accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made because it 
would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be 
eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote57147SCN426N/AP27-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 6/15/2013

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited law school.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree, specifically graduation from an accredited law school, is absolutely required for the role of Right of Way Research Analyst. This requirement is necessary due to the intricate legal nature of the job, which involves performing legal research associated with right of way acquisition, preparing legal documents, and liaising with legal entities. The job requires comprehensive knowledge of legal practices, procedures, and documentation, which typically necessitates an advanced understanding of law provided by a law school education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description for the Right of Way Research Analyst position in the State of New Jersey specifies a requirement for graduation from an accredited law school. This requirement constitutes a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree, as it necessitates the completion of a law degree, which generally requires an undergraduate degree as a prerequisite.

name: Adjuster 2 Unsatisfied Claims And Judgment Fund

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, one (1) of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience performing investigations and/or adjustment of claims for the recovery of damages for injury or property damage resulting from the use of motor vehicles, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. Candidates can either have a bachelor's degree combined with three years of relevant experience (one year in a supervisory role) or seven years of professional experience, with one year in a supervisory capacity, to qualify. This allows individuals without a degree but with significant relevant experience to be eligible.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description outlines two pathways to meet the requirements: 

1. Seven (7) years of professional experience performing investigations and/or adjustment of claims, with one (1) year in a supervisory capacity.

2. Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of the professional experience mentioned, with one (1) year in a supervisory capacity.

While the first requirement allows for a candidate without a degree to qualify with extensive professional experience, the alternative option may pose a barrier for those without a degree. This could potentially limit the pool of applicants who rely on formal education rather than extensive experience. Additionally, the requirement that semester hour credits equate to relevant experience and the definition of "professional experience" may imply a preference for candidates with a degree or specific types of experience, potentially disadvantaging those who have gained relevant skills in different contexts or through non-traditional paths.

name: Chief Bureau Of Transportation Services

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and six (6) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

Possession of a Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Public Administration, Business Administration, Finance, or Management; and five (5) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

alternativeQualifications: Ten (10) years of professional experience in a large central service agency

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job of Chief Bureau of Transportation Services does not absolutely require a higher educational degree, as candidates can qualify through extensive professional experience alone. The requirements specify either ten years of relevant professional experience, or a combination of experience and a bachelor's or master's degree. Therefore, a higher educational degree is not mandatory if the candidate possesses the requisite professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description states that applicants must meet one of the following requirements: 

1. Ten years of professional experience in a large central service agency, with three years in a supervisory capacity.
2. A bachelor's degree and six years of relevant professional experience, with three years in a supervisory capacity.
3. A master's degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Finance, or Management, and five years of relevant professional experience, with three years in a supervisory capacity. 

The note specifies that thirty semester-hour credits are equivalent to one year of relevant experience.

These requirements suggest a barrier to applicants without a college or university degree because they would need ten years of specific professional experience, with three years in a supervisory role, to qualify. The absence of a degree requires a more extensive amount of experiential qualifications as opposed to the option with a degree.

name: Deputy Attorney General 5
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification
30465


DEPUTY ATTORNEY GENERAL 5

Unclassified
N.J.S.A. 11A:3-4(g)

DEFINITION:

Under direction of a Deputy Attorney General 1 or 2, or other 
supervisory official in Department of Law and Public Safety 
plans, participates in the legal representation of State 
departments or other entities prescribed by applicable statutes; 
conducts work concerned with the detection and prosecution 
of criminal activities; interprets and enforces law, regulations; 
participates in legal and related activities involving federal 
and local jurisdictions and other State entities; does other 
related work as required.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Provides legal advice and represents State departments 
and other entities to ensure protection of the bonafide 
interests of the State of New Jersey and of the publics served.

Prosecutes and/or participates in the prosecution of criminal 
and/or civil matters to produce results that are consistent with 
applicable law and with the Constitution of the United States.

Participates in the defense of civil matters and prepares 
required legal documents.

Prepares and/or participates in the preparation of formal 
and informal opinions, pleadings, trial and appellate briefs, 
legislative and legal memoranda, proposed legislation and 
revisions to various administrative publications. 

Conducts or participates in the conduct of legal research 
and/or investigations.

Conducts liaison activities with staff of various agencies 
and jurisdictions on legal and investigative matters.

Prepares correspondence and reports to apprise officials 
and members of the various publics served of conditions, 
progress, and accomplishments in areas of concern.

Coordinates the work activities of legal, clerical and 
investigative staff.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of 
manual and/or electronic recording and information 
systems used by the agency, office or related units. 

REQUIREMENTS

LICENSE

Admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the 
State of New Jersey.

Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license 
valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, 
rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform 
the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of State and Federal administrative law 
and practices, and of federal court procedures.

Knowledge of the procedures used to prepare and 
prosecute civil and criminal cases.

Knowledge of the types of formal and informal 
legal documents.

Knowledge of the methods used to gather and 
analyze information.

Knowledge of investigative methods.

Ability to participate in the coordination and 
prosecution of civil and criminal matters.

Ability to conduct research and prepare reports 
and correspondence. 

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working 
relationships with those interested or involved in the 
work of the unit. 

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, 
office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate 
in English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  
American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered 
as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as 
long as they can perform the essential functions of the job 
after reasonable accommodation is made to their known 
limitations.  If the accommodation cannot be made because 
it would cause undue hardship, such persons, may not be eligible.

CODES:   Z/25  -  30465                MER             9/29/07

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the State of New Jersey.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothFalseExplanation: The job description specifies that the requirements for the Deputy Attorney General 5 position include "Admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the State of New Jersey." This indicates that a specific legal qualification, rather than an educational degree, is mandatory for the role. There is no mention of alternative qualifications that could replace this requirement, meaning that the role does not consider other qualifications as alternatives to the legal admission requirement. Therefore, both DegreeRequirementStatus.isDegreeMandatory and DegreeRequirementStatus.hasAlternativeQualifications are False.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree, specifically a law degree, is absolutely required for this job. The job description specifies that the candidate must have admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the State of New Jersey. This requirement implies that the candidate has earned a Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school and successfully passed the New Jersey Bar Examination, both of which are necessary qualifications for practicing law in the state.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the State of New Jersey.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description requires "Admission to practice as an Attorney at Law in the State of New Jersey," which typically necessitates having a Juris Doctor (JD) degree from a law school. This implies that a college or university degree (an undergraduate degree followed by a law degree) is a barrier for applicants who do not have these educational qualifications.

name: Confidential Investigative Specialist 2
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


CONFIDENTIAL INVESTIGATIVE SPECIALIST 2

STATE COMMISSION OF INVESTIGATION

UNCLASSIFIED

NJSA 52:9M-9

DEFINITION:

Under the direction of the Assistant Director, Confidential Investigative 
Specialist 3 or other supervisory officer of the State Commission of 
Investigation, conducts confidential background and security clearance
investigations. Assists in the development, implementation, management, 
and control of confidential programs and logistical operations critical to 
the Commission's investigative operations with a moderate degree of 
independence and supervision. 

NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only. 
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this
job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be
listed. 

EXAMPLES OF WORK: 

Assists with sensitive and confidential criminal history background 
investigations in response to requests and inquiries from other agencies 
as requested or statutorily-mandated. 

Researches, reviews and evaluates internal intelligence, investigative 
and other documents and records. 

Conducts research of highly confidential and/or sensitive legal, 
investigative and intelligence documents, records and archives as 
required in support of Commission issues and matters. 

Performs corporate record searches through the Division of Revenue 
for corporate officers, registered business addresses, corporate 
amendments and annual reports related to confidential investigations 
and research. 

Prepares accurate and detailed confidential reports of investigations 
which effectively communicate findings, conclusions and recommendations.
Weighs facts impartially and accurately and communicate them clearly, 
concisely and objectively. 

Assists in the preparation of disseminations of reports containing factual 
findings in accordance with Commission policies and guidelines. 

Assists in the collection, accountability and organization of confidential 
investigative, intelligence and legal documents, exhibits and materials 
designated for off-site storage or destruction. Assists with the transfer 
and control of documents and materials in accordance with Commission
and New Jersey Department of State record retention and destruction 
policies and guidelines. 

Serves as back-up Electronic Recording Evidence Custodian in the 
collection, cataloging, duplicating, accounting, maintaining and securing 
of electronic records obtained for or through Commission's investigative 
operations.

Assists in the proper chain-of-custody and control of electronic 
records in accordance with Commission, state and federal rules 
of evidence to include the disposition of electronic records. 

Assists in the security and accountability of documents, records and 
other material obtained by subpoena or formal requests in the course 
of Commission investigations. Assists in the security of the evidence 
vault and the proper chain-of-custody and control of documents, records, 
exhibits and other materials. Assists in annual and periodic audits and 
integrity inspections as required. 

Assists in the control and administration of the Commission's fictitious 
driver license, confidential vehicle registration and other confidential
document programs administered by the New Jersey Division of State 
Police and other law enforcement agencies. Assists with the issuance 
of documents and credentials, assignment, monitoring, auditing, and 
surrender consistent with policies, procedures and regulations set forth 
by the New Jersey Division of State Police or other law enforcement 
agencies.
 
Assists with the administration of Commission police radio communication 
equipment including assignment, maintenance, inspection, and auditing
consistent with policies, procedures and regulations set forth by the 
New Jersey Division of State Police. 

Assists in the administration and control of Commission-owned 
vehicle fleet including assignment, documents, inspection, 
maintenance, repair, E-Z Pass, accident reporting and surrender 
consistent with Commission and State policies, procedures and 
regulations. 

Assists in the administration and control of security and burglar 
alarm systems for Commission facilities including assigning security 
access codes. Responds to and investigates alarm activations and
other security breaches on a twenty-four (24) hours basis. 

Assists in the development of specifications and requirements for 
covert and surveillance vehicles including retro-fitting vehicles for
investigative purposes. 

Assists with security for public hearings conducted by the 
Commission with the New Jersey Division of State Police 
and State House management operations. 

Provides logistical support for public hearing conducted by the 
Commission including the transportation of evidence, exhibits 
and witnesses. 

Performs delivery and courier service to and from the Commission 
for legal, confidential, salary, personnel and other related documents. 

Assists in the preparation of plans and specifications for equipment, 
supplies and other requirements to justify budget requests. 

Maintains knowledge and familiarity with policies, regulations, 
precedents and other matters related to the technical and 
administrative aspects of assignments and responsibilities. 

Utilizes various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems, audio and visual equipment, communication 
devices and other equipment utilized by the Commission. 

REQUIREMENTS: 

EDUCATION: 

Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's Degree. 

EXPERIENCE:

Six (6) years experience in conducting and organizing administrative,
criminal, intelligence or background investigations in a federal, state 
or other investigative or regulatory agency which shall have included 
the review and analysis of modern business, financial and accounting
records. 

NOTE:  A Master's Degree in Criminal Justice, Public Administration, 
Business Administration, or other related field may be substituted for 
one (1) year of the indicated experience. 

NOTE:  Applicants who do not possess the required education 
may substitute experience as indicated on a year-for-year basis. 

NOTE:  Applicants accepting employment as Confidential 
Investigative Specialist 2 with the State Commission of Investigation 
are required to adhere to certain current employment restrictions and 
a secrecy agreement. 

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
mobility, is required to perform the essential duties of the position. 

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge and understanding of the statutory mandates of the 
Commission and the ability to conduct background and security 
clearance investigations consistent with this mandate as well as
 specific authorizing resolutions. 

Knowledge of investigative techniques, methods, procedures and 
terminology related to financial, regulatory, background, and other 
types of investigations. 

Knowledge of procedures governing rules of evidence. 

Knowledge of regulations and procedures governing state contracts. 

Knowledge and understanding of law enforcement related 
equipment and services. 

Knowledge of vehicle fleet operations and maintenance. 

Knowledge of police radio communication equipment and systems 
including operation, maintenance and communication protocols. 

Knowledge of methods and techniques for work organization and 
effective verbal or graphic presentation of information to diverse 
audiences. 

Knowledge of corporation structures, financial statements and 
transactions, and financial fraud and the ability to apply this 
knowledge in conducting investigations. 

Knowledge of modern business and investigative systems,
methods and procedures including the continuous revision 
and alteration of methods and plans as may be required. 

Knowledge of the relationship among federal, state and local 
government agencies. 

Knowledge of documents, publications and reference material 
housed by the State Library and governmental archives. 

Knowledge of the policies and procedures of the Commission. 

Knowledge of policies and procedures of State and local law 
enforcement agencies and the Bureau of Risk Management to 
ensure proper notification, documentation, processing and 
disposition of motor vehicle accident reports. 

Knowledge of personal computers and software applications
 including word processing, spreadsheets, data base, graphic 
presentation, public records information and electronic mail. 

Ability to organize, plan, analyze, evaluate, and execute all 
phases of investigative activity including schedules and procedures
 and strategies, where necessary and when warranted using 
resourcefulness, versatility, ingenuity and originality. 

Ability to utilize mechanical aptitude in the operation, installation
and repair of law enforcement devices and equipment. 

Ability to comprehend, analyze and apply the policies and 
procedures of the Commission to work schedules and personnel 
problems encountered. 

Ability to analyze information developed during the course of a 
background and security clearance investigation for possible 
criminal activity and violations. 

Ability to research and collect information relevant to background 
and security clearance investigations. 

Ability to prepare and provide detailed and accurate reports and 
complex correspondence containing findings, conclusions and 
recommendations in a timely fashion.

Ability to maintain records, files and other information consistent 
with Commission, state and federal policies, procedures and 
regulations. 

Ability to identify, evaluate and take receipt of electronic recording 
evidence and/or potential evidence. 

Ability to determine through review, examination and analyses,
information relevant to background and security clearance 
investigations. 

Ability to communicate and interact effectively both orally and 
in writing. 

Ability to work independently or as a team member, including 
periods of intense concentration and high stress. 

Ability to assign, instruct and provide guidance and assistance 
to other staff as required, after a period of training. 

Ability to utilize the New Jersey Criminal Justice Information 
System and other public records information systems. 

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems, audio and video equipment, communication 
devices and other equipment utilized by the Commission. 

Ability to develop instructional information and programs and 
conduct training programs in areas of specific knowledge. 

Ability to read, write, speak, understand and communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform duties of this position. American 
Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable 
forms of communication. 

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long 
as they can perform essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be 
made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, 
such persons may not be eligible


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote90728SUNL98N/AX98-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 7/14/2012

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's Degree.
A Master's Degree in Criminal Justice, Public Administration, Business Administration, or other related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the indicated experience.

alternativeQualifications: experience as indicated on a year-for-year basis

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as the job description allows for the substitution of the required Bachelor's Degree with the necessary experience on a year-for-year basis. This means that an applicant can qualify for the position based on relevant experience instead of holding a formal higher educational degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is required to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that the position requires graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's Degree. This is a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. However, note that there is a substitution clause: applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute experience on a year-for-year basis. This means applicants without a degree may still qualify if they possess equivalent experience.

name: Manager 1 Motor Vehicle Commission

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and five (5) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

Possession of a master's degree in Business, Public or Personnel Administration, or related fields from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

alternativeQualifications: Nine (9) years of administrative experience involving planning, budgets, and/or administration of programs in a large public or private agency, two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as applicants can qualify through relevant work experience alone. The job description states that nine years of relevant administrative experience, including two years in a supervisory capacity, is an acceptable qualification. Alternatively, a bachelor's or master's degree can reduce the required years of experience. Thus, while higher education can substitute for some experience, it is not strictly necessary to qualify for this position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description outlines a requirement for either nine years of relevant administrative experience with two years in a supervisory capacity, or a bachelor's or master's degree coupled with a specific amount of professional experience. This effectively creates a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree, as they must have substantial and specific experience to qualify without a degree. The equivalency of thirty semester-hour credits to one year of experience also implies a preference for educational qualifications.

text:

You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification
    
    

    
        
            
                
                    JUDICIARY OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY
                
             Support Staff Band Specification
Clerical, Administrative and Courtroom Support Track
BAND SUMMARY
Support Staff perform a variety of clerical, administrative, and other support functions in connection with proceedings instituted before courts or programs administered under the supervision of the courts, in support of the business operations of such courts, and as contact representatives for clients and customers or users of the services provided by the New Jersey Courts. 
LEVEL SUMMARY
Level 1 - Basic (Judiciary Clerk 1 and Court Services Representative): Employees at this level perform basic, limited keyboarding, clerical functions in support of the business operations of the Judiciary.
Level 2 - Basic (Judiciary Clerk 2, Judiciary Clerk Driver, and Judiciary Account Clerk 1): Employees at this level perform basic clerical functions in support of the business operations of the Judiciary. May be hired to serve as drivers.
Level 3 - Journey (Judiciary Clerk 3 and Judiciary Account Clerk 2): Employees at this level perform journey level clerical functions in support of the business operations of the Judiciary. May be assigned to a courtroom to serve as a court clerk.
Level 4 - Mastery/Paraprofessional (Judiciary Clerk 4, Clerk to Grand Jury, and Administrative Specialist 1): Employees at this level act as lead workers and perform both paraprofessional and mastery level clerical functions in support of the business operations of the Judiciary. May be assigned to a courtroom to serve as a court clerk.
TASKS
NOTE: The above summary and following examples of work are for illustrative purposes only. Any one position may not include all of the tasks listed, nor do the examples cover all of the duties, which may be performed. Tasks are cumulative; higher levels include the tasks associated with lower.
Level 1
Adjust office machines or equipment, including scanning and digitizing machines
Answer routine questions
Check condition of fleet vehicles
Collect correspondence, packages, reports and other materials
Complete standard office or agency business forms
Compute simple numerical data -- addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
Correct errors on finished copy 
Deliver, return or file standard media format files
Direct the flow of litigants in the courtroom
Distribute judges' orders or requests
Distribute materials, equipment, parts or supplies
Distribute or route correspondence, files or output to appropriate offices or people
File records, cards, reports, forms, letters, financial items or other written documents alphabetically, chronologically numerically or by subject
Inventory materials, parts or supplies
Issue receipts

Locate law books, documents, records, tape recordings or other reference materials for judges or other court officials
Maintain records, files or other written materials

Operate audio or video equipment 
Operate automobiles, light duty trucks, vans or other motor vehicles

Prepare and send regular, insured, special delivery, express, certified or registered mail to appropriate individuals or agencies
Prepare documents for authentication
Provide cross-training to co-workers; for example, demonstrate to other staff how you perform your work Provide quality customer service to court users and/or internal customers
Receive insured, special delivery, express, certified or registered mail

Schedule dates or times for conferences, hearings, trials, adjournments or "back-up" cases

Type or transcribe varied types of complex, confidential or sensitive material, for example, minutes of informal hearings, conferences or meetings; policy statements, recommendations or decisions, etc.
Verify authenticity or validity of documents
Verify records for accuracy, completeness or conformity 
Verify requisitions, vouchers, bank statements or financial transactions
Write case notes or draft other case related correspondence
Level 4
Act as lead worker to team members or other group of non-subordinates in assigned tasks
Administer skills tests
Advise judges, management or members of a tribunal on case issues
Analyze case processing and/or bail from intake through disposition
Analyze data
Analyze reports for distribution or action 
Answer legal complaints by telephone or in writing
Apply statutes, court rules, case law, policies or other regulatory standards to cases
Approve continuances or adjournments in adherence with state or local division rules or practices
Arrange for clients' or customers' admission or discharge into/from facilities 
Calculate statistical information for reports 
Check accounts for legitimacy or verification of payments
Confer with judges or hearing officers on policies or procedures 
Explain conditions of program, probation or community service
Give advice or assist staff or team members with work in progress
Implement operating procedures or systems
Inform managers about unresolved staff or team conflicts 
Interpret accounting, financial or statistical data
Interview clients or customers for needed information and document acquired information 
Investigate discrepancies in accounts, statements or other financial reports 
Prioritize cases
Provide information to judges, attorneys or community organizations
Provide structured training to co-workers 
Provide higher level technical advice and/or expertise to staff, peers or management
Regulate flow of work in accordance with operating schedules
Screen confidential material for release to public or other authorized person/agency
COMPETENCIES
NOTE: The following competencies are cumulative in nature. For example, lower level competencies are prerequisite to higher levels.
Level 1
Arithmetic –Accurately performs computations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. 
Conscientiousness - Displays a high level of effort and commitment towards performing work. Consistently focused. Demonstrates responsible behavior. Presents self and work product in a professional manner.
Customer Service - Provides quality service. Works and communicates with internal and external customers to satisfy their expectations.
Eye-Hand Coordination (Keyboarding) - Accurately coordinates one's eyes with one's fingers, wrists or arms to move, carry or manipulate objects.
Interpersonal Skills - Shows understanding, respect, collegiality, courtesy, tact, empathy, cooperation, concern, and politeness to others. Develops and maintains effective relationships with others; including effectively dealing with individuals who are difficult, hostile or distressed. Relates well with people from varied backgrounds and different situations. Sensitive to cultural diversity, race, gender, disabilities, and other individual differences. Participates fully in team activities.
Listening - Receives, attends to, interprets and responds to verbal messages and other cues such as body language in ways that are appropriate to listeners and situations. Shows dignity and respect to all.
Manages and Organizes Information - Identifies a need and gathers organizes and maintains information. Determines its importance and accuracy, and communicates it by a variety of methods. Perceptual Speed - Sees details in words, numbers, pictures and graphs, quickly and accurately.
Physical Strength and Agility – Bends, lifts, climbs, stands, and walks for extended periods of time. Performs moderately heavy laboring work. Uses proper body mechanics.
Reading Comprehension- Learns from written material by determining the main idea or essential message. Recognizes correct English grammar, punctuation and spelling. 
Resource Handling - Selects, acquires, stores and distributes resources such as materials, equipment or money. 
Speaking - Uses correct English grammar to organize and communicate ideas in words that are appropriate to listeners and situations. Uses body language appropriately.
Vehicle Operation – Competently, safely and efficiently operates cars, vans and light trucks. Complies with the New Jersey motor vehicle laws and the Judiciary’s motor vehicle policy.
Writing - Uses correct English grammar, punctuation and spelling to communicate thoughts, ideas, information and messages in writing. 
Level 2
Applies Technology To Tasks - Selects and understands procedures, machines or tools that will produce the desired results. Identifies or solves problems in machines, computers or other technologies as they are related to performing tasks.
Mathematical Reasoning - Solves practical problems by applying a variety of mathematical techniques such as formulas and percentages. 
Organizational Awareness - Knows the organization’s mission and functions, and how social, political organizational and technological systems work, and operates effectively within them, including the policies, procedures, rules and regulations of the work or organization.
Level 3 
Reasoning - Identifies rules, principles or relationships between facts, data, and other information. Asks pertinent questions to acquire needed information. Analyzes information and makes logical inferences or draws accurate conclusions. 
Teamwork - Encourages and facilitates cooperation, pride, trust and group identity. Fosters commitment and team spirit and works with others to achieve goals.
Technical Competence - Uses knowledge that is acquired through formal training and/or extensive on-the-job experience to perform one's job. 
Level 4
Creative Thinking - Uses imagination to combine ideas or information in new ways. 
Leadership - Interacts with others to influence, motivate and challenge them. 
Visualization - Mentally organizes and processes symbols, pictures, graphs, objects or other information, for example, visualizes the flow of work activities from reading a work plan.
Self-Management - Sets well-defined and realistic personal goals. Displays a high level of initiative, effort and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner. Works with minimal supervision and is motivated to achieve. Demonstrates responsible behavior.
Teaches Others - Helps others learn through coaching and mentoring. Identifies training needs and provides positive reinforcement. 
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 
Experience
Level 3
One year of experience in an office environment performing a variety of clerical and support services to include keyboarding and one or more of the following: document or information processing, handling payments for fees, recording monies received, reconciling balances or accounts and/or scheduling meetings or appointments. 
Level 4
Three years of experience in an office environment performing a variety of clerical and support services to include keyboarding and one or more of the following: document or information processing, handling payments for fees, recording monies received, reconciling balances or accounts and/or scheduling meetings or appointments.
Testing
Level 1 
Ability to use a keyboard, no minimum speed
Levels 2, 3 and 4
Ability to type a minimum of 25 net words per minute.
License
Appointees will be required to possess a driver’s license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.
Physical Ability: (Limited to approved positions)
For some positions, applicants must have the ability to perform work which requires climbing and prolonged standing, stretching, bending and reaching to perform the essential duties of the position. For some positions, the selected candidate must be able to frequently lift and carry supplies weighing from 30 to 50 pounds and, occasionally, materials weighing up to 75 pounds, in order to perform essential duties of the position.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS/SPECIAL SKILLS/CONSIDERATIONS
BILINGUAL IN SPANISH AND ENGLISH VARIANT
The above examples of work are to be performed by utilizing Spanish or English, as required, depending on the needs of the individual persons communicated with during the course of official duties. Such examples do not require an individual to interpret or translate any court proceeding or in any other context. 
COURT CLERK
The Judiciary Clerk 3 or Judiciary Clerk 4 position may require work in a courtroom. Employees in these titles may function as a court clerk, performing related work including, but not limited to, preparing, calling and annotating the court calendar; swearing in jurors; administering oaths to witnesses; maintaining custody of exhibits; recording and maintaining records of court proceedings; updating case information; and discussing daily court activities, scheduling of cases, calling of calendar, etc., with the Judge.

alternativeQualifications: Experience in an office environment performing clerical and support services
Ability to use a keyboard
Ability to type a minimum of 25 net words per minute

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job description for positions in the clerical, administrative, and courtroom support track for the Judiciary of the State of New Jersey specifies experience requirements, involving clerical and support services experience, rather than specific educational qualifications. The levels described (from 1 to 4) focus on varying degrees of competence, experience, and responsibility in clerical functions, which can be acquired through on-the-job experience rather than formal education. Hence, while certain skills and possibly some level of education (such as high school completion) may be beneficial or required, a higher educational degree is not explicitly necessary for these roles.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver’s license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: No barriers are found.

name: Administrative Assistant 2 State Commission Of Investigation
Principal Technician Management Information Systems

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a bachelor's degree in a computer-related area
Possession of a masterâs degree in a computer-related area

alternativeQualifications: Six (6) years of professional experience utilizing or implementing electronic information systems
Thirty (30) semester-hour credits are equal to one (1) year of relevant experience
Twenty-four (24) semester hour credits in data processing from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of professional experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation:
The job description specifies that a higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Principal Technician, Management Information Systems position. The requirements offer multiple pathways: 

1. Six years of relevant professional experience without a degree.
2. A bachelor's degree with two years of experience.
3. A bachelor's degree in a computer-related area with one year of experience.
4. A master's degree in a computer-related area without experience.
5. A combination of 24 semester-hour credits in data processing and four years of relevant experience.

These options highlight that while higher education is beneficial, it is not mandatory if the applicant has sufficient relevant professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description outlines specific requirements that could be barriers for applicants without a college or university degree: 

1. The job states that applicants must meet one of the following combinations of experience and education:
   - Six (6) years of professional experience related to information systems.
   - A bachelorâs degree from an accredited college or university, plus two (2) years of relevant professional experience.
   - A bachelorâs degree in a computer-related area, plus one (1) year of relevant professional experience.
   - A masterâs degree in a computer-related area.
   - Twenty-four (24) semester hour credits in data processing from an accredited college or university, plus four (4) years of relevant professional experience.

This indicates that a college or university degree or college credits is required, either directly or indirectly, to qualify for the position, creating a barrier for those who do not have such educational credentials.

name: Administrative Specialist 1
