educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation form an accredited college or university with a Bachelorâs degree
supplemented by a Masterâs degree in rehabilitation, counselling, social work, creative arts therapy, occupational therapy, education, or a related therapeutic field.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is absolutely required for the job of Supervisor of Rehabilitative Services. The job description specifies that applicants must have graduated from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree, supplemented by a Master's degree in fields such as rehabilitation, counseling, social work, creative arts therapy, occupational therapy, education, or a related therapeutic field. Additionally, the role requires substantial experience in rehabilitation therapy or mental health administration, which indicates the need for extensive knowledge and expertise in these domains, commonly acquired through advanced education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that applicants are required to have a Bachelor's degree supplemented by a Master's degree in rehabilitation, counselling, social work, creative arts therapy, occupational therapy, education, or a related therapeutic field. This educational requirement acts as a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree.

name: Forms Design Technician 3
text:
Job Specification 41354 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 41354 

FORMS DESIGN TECHNICIAN 3

   JOB CATEGORY SUMMARY

   A position in this job category typically proofreads material for
   accuracy; determines measurements for typesetting; edits written
   material; composes mechanicals; determines format, size, and
   arrangement of forms; operates computerized typesetting and composing
   equipment; evaluates graphic design for style, arrangement, color,
   technique, and effect.

   CHARACTERISTIC TASKS

       NOTE: The above Job Category Summary and following examples of
       work are for illustrative purposes only.  Any one position may not
       include all of the tasks listed, nor do the examples cover all of
       the duties which may be performed.

   Proofreads material for accuracy

   Determines measurements for typesetting

   Edits written material

   Composes mechanicals

   Determines format, size, and arrangement of forms

   Checks typesetting equipment for working condition

   Verifies entered data against source documents

   Evaluates graphic design for style, arrangement, color, technique, and
   effect

   Copies data to tape, floppy disk, or other data storage medium

   Develops formats for printed material

   Designs layout for brochures, newsletters, forms, reports, leaflets, or
   booklets

   Determines leading for forms

   Determines style, techniques, and medium for graphic arts projects
   Designs layouts of graphic or printed materials

   Determines sequence of information on forms

   Designs forms for printer capability

   Designs office forms such as invoices and production sheets

   Analyzes forms for determination of effectiveness, possible change, or
   update

   Corrects routine problems with computer or printer

   Designs charts and graphs

   Estimates necessary quantity of time, costs, materials or personnel for
   the accomplishment of assignments or goals

   Recommends the purchase of new and replacement materials, equipment,
   parts and supplies

   Organizes graphic arts projects from conception to completion

   Verifies that quantity and type of item ordered matches invoice

   Determines quantity of forms for printing

   Inventories materials, equipment, parts or supplies

   Operates computerized typesetting and composing equipment

   Selects typeface for printed matter

   Makes (produces) camera-ready copy

   Types copy

   Operates computer terminal or PC for information processing

   Sets type

   Operates film processing component of photo typesetting equipment

   Checks working condition of graphic arts equipment

   Manipulates (uses) drafting equipment, such as T-square, triangle,
   compass, or leroy sets
   Operates manual typesetting equipment

   Applies computer programs to graphics design development

   Informs individuals of procedures necessary for completion of forms or
   applications

   Informs the responsible person or organization of difficulties,
   accomplishments, plans or goals

   Provides technical advice to staff, peers or management

   CHARACTERISTIC KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

   Knowledge of the types and characteristics of graphic arts equipment

   Knowledge of principles and techniques of forms design

   Knowledge of picas and points for printing

   Knowledge of standard English grammar; for example, syntax,
   punctuation, verb agreement, or tense

   Knowledge of the principles and techniques of copy preparation,
   composition and layout

   Knowledge of layout specifications for printing

   Knowledge of printing terminology

   Knowledge of types of graphics software packages

   Knowledge of layout techniques

   Knowledge of proofreading symbols

   Knowledge of limitations and capabilities of printing equipment

   Knowledge of graphic arts techniques and media

   Knowledge of the principles of graphic arts design

   Knowledge of aesthetic design

   Knowledge of mini or mainframe computer word processing software
   Knowledge of procedures for maintaining laser printers

   Knowledge of techniques for film processing

   Knowledge of techniques of interpersonal relations

   Skill in operating a typewriter

   Skill in operating a word processor

   Ability to operate computerized typesetting systems

   Ability to make precise measurements for graphic designs

   Ability to use layout equipment and tools

   Ability to produce artwork from verbal description of requirements

   Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide, using decimals,
   percentages and fractions

   Ability to select graphics that communicate conception or idea to
   target audience

   Ability to edit rough or final copy for form, accuracy, and clarity

   Ability to develop computer codes, formats, and designs

   Ability to compare written or printed material for accuracy

   Ability to design graphics using computer software

   Ability to determine leading for forms

   Ability to operate graphic arts equipment

   Ability to use a proportion wheel

   Ability to design charts or graphs from raw data

   Ability to establish goals and set priorities

   Ability to summarize information in a written form

   Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide whole numbers
   Ability to use a proportion wheel

   Ability to operate manual typesetting equipment

   Ability to read and interpret laws, rules, and regulations

   Ability to convey information in a written form

   MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

       Completion of a vocational, technical or specialized training
       program in the graphic arts.

       EXPERIENCE:

       Three (3) years of experience in work utilizing graphic arts
       equipment, forms design, and layout specifications for printing.

       SUBSTITUTION

       Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute
       one (1) additional year of the indicated experience.

   FOR MORE INFORMATION REGARDING JOB CATEGORIES, please refer to the Job
   Specification Information Sheet available at the New Jersey Department
   of Personnel or your agency's personnel office.

   Occupational Group:   Art Occupations

   Occupational Family:  Graphic Arts

   Level    Title Code  Title Reference Number  Effective: 5/28/94

     1        41354       14020701 (C) 35,12

alternativeQualifications: One (1) additional year of the indicated experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The minimum education requirement is the completion of a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in the graphic arts, or applicants can substitute one additional year of relevant work experience if they do not possess the required education. Therefore, a higher educational degree beyond specified training or experience is not necessary.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description states a minimum education requirement of completing a vocational, technical, or specialized training program in the graphic arts. However, it allows for a substitution where an applicant who does not meet the educational requirement may substitute one additional year of the specified experience. This substitution option reduces the barrier for applicants without a formal college or university degree, although it still requires a total of four years of relevant experience.

name: Planning Associate 2
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


  PLANNING ASSOCIATE 2 POLICY AND PLANNING

  DEFINITION:

  Under direction of a Planning Associate 3, manager, or other
  supervisory official in the Department of Education, analyzes,
  develops, and recommends education policies, plans, and priorities in
  order to implement state and federal laws pertaining to education
  programs and practices; develops education programming by conducting
  analyses and evaluation of education programs, surveys, needs
  assessment, and related research.  Establishes, maintains, and
  evaluates program and fiscal data related to state and federal formula
  aid and discretionary grant applications and allocations; performs
  mandated regulatory functions; is knowledgeable in and works with
  independence in areas of assignment; does related work as required.

  NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes 
  only.  A particular position using this title may not perform all duties 
  listed in this job specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the 
  job may not be listed.

  EXAMPLES OF WORK:

       Establishes plans and priorities for education programs as 
  needed for eligible populations by analyzing and conducting surveys,
  administrative procedures, and related research.

       Develops policy recommendations and/or administrative code for
  implementation of state and federal laws pertaining to education
  programs and practices.

       Drafts legislation and prepares legislative bill analyses.

       Conducts legislative briefings.

       Plans implementation of education projects and programs.

       Designs and implements evaluation instruments to analyze
  effectiveness of education policy, plans, training, and education
  services in local school districts and intermediate and regional units.

       Assists in the establishment of developmental priorities for
  curriculum and training services.

       Establishes and maintains effective work communications with
  county offices, and regional units to ensure compliance with
  educational policy, plans, and programs.

       Develops technical documents for all New Jersey education systems
  to evaluate educational services.

       Analyzes complex demographic data, develops plans, and recommends
  policy and formula for funds distribution.

       Analyzes relevant state and federal laws and regulations and
  develops policy and planning recommendations for their enforcement.

       Initiates the planning of specialized programs for target
  populations.

       After review, makes recommendations on changes in maintenance 
  of local district education policy, plans, and goals, as approved by the
  Department of Education.

       Establishes and maintains liaison with education and public 
  interest groups to inform them of department activities and identify 
  their needs.

       As directed, trains other professional or nonprofessional
  personnel.

       Review administrative law judge decisions for impact on education.

       Evaluate impact of policy changes on programs or services.

       Researches and analyzes demographic, labor market, and
  technological data and makes recommendations on education 
  programs and plans to meet changing needs.

       As required, develops and recommends funding criteria and
  competitive application procedures and forms for awarding grants and
  contracts to eligible agencies.

       Provides technical assistance to local programs and coordinates
  the development of training programs for funded agencies, as needed.

       Coordinates the ongoing statewide implementation and evaluation of
  instructional programs as required by federal law and regulations to
  ensure compliance.

       As required, coordinates program maintenance and fiscal reporting
  comparing results with department standards and recommending changes 
  to meet standards as needed.

       Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
  manual recording and computerized information systems used by
  the agency, office, or related units.

  REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

           Graduation from an accredited college or university with a
  Master's degree in Educational Administration, Public Administration,
  or a related field or a degree in Law.

       EXPERIENCE:

            Four (4) years of experience in education planning, analysis
  of educational policy, or intergovernmental/legislative relations in
  the implementation of educational policy and planning.

        LICENSE:

            Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license
  valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than
  employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties 
  of the position.

  KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

           Knowledge of the organization and structure of the New Jersey
  education system.

           Knowledge of public education policy at the local, state, and
  federal levels.

           Knowledge of state and federal statutes and administrative
  codes, as applied to education.

           Knowledge of principles and practices providing adult
  education programming at the local level.

           Knowledge of state and federal program aid requirements.

           Knowledge of legislation and guidelines related to funded
  programs.

           Knowledge of the operational processes and practices of state
  agencies, including the fiscal system.

           Ability to develop education policies and plans based on need
  and in accordance with legislation.

           Ability to interpret and explain information on laws, rules,
  regulations, policies, and plans pertaining to education.

           Ability to establish and maintain working and information
  networks with education and public interest groups.

           Ability to exercise leadership in program planning and
  development with department staff, county offices, regional 
  units and local school district staff.

           Ability to coordinate plans and resources and identify problem
  areas or needs.

           Ability to analyze data and prepare accurate reports of
  findings, conclusions, and recommendations.

           Ability to prepare accurate documentation of budgetary needs.

           Ability to interpret state and federal rules and regulations
  and develop a responsive plan for meeting special needs.

           Ability to prepare extensive official correspondence.

           Ability to coordinate program maintenance, and fiscal
  reporting, and other essential files.

           Ability to develop technical assistance materials.

           Ability to plan and conduct regional and statewide inservice
  training programs.

           Ability to develop program plans from needs assessment
  information.

           Ability to analyze state and federal labor projections and
  identify appropriate educational programs to meet these needs.

           Ability to analyze trends and project future educational needs
  based on these trends.

           Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or
  manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
  office, or related units.

           Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
  English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American
  Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable 
  forms of communication.

           Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as
  long as they can perform the essential functions of the job after
  reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  
  If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause 
  the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

  
This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote72624FPolicy And PlanningSNNL28N/AP28-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 10/30/1993

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master's degree in Educational Administration, Public Administration, or a related field or a degree in Law.
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master's degree in Educational Administration, Public Administration, or a related field or a degree in Law.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description specifies that a Master's degree in Educational Administration, Public Administration, or a related field, or a degree in Law, is required. This indicates that a higher educational degree is absolutely required for this job. The responsibilities of the position, such as analyzing educational policies, developing recommendations compliant with state and federal laws, and conducting legislative briefings, necessitate a comprehensive understanding and expertise that typically come with advanced education. The complexity of the tasks and the level of knowledge and skills demanded by the job make the requirement for a higher educational degree justifiable.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The requirement for a Master's degree in Educational Administration, Public Administration, or a related field or a degree in Law creates a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree.

name: Governmental Relations Specialist 1

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience in written and verbal communication.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of Governmental Relations Specialist 1. The job description specifies that applicants can qualify with seven years of professional experience in relevant areas such as communication, consumer services, journalism, or public affairs. Alternatively, possessing a Bachelor's degree and three years of relevant professional experience can also qualify an applicant for the job. The job allows for experience to substitute for formal education, recognizing professional skills and knowledge as essential criteria.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description presents a barrier to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree in its requirements section. Specifically, it states that applicants must meet "one of the following or a combination of both experience and education: Thirty (30) semester hour credits are equal to one (1) year of relevant experience. Seven (7) years of professional experience in written and verbal communication...OR Possession of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience." This means that if an applicant does not have a Bachelor's degree, they must have seven years of professional experience, which could be a significant barrier for those without higher education credentials.

name: Program Specialist 4

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, one (1) year which shall have been in a supervisory capacity over professional or technical staff.

Possession of a master's degree from an accredited college or university in a Social/Human services specialty area, Public or Business Administration, Child Advocacy and Policy, or Child Advocacy and Policy with a concentration in Public Child Welfare; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity over professional or technical staff.

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience in planning, monitoring, coordinating, implementing, modifying and/or evaluating a social or human services program, one (1) year which shall have been in a supervisory capacity over professional or technical staff

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as applicants can qualify through a combination of professional experience and education. Specifically, eight years of professional experience related to the job description, including one year in a supervisory role, can substitute for a degree. Alternatively, possessing a bachelorâs degree or a masterâs degree in a relevant field can reduce the number of required professional experience years. Therefore, while higher education is valued and can lessen the experience requirements, it is not an absolute necessity for this job.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description lists specific educational qualifications as requirements: 

1. A candidate must have either:
   - Eight (8) years of relevant professional experience, with at least one (1) year in a supervisory role.
   - A bachelor's degree and four (4) years of relevant professional experience, with at least one (1) year in a supervisory role.
   - A master's degree in a specified field and three (3) years of relevant professional experience, with at least one (1) year in a supervisory role.

The equivalency note (Thirty (30) semester hour credits are equal to one (1) year of relevant experience) slightly mitigates the emphasis on formal education but still places a degree as a potential barrier unless a significant amount of experience compensates for it.

name: Manager Field Operations Commission For The Blind And Visually Impaired
text:
Job Specification 62680 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 62680 

MANAGE:R, FIELD OPERATIONS, COMMISSION FOR THE BLIND AND VISUALLY
                             IMPAIRED

 

DEFINITION


 Under direction of the Executive Director, Commission for the
 Blind and Visually Impaired, plans, develops, coordinates, and
 evaluates multiple diverse programs designed to identify and
 service the needs of multi-ethnic, multi-cultural clients
 requiring vocational rehabilitation, education, health care and
 prevention, career development, independent living or other
 services; manages budget and other resources allocated for
 services to blind and visually impaired clients; directs and
 supervises staff identifying and coordinating clients needs; does
 other related work.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Plans, coordinates, administers and directs field operations for
 the effective and efficient delivery of regional or statewide
 client services to individuals who are blind and visually
 impaired, including vocational rehabilitation, education,
 independent living, health care and prevention, career
 development, deaf-blind and other services designed to benefit
 the client.

 Evaluates needs for assistive technology for staff and clients.

 Oversees the electronic maintenance of client, service delivery,
 and fiscal and other required program information.

 Analyzes and evaluates program operations.

 Supervises the activities of staff engaged in providing services
 to blind and visually impaired clients.

 Complies with requirements for fiscal reporting and related
 liaison work with the Commission's fiscal staff of the
 Commission; develops and negotiates annual budget proposals and
 implements approved budgets; monitors and manages available
 resources.

 Prepares and directs the preparation of clear, sound, and
 accurate reports containing findings, conclusions and
 recommendations to evaluate office performance and program
 functions.

 Provides recommendations for the resolution of operational
 problems.

 Plans and develops operating procedures to satisfy program
 requirements, employee and client needs, and applicable statutes
 and policies.

 Manages the on-site administrative activities of the assigned
 site including responsibility for vehicle assignments, building
 management, equipment-ordering, etc.

 Advance agency goals; provides information regarding agency
 services.

 Implements federally legislated program to provide employment
 opportunities for clients.

 Analyzes existing and proposed legislation to identify impacts on
 current programs; provides input for the preparation of
 recommendations to modify or develop legislation necessary to
 expedite implementation or new programs for reforms.

 Establishes and maintains liaison and cooperative working
 relationships with other agencies and organizations interested or
 involved in the work of the program.

 Identifies and utilizes community resources for the benefit of
 the blind and visually impaired.

 Oversees quality control activities designed to evaluate program
 services.

 Estimates, projects and evaluates workloads, and develops
 adjustments designed to maintain continuity of sound programmatic
 administrative and fiscal procedures; plans and implements
 modifications to procedures, equipment use and staffing
 requirements.

 Provides guidance to staff to ensure that the Commission goals
 are met.

 Directs the establishment and maintenance of essential and
 confidential records and files to ensure that services delivery
 and administrative information is retained and readily
 accessible.

 Familiarizes staff and consumers on the various types of
 technology used by the Blind and Visually Impaired.

 Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has
 responsibility for effectively recommending the hiring, firing,
 promoting, demoting and/or disciplining of employees.

 May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EDUCATION:

      Graduation from an accredited college or university with a
 Bachelor's degree supplemented by a Master's degree in social
 work, psychology, public administration, education,
 rehabilitation, counseling or related field.

      EXPERIENCE:

      Four (4) years of supervisory experience providing
 vocational rehabilitation, education or other services to blind
 or visually impaired individuals.

      NOTE: Applicants who do not possess the Master's degree
 may substitute two (2) additional years of supervisory experience
 as described above.

      LICENSE:

      Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license
 valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather
 than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential
 duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of supervisory principles and techniques.

 Knowledge of the vocational, educational, health and other needs
 and services likely to be required by blind or visually impaired
 individuals

 Knowledge of the community resources likely to be available to
 provide needed services for the blind and visually impaired.

 Knowledge of program evaluation techniques.

 Ability to oversee quality control activities for the evaluation
 of program services.

 Ability to manage and monitor fiscal and other resources.

 Ability to prepare and direct the preparation of clear,
 technically sound, accurate, and informative reports containing
 findings, conclusions, and recommendations.

 Ability to prepare correspondence.

 Ability to manage administrative program activities of the
 regional office.

 Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working
 relationships with the representatives of other agencies
 interested or involved in the work of the program.

 Ability to identify and utilize community resources.

 Ability to assign, instruct, supervise, and evaluate the work of
 subordinates.

 Ability to analyze and evaluate program operations.

 Ability to read and interpret laws, rules and regulations and
 apply them to specific situations.

 Ability to supervise the activities of staff engaged in providing
 services to the blind and visually impaired.

 Ability to provide recommendations for the resolution of
 operational problems.

 Ability to establish and maintain essential records and files.

 Ability to analyze existing and proposed legislation to identify
 impact.

 Ability to evaluate the need for assistive technology for staff
 and clients.

 Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic an/or
 manual recording and information systems used by the agency,
 office, or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
 English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.
 American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as
 acceptable forms of communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as they can perform the essential functions of the job after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If
 the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the
 employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 CODES:  29/M29 - 62680             MCK                 4/21/01

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree
supplemented by a Master's degree in social work, psychology, public administration, education, rehabilitation, counseling or related field

alternativeQualifications: Two additional years of supervisory experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job description specifies that a Master's degree in social work, psychology, public administration, education, rehabilitation, counseling, or a related field is a requirement, indicating that a degree is mandatory. However, there is an alternative qualification mentioned: applicants who do not have a Master's degree can substitute it with two additional years of supervisory experience in the relevant field. Therefore, while the degree is initially mandatory, there is an alternative pathway that allows for qualification without it, hence both questions have the same conclusion.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job if the applicant fulfills the experience requirement. While a Master's degree in social work, psychology, public administration, education, rehabilitation, counseling, or a related field is preferred, candidates without a Master's degree may substitute it with two additional years of the required supervisory experience. Therefore, the job allows for flexibility by recognizing extensive relevant experience as a substitute for advanced formal education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that applicants must have a Bachelor's degree supplemented by a Master's degree in social work, psychology, public administration, education, rehabilitation, counseling, or a related field. This educational requirement presents a barrier to hiring applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Additionally, while there is an option to substitute the Master's degree with two additional years of supervisory experience, the Bachelor's degree requirement remains a barrier.

name: Accident Record Reviewer
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 ACCIDENT RECORD REVIEWER 

 DEFINITION:

 Under the direction of a Principal Accident Record Reviewer or other
 supervisor in a State Department or Agency, assists with the work
 involved  in  the  non-professional  analysis,  recording  and/or
 coding  of  motor  vehicle  or traffic  information;  does  other
 related duties.

 NOTE:  The  examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes  only.  A particular position using this title  may  not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Collects  data concerning prevailing conditions and precipitating
 circumstances  in relation to motor vehicle accidents  and  makes
 non-professional analyses.

 Reads  the  reports  relating  to a specific  accident,  makes  a
 judgement  as  to  which report has presented the  most  accurate
 account, and /or combines information from several reports.

 Codes the accident  information  into  Electronic  Data  Entry
 Terminals for storage in an EDP system.

 May  maintain  a location file of motor vehicle accident  records
 and, using the records in this file, determines locations of high
 accident incidence.

 Makes field trips to accident sites to make studies as required.

 May  prepare simple statistical summaries, ratios, averages,  and
 other  figures that can contribute toward the analysis of factors
 affecting motor vehicle accidents.

 Prepares  maps,  charts,  graphs, and diagrams  illustrating  the
 frequency,  type,  and other factors relating  to  motor  vehicle
 accidents.

 Redrafts local geographic maps to show new alignments of roadways
 in area of high accident incidence by contacting local police and
 engineers as required.

 Prepares statistical, progress, and other reports.

 Appears  in  court  to  verify  information  containing  accident
 summarization as may be required.

 May maintain records and files.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or  manual  recording  and information  system  used  by 
 the agency, office or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

 EXPERIENCE:

 One (1) year of experience in the non-professional analysis,
 recording and/or coding of information.

 LICENSE:

 Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in 
 New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee 
 mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of the laws, rules, regulations relating to the control
 of motor vehicle traffic in New Jersey as set forth inTitle 39 of  
 the revised statues of Motor Vehicles and Traffic Regulations
 and the New Jersey Driver's Manual after a period of training.

 Knowledge of the principles and problems involved in the
 collection and organization of statistical data relating to motor
 vehicle accidents.

 Knowledge of the current problems of traffic control and  traffic
 safety in New Jersey after a period of training.

 Ability to make a non-professional analysis and remember detailed
 information and codes  elating to motor vehicle traffic regulations 
 and operations.

 Ability to read maps and diagrams and make proper application of
 all legends and scales.

 Ability  to make an analysis of accident locations from a written
 description.

 Ability  to  make  judgement of cause of accidents  from  varying
 reports.

 Ability to maintain a location file of motor vehicle accident
 records and, using the records in this file, to determine
 locations for high accident incidence.

 Ability  to  prepare statistical summaries, ratios, averages  and
 other figures which can contribute toward the analysis of factors
 relating to motor vehicle accidents.

 Ability to prepare maps, charts, graphs and diagrams illustrating
 the  frequency, types and other factors relating to motor vehicle
 accidents.

 Ability to prepare reports.

 Ability to maintain records and files.

 Ability  to  learn to utilize various types of electronic  and/or
 manual  recording information systems used by the agency,  office
 or related units.

 Ability  to  read,  write, speak, understand, or  communicate  in
 English  sufficiently  to perform the duties  of  this  position.
 American  Sign  Language or Braille may  also  be  considered  as
 acceptable forms of communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long 
 as they can perform essential functions of the job with or without 
 reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be 
 made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, 
 such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote21732SC3509N/AA08-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 10/17/2015

The job requires one year of experience in non-professional analysis, recording, and/or coding of information. Knowledge and skills needed for the position, such as understanding traffic laws, making non-professional analyses, reading maps, and preparing reports, can be acquired through training and experience rather than a formal educational degree. The job specification focuses on abilities, knowledge, and experience rather than educational qualifications.

There are no barriers stated in the job description that suggest a degree is necessary for applying or being hired for the role.

name: Engineering Technician 3
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN  3

DEFINITION

Under general direction of a supervising engineer title or other supervisor 
in a state department, institution, or agency, supervises a unit of technicians 
engaged in engineering support functions; prepares and signs official 
performance evaluations for subordinate staff; does other related duties as 
required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only. 
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this 
job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be 
listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Organizes, plans, schedules, and supervises activities of a party or parties 
performing investigations, inspections, and surveys involved in engineering 
and planning projects and related work.

Trains and supervises subordinates in collection, assembly, analysis, 
manipulation, and recording of data for use in engineering projects and/or 
for use in developing forecasts/projections relative to planning studies.

Visits work locations in the field to ensure that proper procedures are being 
followed and to review raw data for accuracy/completeness.

May develop sketches in the field of existing conditions.

Plans, organizes, and assigns work of the organizational unit and evaluates 
employee performance and conduct, enabling the effective recommendation 
of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of subordinates.

Evaluates data at all stages of collection, assembly, and presentation to 
determine that they meet existing specifications.

Develops and interprets the more difficult proofs, charts, maps, and other 
project plans, and may supervise subordinates in this work.

Maintains complete records pertaining to performance and functions of 
assigned subordinates.

Participates in the design of features; performs mathematical computations 
involved in engineering construction and operations; may be assigned 
responsibility for designing small construction projects under direction of an 
engineer.

Establishes sampling plans.

Makes studies, prepares reports, performs statistical calculations, collects 
samples, and makes tests.

Ensures that subordinates are familiar with all plans, specifications, policies, 
procedures, and amendments relating to their specific assignments, and that 
they are complying with them.

Makes recommendations pertaining to specifications, investigations, 
inspections, and survey procedures.

Assumes responsibility for maintenance of records and files.

Performs various types of complex surveys necessary for the design 
and/or construction of state roads, bridges, parks, buildings, and structures 
including property surveys, horizontal and vertical surveys of projects, and 
post-construction quantitative analyses.

Operates and ensures that proper care is given to surveying equipment, 
testing equipment, and miscellaneous recording devices.

Operates Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) systems.

Sets up and supervises the set up of safety and surveying equipment.

May be required to carry signs and surveying equipment, clear brush and 
pound stakes, hubs, and rebar.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information system used by the agency, office, or related units.

WHEN ASSIGNED TO TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT:

Organizes, plans, schedules, trains, supervises, and assigns work to 
engineering technicians in gathering, analyzing, manipulating, and 
arranging traffic and incident data for use in engineering projects.

Performs complex duties relating to engineering support work for traffic 
engineering projects.

Compiles information for inclusion in traffic incident and accident reports.

Coordinates and monitors roadway construction activities and evaluates 
such areas for traffic congestion and implements traffic diversion and/or 
detour routes as necessary.

Supervises engineering technicians in monitoring and disseminating 
information relating to emergency and non-emergency traffic conditions 
and incidents and assessing congestion levels and the severity of incident 
conditions.

Supervises the coordination of information with others such as transportation 
agencies, NJ Turnpike, NJ State Police, State and local police, fire/rescue, 
other neighboring states. 

Supervises engineering technicians in operating and monitoring intelligent 
transportation systems equipment such as closed-circuit television system 
and monitoring of the Departmentï¿½s radio transmissions for traffic information.

Evaluates traffic incidents and determines the necessary plan and response 
equipment needed to clear the roadway of incidents and implements traffic 
diversions and/or identifies alternate routes for traffic detours as required.

Monitors field equipment for malfunctions and resolves equipment problems.

Supervises the tracking and recording of traffic incidents.

Operates and supervises engineering technicians in operating motorist 
information systems such as variable message signs and the 511 system 
to provide information to the motoring public.

Supervises engineering technicians in comparing and checking for accuracy 
real-time traffic information with daily emergency traffic interference and 
planned traffic interference reports for use by engineers.

May assist in establishing and implementing policies and procedures including 
standard operating procedures.

Prepares reports and correspondence relating to traffic incidents.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

High school diploma and satisfactory completion of high school level courses 
in basic mathematics which shall have included completion of courses in 
Geometry and Algebra levels 1 and 2.

NOTE:  The responsibility for ensuring that employees have satisfactorily 
completed the required high school level courses rests with the Appointing 
Authority.

EXPERIENCE:

Four (4) years of technical experience performing engineering support tasks 
involved in the planning, surveying, design, inspection, investigation, and/or 
maintenance of various types of engineering projects or operations.

NOTE:  Semester hour credits in engineering or engineering technology from 
an accredited college or university may be substituted for the indicated 
experience on a year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits 
being equal to one (1) year of experience.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of procedures applied in engineering activities and related technical 
operations.

Knowledge of materials, tools, and equipment used in various engineering, 
construction, maintenance, and/or operational projects.

Knowledge of problems that arise when investigations, inspections, and surveys 
are made in the field, and of the precaution to be taken.

Knowledge of techniques and procedures used in gathering, analyzing, 
manipulating, and arranging data.

Knowledge of basic mathematical operations and basic geometry concepts.

Knowledge of principles of management and supervision.

Knowledge of department purposes, procedures, and standards.  

Ability to organize assigned field and office work, analyze and perform 
necessary operations, and develop effective work methods.

Ability to operate surveying and testing instruments.

Ability to supervise assigned staff and plan, organize and implement projects 
within the unit.

Ability to set up safety and surveying equipment.

Ability to prepare contract drawings utilizing Computer Aided Design and
 Drafting (CADD) systems.

Ability to perform duties requiring physical exertion such as carrying signs 
and survey equipment, clearing brush and pounding stakes, hubs, and rebar.

Ability to read and interpret plans, maps, and specifications.

Ability to supervise subordinates and to provide formal/informal instruction.

Ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with coworkers, s
upervisor, and with the public.

Ability to prepare clear, technically sound, accurate, and informative 
reports of investigations, inspections, surveys, and analyses containing f
indings, conclusions, and recommendations.

Ability to maintain records and files.

WHEN ASSIGNED TO TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT:

Knowledge of the techniques and procedures used in gathering, analyzing, 
manipulating, and arranging traffic and incident data for use in engineering 
projects.

Knowledge of the methods used in traffic control and the design of traffic 
control plans and safety set ups.

Knowledge of the functions and applications of the equipment used in 
incident management.

Knowledge of the general theory of traffic flow and traffic signal timing.

Knowledge of the New Jersey State highway system as it relates to traffic 
engineering.

Knowledge of the hazardous materials symbols and how to disseminate
 the information to responders of traffic incidents.

Knowledge of highway capacity calculations.

Knowledge of the general principles and practices of traffic engineering.

Ability to compile information for inclusion in traffic incident and accident 
reports.

Ability to monitor roadway construction activities for traffic congestion 
and to determine the appropriate plan and response equipment necessary 
to divert traffic and/or establish detour routes as required.

Ability to supervise engineering technicians in monitoring and disseminating 
information relating to traffic conditions and incidents and assessing information 
for use in engineering projects and to develop effective work methods.

Ability to coordinate traffic incidents and determine how to effectively clear 
incidents and/or reroute traffic.

Ability to operate communications equipment and software related to traffic.

Ability to establish working relationships with others and to communicate 
effectively.

Ability to monitor field equipment for malfunctions and resolve equipment 
problems.

Ability to track and record traffic incidents.

Ability to monitor radio transmissions for traffic information.

Ability to compare and check for accuracy traffic reports used in 
engineering projects.

Ability to read and interpret plans, maps, and specifications.

Ability to prepare reports and correspondence relating to traffic incidents.

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and 
information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform duties of this position. American Sign Language 
or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform 
essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to 
their known limitations.  If the accommodation cannot be made because it 
would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code(s) whichare different work week or work month and/or variants of the job class title:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote10120SC4018N/AR19-59955SC3518N/AR17-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 2/29/2020

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: High school diploma and satisfactory completion of high school level courses in basic mathematics which shall have included completion of courses in Geometry and Algebra levels 1 and 2.

alternativeQualifications: Four (4) years of technical experience performing engineering support tasks

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN 3 as described. The job requires a high school diploma and satisfactory completion of high school level courses in basic mathematics including Geometry and Algebra levels 1 and 2. Additionally, four years of technical experience in engineering support tasks is required. While higher education credits in engineering or engineering technology can be used to substitute for experience, it is not mandatory for the role. Therefore, a higher educational degree is not a strict requirement.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly state that a college or university degree is required. However, it mentions that semester hour credits in engineering or engineering technology from an accredited college or university may be substituted for the required experience. This implies that having such coursework could be an advantage for applicants, but it does not bar applicants without a degree if they meet the experience requirement through other means.

name: Chief Contract Administration Section

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a master's degree in Business Administration or Public Administration

alternativeQualifications: Nine (9) years of professional experience in work involving contract administration, program administration, financial management, and analysis, and/or budgets and management operations, with at least three (3) years in contract administration in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job as applicants can qualify through a combination of relevant professional experience and education. Options to qualify include having nine years of professional experience, a bachelor's degree with five years of experience, or a master's degree with four years of experience, each with a specified amount in a supervisory role. Therefore, while higher education can reduce the required experience, it is not mandatory as equivalent professional experience is also acceptable.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description presents a potential barrier to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree in the following way:

- It specifies that applicants must meet one of the following requirements: Nine years of professional experience with three years in contract administration in a supervisory capacity; OR possession of a bachelor's degree and five years of professional experience with three years in contract administration in a supervisory capacity; OR possession of a master's degree and four years of professional experience with three years in contract administration in a supervisory capacity. 

Although professional experience can substitute for a degree, the requirement of nine years of relevant professional experience could be a significant barrier for those without a degree, as it is set as a very high threshold compared to candidates who possess a bachelor's or master's degree.

name: Judiciary Clerk Driver
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


JUDICIARY CLERK DRIVER 

JUDICIARY SUPPORT STAFF BAND
(Transporting Services Track)

BAND SUMMARY

A position in the Judiciary Support Staff Band (Transporting Services Track) 
performs a variety of clerical, administrative, and supportive tasks in connection 
with the transportation needs of the Administrative Office of the Courts; 
and in support of the business operations of the Judicial Branch of the 
State of New Jersey. 

CLASSIFICATION FACTORS

Level 1 - Basic Non-Keyboarding (Judiciary Clerk Driver) operates a passenger, 
light duty truck, van, or other motor vehicle; carries out pick-up and delivery 
assignments; does light vehicle maintenance; and performs routine clerical duties.


NOTE: The above summary and following examples of work are for illustrative 
purposes only. Any one position may not necessarily include all of the tasks listed, 
nor do the examples cover all of the duties which may be performed. 

TASKS

Operate automobiles, light duty trucks, vans or other motor vehicles.

Transport supplies, correspondence, equipment and staff to designated 
destinations.

Check condition of fleet vehicles and sees they are properly serviced and 
maintained in good operating condition.

Make minor repairs and adjustments to motor vehicles.

Service, wash, clean, wax and polish motor vehicles

Keep motor vehicles supplied with gas, oil, water and emergency 
supplies.

Secure (obtain) titles and registrations for fleet vehicles

Sort, collect, organize, route and distribute mail, cards, letters, material, and 
packages and/or office supplies.

Use hand truck or cart to move boxes and equipment from location to location.

Store, locate and retrieve records, files, supplies and equipment from various 
locations.

Box, label and prepare files for transfer to offsite locations.

Transport cash and/or other currency to bank for deposit.

Provide emergency courier service

Record (log) incoming correspondence.

Distribute or route correspondence or files to appropriate offices or people.

Send and receive regular, insured, special delivery, express, certified, or 
registered mail to appropriate individuals or agencies.

Store materials, equipment, records, parts and supplies for future needs.

Operate photocopying and other office (fax) equipment.

Compute simple numerical data (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).

Collect (pick-up) correspondence, packages, reports, other materials, 
and equipment.

Process equipment deliveries in warehouse.

Maintain warehouse in a clean, safe environment.

Return equipment to warehouse.

Dispose of surplus equipment 

Complete standard office or agency forms.

Report motor vehicle or office equipment malfunctions to supervisor or 
repairperson.

Inventory materials, parts, or supplies

Adjust office machines.

Record information into manual recordkeeping systems

Route telephone calls

Distribute materials, equipment, parts or supplies

Stoop, bend and stretch to reach job-related materials

Lift and move heavy objects 

COMPETENCIES

Level 1

VEHICLE OPERATION - Competently, safely and efficiently operates cars, 
vans, and light trucks.  Complies with the New Jersey motor vehicle laws and 
the Judiciary's motor vehicle policy.

PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE - Selects and understands procedures, 
machines or tools that will produce the desired results; identifies or solves 
problems in vehicles, machines or other motorized equipment as they relate 
to performing tasks.  (For example, maintenance, service and care including 
cleaning, lubrication, servicing of batteries, and care of tires and lights).

CONSCIENTIOUSNESS -- Displays a high level of effort and commitment 
towards performing work; demonstrates responsible behavior.

LISTENING -- Receives, attends to, interprets, and responds to verbal messages 
and other cues such as body language in ways that are appropriate to listeners 
and situations, and shows dignity and respect to all.

WRITING -- Uses correct English grammar, punctuation, and spelling to 
communicate thoughts, ideas, information and messages in writing.

MANAGES AND ORGANIZES INFORMATION -- Identifies a need; gathers, 
organizes, and maintains information; determines its importance and accuracy, 
and communicates it by a variety of methods.  (For example, manual record keeping).

SPEAKING -- Uses correct English grammar to organize and communicate 
ideas in words that are appropriate to listeners and situations; uses body language 
appropriately.

PERCEPTUAL SPEED -- Sees details in words, numbers, pictures, and graphs, 
quickly and accurately.

EYE-HAND COORDINATION (Non-Keyboarding) -- Accurately coordinates 
one's eyes with one's fingers, wrists, or arms to move, carry, or manipulate 
objects.  (For example, operation of general office machines without a keyboard, 
such as a photocopier, fax machine, dating machine, telephone.)

READING -- Learns from written material by determining the main idea or 
essential message.  Recognizes correct English grammar, punctuation, and 
spelling.

RESOURCE HANDLING -- Selects, acquires, stores, and distributes resources 
such as materials, equipment or money.

ARITHMETIC -- Performs computations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, 
and division correctly.

PHYSICAL STRENGTH AND AGILITY --  Bends, lifts, climbs, stands and walks 
for extended periods of time, perform moderately heavy laboring work, and uses 
proper body mechanics.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

COMMON TO ALL LEVELS

	LICENSE

	Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in NJ.   

	NOTE:    The responsibility for ensuring that employees possess the 
required motor vehicle license, commensurate with the class and type of vehicles 
they operate, rests with the Appointing Authority.

Major Occupational Group: Transporting Services

Occupational Family: Judiciary Support Staff Band

Band                                          Title       Title
Level   Title Description	 Code   Reference  Svc  Week,Year
 
  1       Judiciary Clerk Driver   77113   90710101   (C)   35, 12

EFFECTIVE: 09/07/02

alternativeQualifications: driver's license valid in NJ

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of Judiciary Clerk Driver in the State of New Jersey. The job involves tasks such as operating vehicles, transporting supplies and staff, performing light vehicle maintenance, sorting and distributing mail, and other clerical duties. The primary requirement is possessing a valid driver's license in New Jersey. The job focuses more on practical skills, competencies such as vehicle operation, conscientiousness, listening, and physical abilities, rather than educational qualifications.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in NJ.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: There are no explicit barriers or obstacles stated, suggested, or described in the job description to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree. The job description lists minimum requirements that include possessing a valid driver's license in New Jersey, but it does not mention any educational requirements.

name: Technical Support Specialist 2 State Commission Investigation
text:
Job Specification 90462 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 90462 

TECHNICAL SUPPORT SPECIALIST STATE COMMISSION OF INVESTIGATION

 

DEFINITION


 Under the general direction of the Network Administrator or Assistant
 Director, provide technical support, assistance, and training for
 information technology systems, applications, and hardware. Assist in
 the maintenance and administration of the local area network (LAN) and
 centralized/remote network services. Install, maintain, upgrade, and
 troubleshoot end user desktop and laptop computers including hardware,
 software and printers. Identify, research and resolve technical
 problems. Document, track, monitor, and report problems to ensure
 timely resolution; does other related duties.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only. A particular position using this title may not perform
 all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties
 performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Provide troubleshooting and technical assistance to system users.
 Monitor the Help Desk via telephone and e-mail. Record support
 requests and problems and take the necessary steps to isolate
 problems. Take corrective measures and provide accurate documentation
 and clear concise instruction on problem resolution.

 Provide assistance and training to system users experiencing
 difficulty with or having questions about hardware, software, access
 and applications. Assist in developing documentation and providing
 staff training for operating systems, word processing, spreadsheet,
 database, e-mail, network services, and investigative document and
 case management systems.

 Log all help desk calls in the Help Desk database and assign requests
 to the appropriate support staff.

 Generate weekly Help Desk reports reflecting completed, outstanding or
 cancelled requests. Provide reports and other documentation to the
 Network Administrator.

 Assist in configuring and installation of PC systems. Deliver, unpack,
 setup and connect new PCs to the network. Install standard images and
 configure PC`s with user specific login information. Tests to ensure
 installations are operating properly.

 Assist in installing and configuring printers and other peripherals.
 Deliver, unpack, setup and connect new printers and peripherals. Tests
 to ensure installations are operating properly.

 Assist in installing and configuring standard desktop software i.e.
 Microsoft Office Suite, Windows OS, e-mail and other applications.
 Tests to ensure installations are operating properly.

 Perform upgrades and repairs of PC equipment. Diagnose, repair,
 replace or add components to PC systems i.e. modems, nics, scanners,
 drives, memory, etc. Tests to ensure installations are operating
 properly.

 Assist in maintaining the NT network. Document and maintain server
 backups. Perform Server Health Checks. Perform disaster recovery and
 information archiving procedures including tape rotations, tape backup
 processing and verification. Document and report results.

 Assist in scheduling and development of documented procedures
 associated with disaster recovery, backup, and archiving strategies.

 Operate a variety of audiovisual equipment used to aid for
 investigations, public hearings and training including editing
 machines, video tape recorders, television and movie cameras, LCD
 projectors and audio recorders.

 Utilize equipment to create duplicates of audio/video media for
 purposes of review, dissemination or submission into evidence.

 Setup and test audio/visual equipment for meetings, presentations, and
 public hearings.

 Assist staff in the creation of Microsoft PowerPoint presentations for
 use in investigations, public hearings and training.

 Provide technical assistance and instruction on the use of audiovisual
 equipment.

 Maintain accurate and timely asset tracking and inventory of equipment
 including hardware and software. Label and identify equipment as
 required.

 Compile and record inventory information and prepare reports.

 Maintain records of invoices, receipts, requisitions and other
 inventory documents.

 Work with the Network Administrator and staff to develop web site
 application design, specifications and objectives.

 Assist in the design, develop, implement, debug and release web site
 applications utilizing web site creation software and programming
 languages.

 Assist in coordinating web site development plans with the Office of
 Information and Technology (OIT). Ensure compatibility and consistency
 with the State's guidelines for web site architecture and
 capabilities.

 Assist and perform conversion of hard copy reports, graphics and other
 information into web based usable form.

 Analyze web site information to determine utilization and trends.
 Prepare reports and other documentation as required.

 Prepare reports of information technology matters.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the agency,
 office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EDUCATION:

      Graduation from an accredited college or university with a
 Bachelor's degree which must include a minimum of eighteen (18)
 semester hour credits in mathematics and/or computer science.

      NOTE: Applicants who do not possess the Bachelor's degree but
 possess the 18 semester hour credits may substitute additional
 experience or formal training in Computer Science/Information
 Technology on a year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour
 credits being equal to one (1) year of experience.

      NOTE: Applicants may be required to obtain certification as a
 Microsoft Certified Support Engineer (MCSE)

      EXPERIENCE:

      Two (2) years of experience in data processing systems analysis
 and programming design, or the analysis of work methods and processes,
 or the operation of multi-program or client/server computer systems,
 or working in the support areas of computer scheduling, input/output
 control and magnetic data control in the data processing field or help
 desk, one (1) year of which shall have been in the technical support
 area solving user problems in a help desk or related environment or
 using productivity aids and job control languages.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid
 in NJ only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
 mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of the responsibilities, regulations, policies and
 procedures of the Commission.

 Knowledge of the broad spectrum of data and information processing
 technologies including server hardware and associated software,
 microcomputer hardware, operating systems, software, peripheral
 devices and supportive operational equipment.

 Knowledge of the broad spectrum of data communications technologies
 including local area networking and the telecommunication components
 used to interconnect servers to communication devices and ultimately
 clients.

 Knowledge of and familiarity with capabilities, operating
 characteristics, programming, techniques and intricacies of all data
 and information processing equipment, peripheral devices and software.

 Knowledge of word processing hardware and software and methods for
 utilizing these tools in the most efficient and cost effective manner.

 Knowledge of information system design concepts and the many
 alternative manual, mechanical, and electronic means for gathering and
 storing data as well as converting data into useful information at
 lowest cost.

 Knowledge of countermeasures for dealing with network security and
 virus protection.

 Ability to interpret the information and/or intelligence needs of the
 Commission and translate those needs into a data processing system,
 with adaptations as required

 Ability to establish goals and set priorities, work independently or
 in a team environment, schedule and organize work activities and
 identify/resolve problems which arise.

 Ability to establish and maintain liaison with the Office of
 Information Technology and outside vendors as to the data processing
 requirements and needs of the agency.

 Ability to develop, conduct or coordinate training for Commission
 personnel when new or revised systems are to be implemented.

 Ability to maintain or supervise the maintenance of essential records
 and files.

 Ability to prepare charts, programs and instructions as needed to
 illustrate, explain, and implement data and information processing
 procedures and programs.

 Ability to analyze existing data processing problems and recommend
 solutions.

 Ability to orally and in written form communicate effectively with
 technical staff and agency heads.

 Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording
 and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English
 sufficiently to perform duties of this position. American Sign
 Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
 communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
 they can perform essential functions of the job after reasonable
 accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the accommodation
 cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship,
 such persons may not be eligible.
