This creates a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. However, there is a note that allows for substitution of the Bachelor's degree requirement with additional experience or formal training in Computer Science/Information Technology on a year-for-year basis, which could potentially mitigate this barrier for some applicants.

name: Corrections Ombudsperson
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


CORRECTIONS OMBUDSPERSON

Unclassified N.J.S.A. 11A:3-4(L)
(Governor-appointed position)

DEFINITION

Under direction of the Governor or designee, will function as the head of 
the Office of the Corrections Ombudsperson (OCO) to enforce the rights 
of people who are incarcerated, provide access to the benefits to which 
they are entitled, and ensure accountability, transparency, monitoring, and 
continued improvements within all [of New Jerseyï¿½s] correctional facilities 
(N.J.S.A. 30:1B-6.6c.); shall establish and implement procedures for eliciting, 
receiving, processing, responding, and resolving complaints from people 
who are incarcerated, their families, other interested citizens, public officials, 
and government agencies concerning conditions in the correctional facilities;
does other related duties as required.
	
NOTE:  The New Jersey Legislature created the Office of the Corrections 
Ombudsperson (OCO) in 2005 and mandated it to resolve complaints concerning 
the conditions of confinement for people sentenced to State custody.  Much has 
changed since 2005, and in 2020, Governor Phil Murphy signed a bill strengthening 
the OCO and charging it ï¿½to enforce the rights of inmates, provide access to the 
benefits to which they are entitled, and ensure accountability, transparency, 
monitoring, and continued improvements within all [of New Jerseyï¿½s] correctional 
facilities.ï¿½  N.J.S.A. 30:1B-6.6c.  The responsibilities of the OCO are laid out 
P.L. 2019, c. 288.  OCO provides information to people who are incarcerated and 
to their families; promotes public awareness and understanding of the rights and 
responsibilities of individuals who are incarcerated; identifies systemic issues and 
responses for the Governor and the Legislature to act upon; and ensures compliance 
with relevant statutes, rules and policies pertaining to corrections facilities, services 
and treatment of incarcerated people under the jurisdiction of the New Jersey 
Department of Corrections (DOC).

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Establish priorities for the OCO in line with available resources.

Provide protection for the rights of people who are incarcerated and establish 
procedures to receive, investigate, and resolve complaints regarding issues that 
adversely affect the health, safety, welfare and rights of individuals who are 
incarcerated.

Forestall problems for people who are incarcerated by facilitating early recognition 
of complaints and problems and providing an avenue for prompt redress.

Provide information to people who are incarcerated, family members, representatives, 
DOC employees, and others regarding the rights of people who are in prison.

Maintain toll-free telephone numbers, a website, and a mailing address for receipt of 
complaints and/or inquiries, and logs and responds to inquiries in a timely and helpful 
manner.

In collaboration with the OCO Advisory Board, establishes procedures to gather 
stakeholder input for OCO activities and priorities, and to promote public awareness 
of the OCO and the correctional system.

Provide technical assistance to support the capacity of people who are incarcerated 
to participate in self-advocacy.

Monitor compliance with applicable federal, State, county, and municipal laws, rules, 
regulations, and policies related to the health, safety, welfare, and rehabilitation of 
people who are incarcerated.

Conduct inspections of all DOC facilities on a regular basis and interview people 
who are incarcerated regarding grievances or complaints. 

Monitor and participate in legislative and policy developments affecting correction 
facilities and educate OCO and DOC staff and people who are incarcerated on state 
and federal developments.

Establish a Statewide uniform reporting system to collect and analyze data related 
to complaints received by the Ombudsperson regarding the department.

Establish procedures to receive, investigate, and resolve complaints.

Regularly prepare clear, accurate, and informative reports and correspondence 
containing findings, analyses, conclusions, and recommendations for the 
Department of Corrections, the Governorï¿½s Office, the Legislature, and the public. 

Lead a team of Assistant Corrections Ombudspeople and other OCO employees to 
carry out the mission of the OCO, including determining work assignments, completing 
employee evaluations, and recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting, a
nd/or disciplining of employees.   

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree. 

EXPERIENCE:

Six (6) years of experience working with or advocating for people who are 
incarcerated, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.
				OR
Six (6) years of experience conducting investigations or leading litigation of prison 
conditions or abuses involving varied and often complex documentation, including 
custodial documents, disciplinary records, and medical and mental health records; 
two (2) years of which would be working directly with individuals who are incarcerated; 
three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.
				OR
Six (6) years of criminal justice policy and advocacy experience including working 
on legislative or administrative reform; three (3) years of which shall have been in 
a supervisory capacity.
                                OR
Six (6) years of experience in a combination of the policy, advocacy, investigative, 
or legal roles outlined above.  

NOTE:  A candidate for this appointment may not be disqualified under 
N.J.S.A. 52:27EE-26(d)(2).  If appointed, the Corrections Ombudsperson will 
report to the Governor and shall hold office for a term of five years and may 
continue to hold office until reappointed.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of applicable federal, State, county, and municipal laws, rules, 
regulations, and policies related to the health, safety, welfare, and rehabilitation 
of people who are incarcerated.

Knowledge of policy, practice, and culture common in correctional settings.

Knowledge of caseload management and prioritization of work.

Knowledge and understanding of the impact of incarceration on the individual, 
family, and community.

Knowledge and understanding of the Prison Rape Elimination Act.

Ability to be neutral and impartial and not act as an advocate for the complainant 
or the DOC.

Ability to manage multiple projects and issues concurrently.

Ability to review, interpret and analyze state and federal laws.

Ability to understand issues related to diverse corrections populations including 
race, ethnicity, immigration status, gender, and LGBTQ+ incarcerated individuals.

Ability to work with diverse stakeholders.

Ability to work independently and with integrity.

Ability to manage assigned staff and plan, organize, and implement projects within 
the office.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recordings 
and computer information systems and software applications used by the agency, 
office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently 
to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign Language or Braille may 
also be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform the 
essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.  If 
the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer 
undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote60295SUNL98N/AX98-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 12/04/2021

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job for Corrections Ombudsperson requires a higher educational degree, specifically a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. This requirement is likely in place to ensure that the candidate has a foundational level of education that equips them with the necessary analytical, managerial, and communication skills needed to perform the duties of the position effectively. Additionally, the experience requirements, which include specific years spent in relevant roles and in supervisory capacity, indicate the need for a professional with a comprehensive understanding of the corrections system, advocacy, policy, and legal implications. A higher educational degree supports developing such an understanding and skill set.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree is specified as a requirement for this position. This presents a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree.

name: Administrator Law & Public Safety
text:
Job Specification 30358 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 30358 

ADMINISTRATOR, LAW AND PUBLIC SAFETY
                                                    UNCLASSIFIED
                                                    N.J.S.A. 11:4-4u
  

DEFINITION


       Under administrative direction of the Attorney General, First
  Assistant Attorney General, or Division Director in the Department of
  Law and Public Safety, develops and implements policy designated to
  facilitate the application of all operational and administrative
  processes.  Manages the procurement and utilization of human, fiscal,
  and other resources, and institutes programs, systems and procedures
  deemed vital to efficient operations.  Develops short and long term
  plans to insure attainment of established goals, and to provide all
  appropriate levels of management with guidance/support on
  administrative and operational matters; does related work as required.

  
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


       Prepares recommendations, rules, regulations, and revisions of
  existing procedures for submission, using considerable initiative and
  independent judgement in order to update and refine current systems,
  procedures and practices.

       Formulates policy recommendations related to existing/new
  legislation, regulations and governmental procedures which impact on
  organizational objectives.

       Manages the development and execution of plans and programs, the
  procurement, allocation, and utilization of services, equipment, space,
  personnel and other resources, in order to foster and maintain optimum
  levels of efficiency and effectiveness.

       Manages the work programs in the areas of assigned responsibility
  in a manner designed to achieve short and long term organizational
  goals.  Reviews and coordinates qualitative and quantitative
  evaluations and implements recommendations in order to monitor and
  increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the operation.

       Directs preparation and execution of the organization's annual
  budget, legislative supplemental appropriation, and public and private
  grant funding proposals in order to maximize fiscal resources.  As
  required represents the Department at meetings/hearings with members of
  the Legislature, the Office of the Governor, and with representatives
  of the Office of Management and Budget.

       Directs the formulation and development of programs and policies;
  reviews current programs and objectives applying technical knowledge to
  promote an effective and uninterrupted work flow.

  Directs management personnel in formulating and executing new
  operational plans and revising existing plans and procedures which are
  responsive to and promote departmental goals, objectives, and
  standards.

       Establishes goals and objectives within broad program guidance in
  order to facilitate budgetary, personnel and other planning processes.
  Review/analyzes regular and special reports to determine needs to
  modify existing plans; as required, formulates new plans to satisfy
  short and long-term requirements.

       Responsible for the development of accurate and comprehensive
  project management planning, control and reporting systems for existing
  and proposed projects in terms of needs assessment, operational
  analysis and procedures review.

       Provides appropriate assignments, instructions, and guidance to
  managers, and other support staff applying knowledge of the operation
  to achieve efficiency and effectiveness.

       Formulates task forces, project teams, or other matrix
  organizations to review, investigate, develop or implement programs,
  policies or other activities as required.  Supervises the activities of
  designated managers/team leaders, evaluates outputs derived from their
  activities and takes action consistent with the Department's goals.

       Conducts meetings with executive staff and with representatives of
  external entities to facilitate application of relevant law, rules, and
  policies.  Serves as the Attorney General's liaison with federal, local
  and other governmental jurisdictions.

       Conducts or directs the conduct of studies of the organizations
  computerization needs/capabilities to identify measures designed to
  enhance efficiency.  Formulates guidelines for the development of
  related programs and projects.  In concert with OAG, OTIS and OMB
  oversees the design and implementation of appropriate systems.

       Reviews reports and makes appropriate recommendations concerning
  matters such as organization, staffing, work procedures, work flow,
  administrative directives, etc.

       Prepares or directs preparation of regular and special reports to
  apprise the Attorney General of activities, trends, or conditions which
  affect operations or management of resources.  As required, initiates,
  monitors, receives and evaluates confidential investigations and
  analyses of internal and external operations; makes appropriate
  recommendations.

       Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has
  responsibility for employee evaluations and for effectively
  recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, demoting and/or
  disciplining of employees.

  REQUIREMENTS:

       EDUCATION:

           Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's degree
  supplemented by a Master's degree in Business Administration, Public
  Administration or a related field.

       EXPERIENCE:

           Eight (8) years of experience administering the financial,
  human resource, logistical, organizational and related systems of a
  large public or private organization, five (5) years of which shall
  have been in a supervisory capacity.

           A minimum of one (1) year of the experience indicated shall
  have involved the interpretation and application of public policy.

           NOTE: Applicants who do not possess the required education may
  substitute additional experience as indicated on a year for year basis.

       LICENSE:

           Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid
  in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
  mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

  Special Note:

         Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
  English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American
  Sign Language or braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
  communication.

         Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as
  long as they can perform the essential functions of the job after
  reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If the
  accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue
  hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

  CODE: M98-30358                   DDC                  11/05/93

supplemented by a Master's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or a related field

However, it allows for a substitution of additional experience (on a year for year basis) in place of the required educational qualifications. This implies that while a higher educational degree is strongly preferred and seen as important for the role, it is not absolutely required if the candidate has significant and relevant experience that compensates for the lack of formal education.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description requires graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's degree, supplemented by a Master's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or a related field. Although there is a note allowing for substitution of required education with additional experience on a year-for-year basis, the necessity for post-secondary education could still be considered a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree.

name: Assistant Business Manager Institutions
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 ASSISTANT BUSINESS MANAGER INSTITUTIONS

 DEFINITION: 

 Assists a Business Manager 2, in the planning, supervision, and
 coordination of those functions and departments constituting the
 business  management area of one of the state institutions, and
 substitutes for the Business Manager 2 or 3 when necessary; 
 does other related duties.

 NOTE: The  examples of work for this title are for 
 illustrative purposes only.  A particular position using this 
 title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification.  
 Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Organizes and  supervises the business management work  
 programs of the institution.

 Conducts periodic inspections of buildings and grounds to 
 check on the efficiency of operation and maintenance of the 
 physical plant, the progress of construction projects, conditions 
 in food service,  laundry, housekeeping, stores, farms,  grounds,
 transportation, fire prevention, patrol services, and mechanical
 and other units of the institution; reports conditions encountered 
 to the Business Manager and brings to his/her attention any 
 matters requiring personal attention.

 Supervises the activities of the accounting unit and gives
 appropriate assignments and instructions to the employees  
 in charge of the various fiscal units.

 Supervises the ordering and purchasing of needed institutional
 supplies, and maintains liaison with department officers.

 Conducts inspections of storerooms,  the storage of equipment,
 materials, and supplies of varied kinds, and supervises inventory
 control.

 Conducts  periodic audits of all cash accounts and supervises 
 the maintenance of cash records and cash control procedures 
 including monthly bank reconciliation.

 Performs the personnel administration functions in institutions
 without a Personnel Officer.

 Verifies  state  appropriation and revenue records  periodically,
 and  reviews  all expense, food consumption, power  plant,  
 motor vehicle, and other fiscal reports.

 May prepare a portion of the annual budget request.

 Drafts correspondence in the course of official duties.

 Prepares, reviews and edits financial and statistical reports 
 and other reports.

 Controls and supervises federal grants, set up account 
 records, maintains same in accordance in conditions of the grants.

 Prepares the Capital budget forms in accordance with goals 
 and priorities established by the Business Manager.

 Manages the Campus store, commissary or canteen insuring 
 suitability of merchandise sold and proper pricing, hours of 
 operation to best serve residents and staff.

 Responsible for mail room, switchboard, duplicating and 
 printing facilities and activities.

 Supervises the maintenance of records and files.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by
 the agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

 EDUCATION:

 Graduation from an accredited university or college 
 with a Bachelor's degree in Business, Public or Hospital 
 Administration,  Accounting, Finance, or Economics.

 NOTE: A  valid  certificate as a Certified  Public
 Accountant   (CPA)  issued  by the  New  Jersey  
 State  Board of Accountancy may be substituted 
 for the Bachelor's degree in  Accounting.

 EXPERIENCE:

 Four (4) years of professional financial experience in
 a medical, educational, correctional, or training facility 
 or other business operation where responsibility shall 
 have included the  preparation of financial statements 
 and reports, review of financial records, overseeing the
 development of internal accounting control procedures, 
 and assisting in the development and analysis of an 
 office, unit, agency, or organizational budget, one (1) 
 year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

 NOTE:  A Master's degree in Business, Public 
 or Hospital Administration,  Accounting,  Finance, or 
 Economics may be substituted for one (1) year of the 
 non-supervisory experience.

 LICENSE:

 Appointee  will  be  required to  possess  a  driver's
 license  valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a
 vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to 
 perform the essential duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of the problems involved in the efficient operation 
 of the business unit of a complex institution or organization.

 Knowledge of the administrative techniques required in 
 conducting the business and fiscal affairs of a complex 
 institution or organization.

 Knowledge of accounting and budget procedures and practices.

 Knowledge  of  the accounting procedures used in conducting 
 the business affairs of a complex institution or organization.

 Ability to apply efficient operation methods to problems 
 encountered in kitchens and dining halls, and to the 
 maintenance of buildings, grounds, and equipment in a 
 public or private business operation or facility.

 Ability to organize assigned supervisory and technical work
 in the business unit of a large institution and to develop 
 effective work methods.

 Ability to conduct studies and surveys of the several units
 comprising the business office and prepare detailed reports.

 Ability to conduct physical inspections of buildings and 
 grounds and to check on the efficiency and standards of 
 food service, laundry, housekeeping, stores, fire prevention, 
 and patrol service of the institution.

 Ability to audit cash accounts and supervise cash control 
 records and procedures.

 Ability to supervise the requisitioning and purchase of 
 needed equipment, materials, and supplies.

 Ability to verify revenue records and review expense, food
 consumption, power plant, motor vehicle, and other fiscal 
 records with a view toward efficiency and economy.

 Ability to draft correspondence in the course of official duties.

 Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate, and informative
 statistical, financial, and other statements and reports of
 business management matters containing findings, 
 conclusions, and recommendations.

 Ability to supervise the maintenance of records and files.

 Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or
 manual recording and information systems used by the 
 agency, office, or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate 
 in English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.
 American  Sign  Language or Braille may also be 
 considered as acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as 
 long as they can perform the essential functions of the job 
 after reasonable accommodation is made to their known 
 limitations.  If the  accommodation cannot be made because 
 it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
 may not be eligible.

A Master's degree in Business, Public or Hospital Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics may be substituted for one (1) year of the non-supervisory experience.

alternativeQualifications: Valid certificate as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) issued by the New Jersey State Board of Accountancy

However, it provides an alternative qualification where a valid CPA certificate can substitute for the Bachelor's degree in Accounting. This indicates that having a degree is mandatory, but there is an accepted alternative pathway through certification, implying that alternative qualifications are available.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is required for the Assistant Business Manager Institutions job because the job description specifies the need for a Bachelor's degree in Business, Public or Hospital Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics. Alternatively, a valid CPA certificate can substitute for the Bachelor's degree. The educational requirement is necessary due to the complexity and responsibility associated with the financial and administrative tasks of the role, including supervising various units, preparing financial statements and reports, and maintaining internal accounting control procedures.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: Graduation from an accredited university or college with a Bachelor's degree in Business, Public or Hospital Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics is required, which acts as a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree. A substitute for a Bachelor's degree is a valid certificate as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) issued by the New Jersey State Board of Accountancy, but this still requires a level of formal qualification beyond a high school diploma or equivalent.

name: Supervisor Of Warehouses
text:
Job Specification 40133 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 40133 

SUPERVISOR OF WAREHOUSES

 

DEFINITION


 Under general direction of a supervisory official, supervises the
 activities of a receiving or distribution warehouse and storeroom
 supplying electrical, maintenance, and equipment parts and
 materials in a state department, institution, agency, college, or
 school; does other related duties.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Supervises the work programs and staff of a warehouse and
 storeroom located at a designated facility.

 Provides assignment, instruction, and supervision to subordinate
 employees engaged in requisitioning, storing, repairing, and
 supplying electrical maintenance and equipment parts, and
 materials.

 Establishes and maintains proper storage methods, and standards
 for the efficient use of existing storage space.

 Develops work schedules and methods.

 Establishes and maintains an inventory system.

 Supervises the preparation of requisitions for replenishment of
 stock.

 Plans, organizes, and assigns the work of the organizational unit
 and evaluates employee performance and conduct, enabling the
 effective recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and
 disciplining of subordinates.

 Evaluates the usability, adaptation, or obsolescence of varied
 types of stock, and the interchangeability of parts.

 Oversees the safe storage of stock and equipment in all assigned
 facilities.

 Supervises the checking of requisitions and purchase orders;
 maintains records of materials received and method of shipment.

 Investigates and supervises the investigation of complaints about
 stock and equipment.

 Prepares correspondence to dealers and vendors.

 Prepares accurate and informative reports of the department's
 warehouse program containing findings, conclusions, and
 recommendations.

 Supervises the maintenance of essential records, inventories, and
 files.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and computerized information systems used
 by the agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EXPERIENCE:

      Five (5) years of experience in the receipt, storage and
 distribution of electrical, maintenance, and/or mechanical
 equipment and parts, three (3) years of which shall have been in
 a supervisory capacity.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in New
 Jersey.

      NOTE: The responsibility for ensuring that employees
 possess the required motor vehicle license, commensurate with the
 class and type of vehicle they operate, rests with the Appointing
 Authority.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of the methods used to obtain, store, safeguard and
 distribute equipment, materials, parts and supplies.

 Knowledge of supervisory techniques.

 Knowledge of inventory methods and techniques.

 Knowledge of the problems encountered in warehouse operations.

 Ability to supervise the work involved in the receipt, storage
 and distribution of electrical, maintenance and mechanical
 equipment parts.

 Ability to provide assignments and instruction to assigned staff
 and supervise their work performance.

 Ability to establish and maintain an inventory system.

 Ability to estimate stock and equipment needs.

 Ability to investigate and resolve complaints.

 Ability to establish and maintain proper storage methods, and
 standards for the efficient use of storage space.

 Ability to supervise the checking and recording of deliveries.

 Ability to oversee the proper repair, maintenance and storage of
 mechanical equipment.

 Ability to prepare correspondence.

 Ability to prepare clear, sound, accurate, and informative
 reports of warehouse programs containing findings, conclusions,
 and recommendations.

 Ability to supervise the establishment and maintenance of
 essential records and files.

 Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
 related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in
 English sufficiently to perform duties of this position.
 American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as
 acceptable forms of communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as they can perform essential functions of the job after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If
 the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the
 employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 CODES:   19/M20 - 40133                 DJ             3/30/00

alternativeQualifications: Five (5) years of experience in the receipt, storage and distribution of electrical, maintenance, and/or mechanical equipment and parts, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job description specifies that the key requirement is five years of experience in the receipt, storage, and distribution of electrical, maintenance, and/or mechanical equipment and parts, with three years in a supervisory capacity. There is no mention of a requirement for a higher educational degree; instead, practical experience in relevant areas and supervisory skills are emphasized.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly state any requirement for a college or university degree. However, the requirement of "Five (5) years of experience in the receipt, storage, and distribution of electrical, maintenance, and/or mechanical equipment and parts, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity" could be a barrier for individuals who may have acquired relevant skills and knowledge through other means but do not have formal work experience in these areas. Furthermore, some applicants without a degree may not have had the opportunity to acquire this specific type and level of experience, particularly in a supervisory role.

name: Assistant Biologist
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


 ASSISTANT BIOLOGIST MOSQUITO CONTROL

 DEFINITION

 Under the supervision of a Principal Biologist (Mosquito Control)
 or other supervisory officer in the Department of Environmental
 Protection, participates in the technical, biological and
 ecological tasks involved in the planning, development and
 reviews of mosquito control activities; does other related work.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Examines  pesticides,  pesticide formulations,  and  reviews  new
 airspray techniques.

 Participates in the review and assessment of pesticide resistance
 in mosquitoes; investigates the effects of airspray activities on
 non-target organisms.

 Reviews Federal, State and local government facility requirements
 and those of contractual aircraft service facilities.

 Participates  in  the  inspection of the aircraft  facilities  of
 agencies submitting bids for airspray service contracts.

 Monitors aircraft pesticide applications, conditions, and  dosage
 levels.

 Coordinates  field activities for pesticide application  and  the
 monitoring of target and non-target organisms.

 Participates  in  the training of seasonal employees  in  coastal
 counties  to  monitor  and identify mosquito  populations,  their
 stages of development, and their breeding habitats.

 Identifies   suspected   violations  of   pesticide   application
 regulations.

 Provides  information to other agencies on program policies,  the
 aerial  application of insecticides, and participates in training
 sessions  concerning pesticide application,  equipment  use,  and
 other requirements necessary for State Certification.

 Participates  in the coordination of mosquito control  activities
 with  other  municipal and private mosquito control or  pesticide
 programs.

 Provides   mosquito   control  information  regarding   pesticide
 legislation, labeling, certification, training, and licensing.

 Prepares  clear,  technically sound,  accurate,  and  informative
 reports.

 When  required, provides testimony and acts as a witness for  the
 State at hearings and/or in court.

 Compiles,  tabulates,  and analyzes various  types  of  technical
 airspray program data.

 Prepares correspondence.

 Maintains records, reports, and files.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or  manual  recording and information  systems  used  by  the
 agency, office or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

           EDUCATION:

                  Graduation   from  an  accredited   college   or
 university  with  a  Bachelor's degree in one of  the  biological
 sciences.

           EXPERIENCE:

       One (1) year of experience in entomological or bio-chemical
 research,  or in the application of entomological or bio-chemical
 principles to field investigations or chemical control of  insect
 populations.

                 NOTE: A Master's degree in Biology or Entomology
 may be substituted for the year of experience.

           LICENSE:

                 Possession  of a Certified Pesticide  Applicator,
 Commercial license in the appropriate categories, issued  by  the
 New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection.

             Appointee  will  be  required to possess  a  driver's
 license  valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a  vehicle,
 rather  than  employee  mobility, is  necessary  to  perform  the
 essential duties of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of biological principles.

 Knowledge of the principles of entomology.

 Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of 
 mosquito control.

 Knowledge  of pesticides and their application, and the pesticide
 equipment.

 Ability  to  read  and interpret laws, rules and regulations  and
 apply them to specific situations.

 Ability to conduct surveys, and to collect and evaluate data.

 Ability to review and assess mosquito control activities.

 Ability  to coordinate mosquito control activities with those  of
 other units and organizations.

 Ability  to  provide advice and information on  mosquito  control
 regulations and practices.

 Ability   to   establish   and   maintain   cooperative   working
 relationships with other mosquito control personnel.

 Ability  to  prepare  clear,  technically  sound,  accurate   and
 informative   reports,  containing  findings,   conclusions   and
 recommendations.

 Ability to maintain records, and files.

 Ability  to  learn to utilize various types of electronic  and/or
 manual  recording  and information systems used  by  the  agency,
 office or related units.

 Ability  to  read,  write, speak, understand, or  communicate  in
 English  sufficiently  to perform the duties  of  this  position.
 American  Sign  Language or Braille may  also  be  considered  as
 acceptable forms of communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as  they  can  perform the essential functions of the  job  after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.   
 If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause
 the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote01752LMosquito ControlSCNE19N/AP19-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions.MER   7/07/2007

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences.
A Master's degree in Biology or Entomology may be substituted for the year of experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is required for this job as the minimum educational qualification specified is a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences. Additionally, a Master's degree in Biology or Entomology may substitute for the required one year of work experience, indicating the importance of formal education in the relevant field for this position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession of a Certified Pesticide Applicator, Commercial license in the appropriate categories, issued by the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in one of the biological sciences is required, which presents a barrier for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Additionally, the experience requirement states that a Master's degree in Biology or Entomology may be substituted for the year of experience, further emphasizing the preference for higher education degrees.

name: Supervisor Regional Food Service Operation

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a master's degree in Home Economics, Dietetics, Food Management, or associated field

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience in the management of a complex institution or commercial unit; two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as the job description allows for applicants to meet the criteria through professional experience alone. Specifically, eight years of relevant professional experience, with two years in a supervisory capacity, can substitute for formal education. Alternatively, a bachelor's or a master's degree in a related field can be used to meet the requirements with fewer years of experience. Therefore, the criteria provide flexibility in how qualifications can be met, either through higher education or extensive professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description presents a potential barrier to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree primarily through its education requirement. It states that applicants must meet one of the following: eight years of professional experience with at least two years in a supervisory capacity, or possession of a bachelor's or a master's degree with varying amounts of professional experience. While it allows for a combination of experience and education, the equivalency of 30 semester hours to one year of relevant experience may still pose a challenge for those without any degree, as it requires substantial professional experience to meet the requirement solely through this route.

name: Brand Manager State Lottery
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification



 BRAND MANAGER STATE LOTTERY

               Unclassified
               NJSA 11:4:4U and 11:7-12

 DEFINITION:

 Under  direction of the Deputy Director State Lottery, Department
 of  the  Treasury, establishes and is responsible for development
 of  a  marketing  plan, product promotion, and merchandising  and
 marketing  research  proposals  in  conjunction  with  particular
 brands   (lottery  games);  directs  execution  of  all   related
 projects/assignments  in  conjunction  with  advertising,  sales,
 product  positioning,  and  consumer  research;  coordinates  all
 phases  of lottery activities and interface with various sections
 of the State Lottery; does other related duties as required.

 NOTE:  The  examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes  only.  A particular position using this title  may  not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.
 
 EXAMPLES OF WORK:

 Develops  long  and short term marketing strategies/policies  for
 all components of the marketing mix of products.

 Consults  with  advertising  agencies  to  implement  strategies,
 inspects  data  regarding focus groups and  market  surveys,  and
 analyzes  statistical  data as it applies to  the  product  brand
 mixes.

 Monitors   sales  impacts  of  various  programs  subsequent   to
 implementation  and  makes contacts to  gather  data  from  other
 lottery states and countries.

 Studies   advertising  strategies  and  promotional   and   sales
 techniques  used by other lotteries and recommends action  to  
 be taken to benefit overall lottery sales.

 Consults     with    other    product    brand    managers     to
 coordinate/effectuate   the   most  beneficial   strategies   and
 techniques to improve overall lottery sales; interfaces with  all
 level  staff  in  planning  and research,  marketing,  sales  and
 finance  departments within the State Lottery as  well  as  other
 state agencies and private sector companies.

 Analyzes  products  in  terms  of  life  cycle,  portfolio,   and
 placement in overall marketing mix and develops an execution plan
 for coordination of this project.

 Monitors public response to advertising campaigns.

 Maintains records and files.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or  manual  recording and information  systems  used  by  the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EDUCATION:

      Graduation from an accredited college or university  with  a
 Bachelor's degree including or supplemented by three (3) semester
 hour  credits in statistics and six (6) semester hour credits  in
 marketing.

      NOTE:  Applicants who do not possess the required education
 may   substitute   additional  experience  as  indicated   on   a
 year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits  being
 equal to one (1) year of experience.

      EXPERIENCE:

      Three  (3)  years of management experience involving  market
 research  and planning, product promotion and merchandising,  and
 consumer research.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees  will  be required to possess a driver's  license
 valid  in  New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle,  rather
 than  employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties
 of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of sales promotion techniques.

 Knowledge of marketing.

 Knowledge of brand management.

 Knowledge of management principles and techniques.

 Knowledge  of  methods and techniques to interpret  advertisement
 surveys and evaluations.

 Knowledge of data collection and statistical  analysis  as  it
 relates to survey interpretation.

 Knowledge of media advertising.

 Knowledge  of New Jersey rules and regulations after a period  of
 training.

 Ability  to  interface with various disciplines, sections  within
 the  State  Lottery,  vendors, other state agencies  and  private
 sector organizations to most benefit product sales.

 Ability to manage a high volume product line.

 Ability  to analyze polls to determine public reaction to lottery
 advertising.

 Ability to plan and implement various public relations programs.

 Ability  to  establish and maintain cooperative  liaison  contact
 with public and private agencies.

 Ability  to  evaluate  results  of  advertising  and  promotional
 programs.

 Ability  to  organize assigned work and develop appropriate  work
 methods.

 Ability  to  prepare  correspondence in the  course  of  official
 duties.

 Ability  to  prepare  clear,  technically  sound,  accurate,  and
 informative   reports  containing  findings,   conclusions,   and
 recommendations.

 Ability to maintain records and files.

 Ability  to  utilize  various types of electronic  and/or  manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office,  or
 related units.

 Ability  to  read, write, speak, understand, and  communicate  in
 English   sufficiently  to  perform  duties  of  this   position.
 American  Sign  Language or Braille may  also  be  considered  as
 acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as  they  can  perform  essential  functions  of  the  job  after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  
 If the  accommodation  cannot be made because  it  would  cause  
 the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.
 
This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote61056SUNL98N/A&98-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 4/8/1998

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree including or supplemented by three (3) semester hour credits in statistics and six (6) semester hour credits in marketing.

alternativeQualifications: additional experience on a year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits being equal to one (1) year of experience

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: The job description for Brand Manager State Lottery specifies that a Bachelor's degree including or supplemented by credits in statistics and marketing is required. However, it also provides an alternative where the lack of the specified educational credentials can be substituted with additional relevant experience on a year-for-year basis. This indicates that while a higher educational degree is preferred, it is not absolutely required if the candidate has sufficient appropriate experience in lieu of formal education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Department of Motor Vehicles, New Jersey

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description poses potential barriers for applicants without a college or university degree due to the outlined education requirement. Specifically, it requires graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree, which includes or is supplemented by specific semester hour credits in statistics and marketing. Applicants without the required education can substitute it with additional experience on a year-for-year basis, which somewhat alleviates the barrier, but the initial emphasis on a degree might discourage those without one from applying.

name: Data Processing Librarian 1
text:
Job Specification 53363 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 53363 

DATA PROCESSING LIBRARIAN 1 (VARIANT TITLE C)

 NOTE: This specification will be used for the general nonvariant
 Data  Processing Librarian 1 and the following title variant  for
 Data Processing Librarian 1:

 Variant C - Designates - Data Center - OIT

 

DEFINITION


 Under  general  supervision in a Data Center or in a  subordinate
 Computer  Center  in a state department, agency, institution,  or
 State  College,  is responsible for storing and  controlling  all
 magnetic  and  punched  media, including media  stored  at  other
 locations,  and media stored in-house as an off-site service  for
 other state facilities; performs and oversees the maintenance and
 collection of magnetic tape reels, disk packs, and other magnetic
 media  used  for  automatic data processing  purposes,  maintains
 control  of subsidiary records, routes tapes, disks, and data  to
 appropriate  areas  within the Data Center;  does  other  related
 duties as required.

 NOTE: The  examples of work for this title are for  illustrative
 purposes  only.  A particular position using this title  may  not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Under  supervision,  oversees  and maintains  the  Data  Center=s
 collection  of  all magnetic and punched media,  including  media
 stored  as  an  off-site service to other  facilities  and  media
 stored at other locations.

 Maintains control of subsidiary records.

 Routes  tapes,  disks, and data to appropriate areas  within  the
 Data Center.

 Supervises Librarian 2, clerical personnel, in the performance of
 magnetic media library duties.

 Manages  work  operations  and/or functional  programs,  and  has
 responsibility  for  employee  evaluations  and  for  effectively
 recommending  the  hiring,  firing, promoting,  demoting,  and/or
 disciplining of employees.

 Ensures  the  security of the data and equipment in the  magnetic
 media library areas as directed.

 Performs and oversees the preparation and maintenance of  history
 records  for  each  reel  of magnetic  tape  in  the  collection,
 indicating  the  number of times used on specific operations  and
 the  number  of  errors encountered on each pass;  brings  faulty
 reels to the attention of the supervisor.

 Performs  and  oversees the maintenance of the log of  reels  and
 disks  currently  available for use; on a  daily  basis,  assigns
 appropriate media for production and test runs.

 Conducts and oversees the performance of numbering, labeling, and
 setting  up of records for new media entering the library;  makes
 the  necessary entries for deletion of media from the  collection
 in accord with unit specifications.

 Is  responsible for the retesting and cleaning of magnetic  media
 and   the  recording  of  results;   maintains  status  of  media
 performance to Data Center standards.

 Develops and oversees the keeping of proper records of all  Aread
 and write@ errors on specific tapes and other media.

 Performs  and  oversees the maintenance of records pertaining  to
 magnetic media use on specific recording/reading devices.

 Operates   a  teleprocessing  terminal  and  used  teleprocessing
 software  in the operation and maintenance of the magnetic  media
 library.

 Is  responsible for the storage and maintenance of  punched  card
 data files.

 Is responsible for the assembly of the magnetic data necessary to
 process a computer operation, including routing such data to  the
 staging area and controlling its return to storage.

 Establishes  procedures and schedules for  cross  shift  magnetic
 media handling.

 Maintains essential records and files.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or  manual  recording and information  systems  used  by  the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EXPERIENCE:

      Three  (3) years of experience in a Data Center, two (2)  of
 which shall have been in the storage, record control, cataloging,
 and routing of tapes, disks, or other magnetic and punched media.

      IMPORTANT NOTICE: Candidates will be tested on the hardware,
 software   operating  system,  language  and/or  other  pertinent
 aspects  of  each installation and must show proficiency  in  the
 areas tested.
 The eligible list from an examination will be used only for the Data
 Center specified.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees  will  be required to possess a driver's  license
 valid  in  New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle,  rather
 than   employee  mobility, is necessary to perform the  essential
 duties of the  position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge  of  magnetic media retention cycles  and  of  magnetic
 media maintenance, record keeping, and handling methods.

 Knowledge  of  procedures and equipment used  in  magnetic  media
 library work.

 Knowledge of the rules, regulations, policies, and procedures  of
 the   Data  Center  and  their  application  to  magnetic   media
 libraries.

 Knowledge  of  information  processing  production  and   control
 functions, practices, and workflow control techniques.

 Knowledge  of  electronic computers as related to magnetic  media
 use.

 Ability  to properly sequence the required input/output media  to
 match production schedules.

 Ability to lead and supervise assigned lower level librarian  and
 clerical staff.
 Ability  to  perform  the duties of other magnetic  data  control
 personnel  of  equal  or lower levels in  period  of  absence  or
 emergencies.

 Ability to prepare clear, accurate, and concise reports and  logs
 for the routing and control of magnetic media.

 Ability to maintain essential records and files.

 Ability  to  utilize various types of electronic  and/or   manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office,  or
 related units.

 Ability  to  read, write, speak, understand, and  communicate  in
 English  sufficiently  to perform the duties  of  this  position.
 American   Sign  Language or Braille may also  be  considered  as
 acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons  with  mental or physical disabilities  are  eligible  as
 long as they can perform the essential functions of the job after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.   If
 the   accommodation  cannot be made because it  would  cause  the
 employer undue  hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 CODES: R14-53363             CAH                     12/5/98
        R14-53363C

alternativeQualifications: Three (3) years of experience in a Data Center, two (2) of which shall have been in the storage, record control, cataloging, and routing of tapes, disks, or other magnetic and punched media.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job specification requires three years of experience in a Data Center, with two of those years involving specific tasks related to magnetic and punched media. However, it does not mention the necessity of a higher educational degree. The focus is on practical experience and the ability to demonstrate proficiency in pertinent areas related to the job duties.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description for the position of Data Processing Librarian 1 does not explicitly state that a college or university degree is required. Instead, it requires three years of experience in a Data Center, with two of those years specifically involving the storage, record control, cataloging, and routing of tapes, disks, or other magnetic and punched media. Therefore, the experience requirement could pose a barrier to applicants who do not possess this specific experience, regardless of their educational background. However, there is no explicit mention of a barrier based on the lack of a college or university degree.

name: Clerk Stenographer-10 Months
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


CLERK STENOGRAPHER - 10 Months

DEFINITION 

Under supervision, takes and transcribes dictation and performs routine, repetitive and other non-
complex clerical work of a varied nature as a beginner at the entrance level of employment; does 
related work as required.

EXAMPLES OF WORK 
Takes and transcribes dictation consisting of letters, memoranda and/or statements of limited 
complexity, following prescribed procedures.

Types a wide variety of materials from pencil copy, rough notes and detailed instructions such as 
correspondence, forms, memoranda, lists, reports statements, certificates, payrolls, vouchers, 
purchase orders.

Opens, sorts, numbers, and distributes mail. 

Addresses, stamps and marks envelopes and other mail.

Sorts and files checks, cash stubs, vouchers, requisitions or other  materials numerically, 
alphabetically or according to other predetermined classification.

Wraps packages for shipment by mail or express. 

Assembles and staples materials for distribution.

Clips newspapers, periodicals, and printed releases and arranges clipping in suitable form as 
directed.

Fills in and checks form letters, circulars and forms as directed.

Looks up needed information.

Maintains prepared mailing lists.

Gives routine information in person and over the telephone.

Tabulates simple numerical data.

Occasionally operates varied types of office machines and equipment.

Files papers, records, correspondence, memoranda, maps, tracings, proper plans and other matt

Pulls paper folders from files as requested.

Answers the telephone and takes messages accurately.

Checks assignments, applications and other documents for correction and completeness.

Refers errors and irregularities to superiors.

Sorts and counts various types of tickets and forms and checks tickets for expiration dates, 
endorsements and mutilations.

Collates and staples pages of reports, instructions and other duplicated materials.

Runs errands to deliver or material. 

Cuts stencils.

Maintains established files where selection and classification of data does not require difficult 
decisions and where procedures are routinized.

REQUIREMENTS 

License 

Appointee will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of 
a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the 
position. 

Knowledges and Abilities 

Basic knowledge of modern office methods, practices, routines machines and equipment.

Some knowledge of the problems involved in organizing assigned stenographic and other clerical 
work and in developing effective work methods.

Ability to take moderately difficult and rapid dictation and to transcribe the notes to the typewriter.

Ability to from varied kinds of copy and from cylinders, records, and Ediphone machine equipment 
accurately, neatly and in accordance with the particular requirement and procedures of the 
Department.

Ability to use correct English and to spell correctly.

Ability to understand, remember and carry out oral and written directions.

Ability to properly use and care for office machines, including manually and/or electrically operated 
typewriters, mimeograph machines, an. other equipment.

Ability maintain the essential records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and information 
systems used by the agency, office or related units. 

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to perform the 
duties of this position. American Sign Language or braille may also be considered as acceptable 
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform the essential 
functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the 
accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such 
persons may not be eligible.

Ability to properly use and care for office machines
Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position

The role primarily involves routine clerical tasks, and the requirements focus on skills such as basic knowledge of office methods, the ability to take and transcribe dictation, use English correctly, and operate office equipment. There is no mention of a necessity for a specific educational degree, indicating that skills and abilities are more critical for this role than formal education.

A Master's degree in a discipline appropriate to the position
