name: Public Safety Telecommunicator
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


PUBLIC SAFETY TELECOMMUNICATOR (01297)

DEFINITION:

Under direction of the Supervising Public Safety Telecommunicator or other 
supervisory official in a 911 Call Center in a State College, receives and 
responds to telephone and/or other electronic requests for emergency 
assistance including law enforcement, fire, medical, or other services; gathers 
essential information and dispatches the appropriate unit(s) to response sites; 
performs other related duties as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  
A particular position using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job 
specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Receives and responds to a variety of emergency and non-emergency 
services and complaints.  

Promptly determines the type of emergency service or action required and
responds accordingly.  

Monitors and dispatches appropriate emergency response providers such 
as police, fire services, emergency medical services and hazardous materials 
response teams.

Utilizes radio, telephone, computerized or other electronic equipment to 
dispatch specific law enforcement, fire and/or medical assistance units to 
the scene of an emergency.

Obtains, verifies, assesses and records all necessary information to best 
assist the caller.

Operates automatic number identification (ANI), automatic location information 
(ALI), telecommunications devices for the deaf (TTY/TDD) and/or other 
electronic equipment to obtain and verify required data.

Monitors fire and burglar alarms and alarm systems for campus buildings; 
dispatches appropriate unit(s) to the site when necessary.

Activates emergency alert systems such as bells, sirens, beepers and tone 
activated devices.

Accesses foreign language interpreter service for non-English speaking 
callers.

Provides first aid or CPR instructions to stabilize the medical condition of 
a person or people until the arrival of professional medical assistance.

Gives precautionary instructions and advice to help ensure personal safety 
and/or minimize the loss of property pending the arrival of police, fire or other 
assistance in nonmedical emergencies.

Refers non-emergency situations to other appropriate public or private 
agencies.

Relays information and/or instructions to field units via radio or mobile data 
terminal.

Utilizes video display terminal or computer oriented or radio equipment to 
receive, monitor, record, summarize and/or transmit data relating to the 
emergency.

Maintains and facilitates communication with responding units by receiving 
and relaying 
confidential information to authorized personnel.

Answers questions about routine regulations and policies.

Receives and answers telephone, radio and video display inquiries of 
the NCIC and the SCIC for the law enforcement agencies of the State.

Maintains and updates records and files in the NCIC, SCIC and other 
database systems.

Prepares and maintains essential records and files.

May inspect fire alarm and circuit indicator panels to determine whether 
they are functioning properly.

Inspects and makes minor adjustments and/or repairs to communications 
and related equipment.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office or 
related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EXPERIENCE:

One (1) year of experience in work involving the receiving, transmitting, 
and relaying of video display and/or radio messages, and in the receiving, 
relaying, and recording of complaints and requests for emergency assistance 
which shall have included the use of video display, data processing, automatic 
number identification, automatic location identification, switching equipment, or 
other computer-oriented equipment.

NOTE:  Appointees to positions at Public Safety Answering Points and at some 
Public Safety dispatch Points must have achieved training and certification 
by the Office of Emergency Telecommunications Services (OETS) in the 
Department of Law and Public Safety as required by NJAC 17:24-2 and 
NJAC 17:24-3.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license valid in New Jersey 
only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary 
to perform essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of methods for operating communications systems.

Knowledge of procedures used for emergency medical treatment.

Knowledge of information required for documenting emergency situations 
and calls.

Knowledge of emergency, medical, fire, police and other emergency 
terminology.

Knowledge of the procedures for dispatching emergency and nonemergency 
equipment and personnel.

Knowledge of safety, security and emergency management procedures and 
guidelines.

Knowledge of procedures for investigating and resolving complaints.

Ability to operate automatic location identification (ALI), automatic number 
identification (ANI) and other communications equipment in a complex 
communications program.

Ability to answer voice and TTY/TTD (telecommunications devices for the 
deaf) telephone calls received from the public.

Ability to operate a Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) system.

Ability to provide clear instructions and guidance to callers in emergency 
and non-emergency situations.

Ability to clearly and accurately relay instructions and questions.

Ability to obtain and analyze facts to reach logical conclusions.

Ability to read and discern visual images on a variety of media.

Ability to organize assigned communications work and develop 
appropriate work methods according to established procedures.

Ability to establish priorities and pass on information as needed.  

Ability to calmly and effectively interact with people in difficult situations.

Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

Ability to understand, remember and carry out oral and written instructions.

Ability to collect information from both English speaking and non-English 
speaking individuals.

Ability to prepare and maintain essential records and files.

Ability to maintain confidentiality of acquired information.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office or related 
units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand and communicate in English 
sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign 
Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of 
communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can 
perform essential functions of the job with or without reasonable 
accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made because 
it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may 
not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote01297SC401501O16-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 8/01/2020

alternativeQualifications: One (1) year of experience in work involving the receiving, transmitting, and relaying of video display and/or radio messages, and in the receiving, relaying, and recording of complaints and requests for emergency assistance

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the position of Public Safety Telecommunicator as per the job description provided. The primary requirement for this position is one year of relevant experience in handling emergency communications and relaying messages using appropriate technology and equipment. Specific technical training and certification, particularly by the Office of Emergency Telecommunications Services, are necessary. Skills and knowledge in operating communication systems, emergency procedures, and the ability to work under pressure are emphasized over formal higher education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees to positions at Public Safety Answering Points and at some Public Safety dispatch Points must have achieved training and certification by the Office of Emergency Telecommunications Services (OETS) in the Department of Law and Public Safety as required by NJAC 17:24-2 and NJAC 17:24-3.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Office of Emergency Telecommunications Services (OETS) in the Department of Law and Public Safety

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description does not explicitly state a requirement for a college or university degree. However, there are potential barriers for applicants without a degree, such as the requirement for one year of experience in relevant work involving the receiving, transmitting, and relaying of messages, and the receiving, relaying, and recording of emergency assistance requests. Although a degree is not mentioned, the experience requirement might indirectly favor those with some form of formal education, training, or prior experience in a related field. Additionally, specialized training and certification by the Office of Emergency Telecommunications Services (OETS) is required for certain positions, which could be a barrier for those without access to such training opportunities.

name: Actuarial Analyst

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by twelve (12) semester-hour credits in mathematics and/or statistics.

alternativeQualifications: Four (4) years of professional experience in actuarial work, including or supplemented by twelve (12) semester hour credits in mathematics and/or statistics

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, as applicants can qualify through professional experience in actuarial work combined with specific credits in mathematics and/or statistics. However, possession of a bachelor's degree with relevant coursework is an alternative qualification pathway. Additionally, obtaining an associate credential (ASA or ACAS) from the Society of Actuaries or Casualty Actuary Society is mandatory, along with compliance with continuing education requirements. This suggests that while higher education can be beneficial, it is not the sole pathway to eligibility for this role.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must possess an associate credential (ASA or ACAS) from the Society of Actuaries or Casualty Actuary Society.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Society of Actuaries or Casualty Actuary Society

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description presents a barrier to hiring applicants who do not have a college or university degree as it states that applicants must meet one of the following requirements: four years of professional experience in actuarial work, including or supplemented by twelve semester-hour credits in mathematics and/or statistics, or possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by twelve semester-hour credits in mathematics and/or statistics. This requirement implies that applicants without a degree would need to have a specific combination of work experience and educational credits, which could be challenging for some non-degree holders to demonstrate. Additionally, possession of an associate credential (ASA or ACAS) from the Society of Actuaries or Casualty Actuary Society is required, potentially further limiting non-degree holders who may not have pursued formal actuarial credentials.

name: Compliance Officer 2 Mvc

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college with an Associate's degree or successful completion of sixty (60) semester hour credits.

alternativeQualifications: Additional experience as stated below on a year-for-year basis. Thirty (30) semester hour credits are equal to one (1) year of experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job requires an Associate's degree or 60 semester hour credits, which can be substituted with additional relevant experience on a year-for-year basis. Therefore, individuals without a higher degree can qualify for this position if they possess the necessary experience in a governmental or private organization involving compliance with laws, rules, and regulations. The emphasis is on the specific experience and the ability to complete mandatory training rather than on a traditional higher educational degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees must successfully complete training in all the following areas: Inspector License Training, Agency Business Process Training, Document Fraud Training and Federal Motor Carrier Safety Assistance Program Training.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description indicates a requirement for graduation from an accredited college with an Associate's degree or the successful completion of 60 semester hour credits. This could be considered a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree. However, the description also notes that applicants who do not meet these educational requirements may substitute additional experience on a year-for-year basis, with thirty semester hour credits equaling one year of experience. This substitution option mitigates the barrier to some extent, allowing applicants with the relevant experience to qualify.

name: Conferee 1 Taxation

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by twenty-one (21) semester-hour credits in accounting courses

alternativeQualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience in accounting or auditing, supplemented by twenty-one (21) semester-hour credits in accounting courses

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job. The job description allows for applicants to qualify based on a combination of experience and education. Specifically, applicants can qualify with seven years of professional accounting or auditing experience, including one year involving conferences for protested determinations, alongside 21 semester-hour credits in accounting courses. Alternatively, a bachelor's degree in addition to three years of the required professional experience is also acceptable. Therefore, while a degree can be advantageous, relevant experience and accounting coursework can also fulfill the job requirements.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description outlines the requirements for the position, which creates a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree due to the following:

- The applicant must meet one of the following: seven years of professional experience in accounting or auditing, including or supplemented by 21 semester-hour credits in accounting courses; OR possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by 21 semester-hour credits in accounting courses, and three years of relevant professional experience. 

This implies that while there is a pathway without a degree (requiring extensive experience and specific accounting coursework), candidates without a degree but lacking the specific experience and educational credits may face a barrier to being considered for this role.

name: Landscape Designer 3
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


LANDSCAPE DESIGNER 3
 
DEFINITION:
 
Under the general direction of a Project Engineer or other supervisory 
official in a state department, agency, or office, performs the complex 
tasks involved in the design, construction, and maintenance of 
landscape architecture projects for transportation projects, parks, 
forests, or botanical gardens; supervises staff and work activities; 
prepares and signs official performance evaluations for subordinate 
staff; does other related duties as required

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes 
only.  A particular position using this title may not perform all duties 
listed in this job specification.  Conversely, all duties performed on 
the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Supervises and/or prepares program documents including the
gathering of data and mapping.

Performs complex onsite investigations to determine site conditions 
prior to landscape design.

Formulates design concepts for each project for discussion with 
supervisory officials.

Supervises the preparation of preliminary landscape plans and detail 
sheets.

Supervises the work operations and/or functional programs and has 
responsibility for effectively recommending the hiring, firing, promoting, 
demoting, and/or disciplining of employees. 

Supervises and/or prepares grading plans and cross sections used 
in developing freeways, parkways, other state highways and parks, 
recreation, and picnic areas.

Supervises the final design of landscape plans which may include 
planting plans, grading plans, paving surfaces, street furniture, and 
landscape construction details.

Supervises the design of architectural details of structures such as 
rustic guard rails, signs, picnic tables, and recreational structures 
required for highway and parkway developments, state parks, and 
forests.

Selects plant materials to be used on assigned projects; inspects 
plant materials.

Prepares a listing of landscape materials on each project for approval.

Make aesthetic recommendations for architectural elements such as 
noise walls, retaining walls, fences, planters, walkways, and street 
furniture.

Supervises the preparation of calculations for landscape items.

Coordinates with construction and maintenance personnel regarding 
landscape design, construction, and maintenance work.

Supervises and/or performs phase review for transportation projects.

Supervises and/or prepares complex specifications for landscape 
items.

Provides guidance, supervision, and training to subordinate 
landscape designers.

Reviews and recommends construction work for acceptance.

Prepares project schedule data on all transportation projects, 
and monthly updates for preconstruction scheduling.

Reviews and prepares written comments for consultant scope 
of work and agreements; prepares modifications to consultant 
agreements.

May assist the supervisory official with consultant monitoring.

Attends meetings with public and government agencies.

Supervises the implementation of the Botanical Garden work 
programs; supervises the inspection of other lands associated
with the New Jersey State Botanical Garden to determine need 
for ornamental horticulture and landscaping work, lawn care, 
tree and shrub needs, and greenhouse operations.

Supervises the labeling of all plant materials in the Botanical 
Garden with its Latin and common name.

Supervises the maintenance and update of a tracking system 
of information used to monitor historical, cultural, landscaping, 
and planting techniques, methodologies, and technologies 
gathered from a national and international exchange.

Organizes and coordinates the research for old photographs, 
park histories, and other records to determine original designs and 
layouts used in the Botanical Garden and for general landscaping.

Instructs staff in the care and maintenance of completed plantings.

Provides advice and answers complex public inquiries regarding 
landscaping or horticultural techniques of the formal and informal 
gardens, greenhouse, and nursery of the NJ State Botanical Garden.

Supervises and/or gives horticultural lectures and other visual 
presentations to garden clubs, professional groups, local and 
private organizations, general public, special interest groups, 
and others.

Works closely with volunteer groups, various garden clubs and 
plant societies, and other associations to organize, coordinate, 
and develop programs, lectures, plant sales, and flower shows 
to promote the Botanical Garden.

Supervises the interpretation of both Latin and common names 
of plants and flowers and keep current with botanical garden 
methodologies, fertilizers, pesticides, and related chemicals, 
their names, applications, and use.

Supervises and/or designs drafts of planting plans in accordance 
with plant lists, sizes, specifications, and cost estimates.

Discusses technologies, methodologies, and techniques with 
other botanical garden representatives.

Approves requisitions for materials, supplies, and equipment 
needed for the botanical garden.

Supervises and/or prepares correspondence and reports.

Supervises the establishment and maintenance of records 
and files.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronics 
and/or manual recording and information systems used by the 
agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

EDUCATION:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a 
Bachelorï¿½s degree in Landscape Architecture.

EXPERIENCE:

Three (3) years of experience in landscape design and 
construction.

NOTE:  A license as a Landscape Architect issued by the 
New Jersey State Board of Architects may be substituted for 
the above education requirement and for one (1) year of the 
required experience.

NOTE:  When assigned to the Department of Environmental 
Protection's State Botanical Garden, a Bachelor's degree in 
Ornamental Horticulture, Aboriculture, or Floriculture, and 
experience in ornamental horticulture work are also acceptable 
in meeting the minimum education and experience requirements.

LICENSE:

Appointees may be required to obtain a New Jersey Pesticide 
Applicator Certificate or Operators Permit in the required 
categories.  

The responsibility for ensuring that employees possess the 
certification as a Pesticide Applicator, Commercial in the 
appropriate categories, issued by the New Jersey Department 
of Environmental Protection, rests with the Appointing Authority.
 
Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid 
in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than 
employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of 
the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:
 
Knowledge of the methods and techniques used to prepare 
landscape-related specifications.

Knowledge of the principles of landscape architectural design.

Knowledge of the types of plant material including their botanical 
names, growth habits, adaptability to hardiness zones, and 
environmental requirements in relation to the transportation 
setting.

Knowledge of landscape construction details, practices, and 
maintenance procedures.

Knowledge of the use and care of equipment, materials, and 
supplies used in landscape architecture.

Knowledge of the principles and techniques involved in 
ornamental horticulture for garden design.

Knowledge of chemical application techniques.

Knowledge of the methods used to restore, renovate, and 
maintain grounds, formal gardens, lawns and flower gardens, 
trees, and shrubs.

Ability to prepare contract plans.

Ability to supervise the preparation of detailed contour grading 
plans and cross sections, planting plans, landscape architectural 
studies, and details to picnic and recreation areas, signs, and 
guide rails.

Ability to prepare specifications, plans, and cost estimates of 
all types of landscape work.

Ability to supervise assigned staff and plan, organize, and 
implement projects within the unit. 

Ability to read and interpret laws, rules, and regulations and 
apply them to specific situation.

Ability to prepare watercolor, pencil, and crayon landscape 
sketches and plans.

Ability to select landscape planting materials.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships 
with volunteer groups, garden clubs, and other associations.

Ability to supervise the preparation of design plans for formal 
gardens, lawns, flower gardens, and landscaping and to monitor 
progress of construction or reconstruction sites.

Ability to develop work schedules.

Ability to prepare reports and correspondence.

Ability to supervise the establishment and maintenance of 
records and files.

Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  
American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered 
as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they 
can perform essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot 
be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, 
such persons may not be eligible.

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelorï¿½s degree in Landscape Architecture.

alternativeQualifications: A license as a Landscape Architect issued by the New Jersey State Board of Architects may be substituted for the required education and for one year of the required experience.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.bothTrueExplanation: The job description for the Landscape Designer 3 position requires a Bachelorâs degree in Landscape Architecture, which implies a mandatory degree requirement. However, it also states that a license as a Landscape Architect issued by the New Jersey State Board of Architects can be substituted for the degree and part of the experience requirement. Additionally, alternative degrees in Ornamental Horticulture, Arboriculture, or Floriculture are acceptable under certain conditions. This provision for alternative qualifications reflects that while a degree is initially mandated, there are accepted alternatives that fulfill the requirement. Hence, both DegreeRequirementStatus.isDegreeMandatory and DegreeRequirementStatus.hasAlternativeQualifications are considered true based on the job description.
mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: Based on the job description, a higher educational degree is required for the position of Landscape Designer 3. The requirements specify that the candidate must have graduated with a Bachelorâs degree in Landscape Architecture or a related field such as Ornamental Horticulture, Arbiculture, or Floriculture when assigned to certain departments. This educational background is necessary to ensure the individual has the foundational knowledge of landscape architectural design, plant materials, landscape construction, and other relevant areas. In addition, although a degree is mandatory, possessing a Landscape Architect license can substitute for the educational requirement and one year of the needed experience, indicating the significance of formal education and professional qualifications for this role.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: A license as a Landscape Architect issued by the New Jersey State Board of Architects may be substituted for the above education requirement and for one (1) year of the required experience.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: New Jersey State Board of Architects

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that a Bachelorâs degree in Landscape Architecture is a requirement. Additionally, it mentions that a license as a Landscape Architect issued by the New Jersey State Board of Architects may substitute for the education requirement and one year of experience, but still implies a formal qualification through the need for a license. This indicates a barrier to hiring an applicant who does not have a college or university degree, as the educational requirement or equivalent licensure is specified.

name: Pensions Benefits Specialist 1

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and one (1) year of the above-mentioned professional experience.

alternativeQualifications: Five (5) years of professional experience in the operation of retirement or health insurance programs

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of Pensions Benefits Specialist 1. The job specification allows for applicants to qualify through either five years of professional experience in the operation of retirement or health insurance programs, or through possession of a bachelor's degree with one year of relevant experience. Therefore, equivalent professional experience may substitute for a degree, indicating that a degree is not mandatory for this position.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Department of Motor Vehicles or equivalent authority in New Jersey

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description specifies that applicants must meet one of the following: have five years of professional experience in the operation of retirement or health insurance programs, or possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and one year of professional experience. This requirement could be a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree, as it restricts them to needing five years of relevant professional experience without the possibility of substituting educational credits for experience.

name: Teaching Assistant 12 Months
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


TEACHING ASSISTANT, 12 MONTHS
  
DEFINITION:

Under supervision of a Supervisor of Educational Programs or Assistant Supervisor 
of Educational Programs in a state school or institution, acts as direct care personnel 
in the classroom and assists with self-help, academic, social, vocational, and 
recreational activities designed for children and/or young adults; does other related 
duties as required.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only.  A position 
using this title may not perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely, 
all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

NOTE:  Appointments may be made to positions requiring bilingual skills to 10 month title.

75262C - Bilingual in Spanish and English
 
SPECIAL SKILL:  Applicants must be able to read, write, speak, understand, and 
communicate in Spanish and English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.

EXAMPLES OF WORK:

Assists with self-help, academic, social, vocational, and recreational activities 
designed for children and/or young adults.

Assists a Teacher 1 or 2 in obtaining and preparing materials and equipment for teaching 
learning activities including paper, pencils, books, arts and crafts materials, charts, pictures, 
visual demonstration materials, record players, and motion picture, slide, overhead, and 
opaque projectors.

Helps prepare visual aids, updates bulletin boards, and arranges displays of student work.

Keeps the classroom in a neat and orderly condition, adjusts room lighting and heating, 
and arranges chairs and desks as required for different activities.

Works individually with developmentally disabled children or adults to develop self-help 
skills and basic environmental awareness.

Accompanies students/clients on outside activities and trips.

Helps maintain discipline.

Assists in keeping records of attendance, illness, and student performance and behavior.

Helps tutor students in simple, routine lessons and assists the teacher by rotating among 
small groups of students involved in discussion, arts and crafts, and/or recreation activities 
and gives guidance to such activities.

Distributes and collects paper, books, and other teaching materials.

Assists the teacher when emergency situations arise including illness, accidents, or fire.

Transports students/clients between residences and classrooms.

Keeps routine records and reports.

If emergency accidents occur in the classroom, commences initial cleaning of the 
classroom and/or of students as a precautionary measure.

In extreme circumstances of individual accidents, escorts the student from the classroom 
to the residence or designated emergency location.

May be required to engage in lifting  clients when working in a setting which provides 
direct services to clients who are non-ambulant or who are semi-ambulant and/or
have severe physical disabilities.

Will be required to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

REQUIREMENTS:

NOTE:  Since this is an entry level position, there are no formal education and/or 
experience requirements.

NOTE:  Appointees must be able to physically lift, move, and position students as needed.

SPECIAL SKILL:  Appointees to the Marie H. Katzenbach School for the Deaf must be 
able to communicate effectively in the language of the deaf, particularly American Sign 
Language, sufficiently to perform duties of the position, and must successfully pass a 
screening process administered by the Deaf and Hard of Hearing Committee at the school.

LICENSE:

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the 
operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential 
duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of the emotional, personal, adjustment, and other problems of children 
and young adults confined in an institution or enrolled in a DCF Regional School.

Ability to learn quickly from oral and written directions, explanations, and from 
demonstrations.

Ability to assist a professional teacher by performing routine duties involved in 
academic, social, vocational, and recreational activities.

Ability to obtain and prepare varied types of equipment and materials for teaching 
learning activities including arts and craft materials, paper, pencils, books, pictures, 
visual aids, record players, and projectors.

Ability to help keep the classroom in a neat and orderly condition and arrange chairs 
and desks for different activities.

Ability to take necessary actions concerning initial cleaning of the classroom and/or 
student when emergency accidents occur.

Ability to assist in maintaining discipline.

Ability to tutor students in routine lessons.

Ability to act as general assistant to a professional teacher and follow established 
measures when emergencies arise such as removing the student from the classroom 
for personal hygiene reasons.

Ability to maintain routine records, reports, and files.

Ability to learn how to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording 
and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently 
to perform the duties of this position.  American Sign Language or Braille may also 
be considered as acceptable forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can perform the essential 
functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation
cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
may not be eligible.

name: Head Laundry Worker
text:
Job Specification 44424 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 44424 

HEAD LAUNDRY WORKER

 

DEFINITION


 Under  direction of a Superintendent of Laundry,  a  Housekeeping
 Supervisor,   or   other  supervisor  in  a   state   department,
 institution, or agency, either (a) supervises management  of  all
 functions,  facilities, services, and personnel  associated  with
 the  operation of a small institutional laundry, (b)  assists  in
 supervising a portion of the service of a large laundry,  or  (c)
 supervises the operation of large linen rooms; does other related
 duties as required.

 NOTE: The  examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes  only.  A particular position using this title  may  not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Is  responsible for proper performance of all laundry  operations
 in   an   assigned  area  and  for  the  assignment,   direction,
 instruction,  and  supervision  of laundry  employees,  patients,
 and/or inmates.

 Supervises  the  proper adjustment and minor maintenance  of  all
 laundry equipment.
   Plans,  organizes, and assigns work of the organizational  unit
 and  evaluates  employee performance and  conduct,  enabling  the
 effective  recommendation of the hiring, firing,  promoting,  and
 disciplining of  subordinates.

 Operates    washers,   extractors,   dryers,   water   softeners,
 sterilizers, and other equipment.

 Prepares starches, bluing, and bleaches.

 Prepares sterilizing compound and soap and detergent mixtures.

 Makes alkalinity and acidity tests.

 Operates the water softener and sterilizer.

 Supervises the checking in/out of laundry.

 Prepares requisitions for laundry equipment/materials/supplies.

 Maintains  and  controls health, sanitary, and safety  conditions
 within the laundry.

 Keeps  records of laundry operations, personnel, time spent,  and
 materials used.

 When acting as supervisor of large linen rooms:

 Checks  requisitions for clothing/linens and sees that sufficient
 supplies are on hand at all times.

 Makes  arrangements  for  the  quick  delivery  of  linens   when
 emergencies arise.

 Prepares reports.

 Maintains linen room records.

 May be required to undergo fire training classes.

 Will  be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or  manual  recording and information  systems  used  by  the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EXPERIENCE:

      Three (3) years of experience in a commercial or institution
 laundry.

      LICENSE:

      Appointee  will  be required to possess a  driver's  license
 valid  in  New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle,  rather
 than  employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties
 of the position.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of laundry methods/practices involved in the processing
 of different types of materials.

 Knowledge  of and skill in the operation/maintenance of  washers,
 dryers,  extractors, presses, water softeners,  sterilizers,  and
 other laundry equipment.

 Knowledge  of  the  preparation  and  use  of  various  types  of
 laundering compounds/solutions.

 Ability  to  operate and supervise operation of  commercial  type
 laundry   equipment   including  washers,   extractors,   dryers,
 tumblers, and presses.

 Ability  to  select  the appropriate washing  soaps,  detergents,
 bleaches,  rinses, and water temperatures for specific  types  of
 laundry.

 Ability  to assign and supervise laundry and linen room employees
 and assigned patients/inmates.

 Ability   to  instruct  employees  in  the  inspection,  sorting,
 marking, checking, folding, and distribution of laundry.

 Ability  to  instruct patients/inmates in proper  use  of  sewing
 machines for mending.

 Ability to prepare reports.

 Ability to prepare records of laundry operations, personnel, time
 spent, and materials used.

 Ability  to  utilize  various types of electronic  and/or  manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office,  or
 related units.

 Ability  to  read, write, speak, understand, and  communicate  in
 English   sufficiently  to  perform  duties  of  this   position.
 American  Sign  Language or Braille may  also  be  considered  as
 acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as  they  can  perform  essential  functions  of  the  job  after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.   If
 the  accommodation  cannot be made because  it  would  cause  the
 employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 CODES: 09/R10 - 44424          RKR/cah               6/25/98

alternativeQualifications: Three (3) years of experience in a commercial or institution laundry.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the position of Head Laundry Worker. The job requires three years of experience in a commercial or institution laundry, and the ability to utilize electronic and/or manual recording systems. Additionally, a valid driver's license may be necessary if operating a vehicle is essential to perform the duties. The focus is on practical skills, knowledge, and experience rather than formal education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: No barriers are found related to the requirement of a college or university degree in the job description for the Head Laundry Worker position. The requirements listed include having three years of experience in a commercial or institutional laundry, the ability to perform tasks as described, and in some cases, possessing a valid driver's license.

name: Gardener
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification



GARDENER

 

DEFINITION


 Under direction, performs gardening work involved in planting and
 keeping of flowers and trees and in keeping grounds in a healthy,
 attractive condition; does other related  duties as required.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not
 perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely,
 all duties performed on the job may not be listed.


EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Organizes assigned gardening work, analyzes gardening problems,
 and develops effective work methods.

 Prepares soil for planting.

 Sows seeds.

 Marks out borders, beds, and areas for planting.

 Transplants plants and seedlings.

 Prepares cold frames.

 Raises plants in greenhouses.

 Maintains correct temperatures in greenhouses.

 Weeds flower beds, vegetable areas, and borders.

 Sprays flower and vegetable plants and fruit trees.

 Prunes and clips shrubbery, bushes, and hedges.

 Harvests and stores garden crops.

 Seeds, waters, sods, mows, weeds, fertilizes, rakes, and trims
 lawns.

 Cuts flowers for indoor use.

 Harvests seeds.

 Makes cuttings and slips.

 May assign and instruct helpers, assistant gardeners, and/or
 inmates, patients, and/or students assigned to gardening work,
 and supervises the performance of their work.

 Mixes sprays and other solutions.

 Sees that proper care is taken of cutting tools, lawn mowers,
 knives, shovels, rakes, and other equipment, tools, and supplies.

 Makes proper use of fertilizers.

 Prepares reports.

 Maintains records and files.

 In the Department of Human Services, may be required to undergo
 fire training classes.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the
 agency, office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

      EXPERIENCE:

      One (1) year of experience in the planting and maintenance
 of lawns, flowers, and shrubs.

      LICENSE:

      Appointees will be required to possess a driver=s license
 valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather
 than employee mobility, is necessary to perform essential duties
 of the position.

      Appointees will be required to obtain a NJ Certified
 Pesticide Applicator=s or Operator=s Permit in the required
 categories.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of horticultural problems.

 Knowledge of equipment, materials, and supplies used in large
 scale gardening.

 Knowledge of preparation of soil for planting of flower, grass,
 and vegetable seed.

 Knowledge of the planning of large scale gardening work in such a
 manner to ensure proper yield will be available at the proper
 time.

 Knowledge of the care of grass and lawn plots.

 Knowledge of  the correct pruning and clipping of shrubs, hedges,
 and bushes.

 Knowledge of the proper use of fertilizers and sprays.

 Knowledge of preparation and use of cold frames and greenhouses.

 Knowledge of methods of harvesting seeds and fruit and in making
 slips and cuttings.

 Ability to analyze, comprehend, and interpret gardening problems
 likely to be encountered in work on the grounds or institutional
 grounds.

 Ability to assign and supervise work of employees, inmates,
 and/or patients and when required the ability to take measures
 required to ernsure their welfare, work progress, and custody.

 Ability to do work involved in sowing seed and in planting,
 transplanting, growing, fertilizing, and harvesting flowers,
 shrubs, vegetables, berries, and fruit.

 Ability to maintain grass plots and areas in a neat, orderly
 condition.

 Ability to prepare reports.

 Ability to keep simple records.

 Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or
 related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in
 English sufficiently to perform duties of this position.
 American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as
 acceptable forms of  communication.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
 as they can perform essential functions of the job after
 reasonable accommodation is made to their known limitations.  If
 the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the
 employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.

 This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote45533SN4009N/AO10-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions.RKR   12/06/1997

alternativeQualifications: One (1) year of experience in the planting and maintenance of lawns, flowers, and shrubs

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the gardener position described. The job requires one year of experience in planting and maintaining lawns, flowers, and shrubs, and the ability to perform various gardening tasks. Relevant knowledge and abilities, such as understanding horticultural problems, using gardening equipment, and maintaining records, are emphasized. Additionally, possession of a valid driver's license and a NJ Certified Pesticide Applicator or Operator's Permit is necessary. The focus is on practical experience and specific certifications rather than formal education.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to obtain a NJ Certified Pesticide Applicator=s or Operator=s Permit in the required categories.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: No barriers are found.

name: Business Manager Corrections

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a master's degree in Business, Public Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics from an accredited college or university

alternativeQualifications: Ten years of professional financial experience in a medical, educational, correctional, or training facility or other business operation with responsibility for preparation of financial statements and reports, review of financial records, oversight of the development of internal accounting control procedures, and assisting in the development and analysis of an office, unit, agency, or organizational budget, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation:
A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Business Manager Corrections job in New Jersey. The job requirements provide multiple pathways to qualify, including:

1. Ten years of relevant professional financial experience, with four years in a supervisory capacity.
2. A bachelor's degree in a relevant field plus six years of professional experience, with four years in a supervisory capacity.
3. A master's degree in Business, Public Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics plus five years of professional experience, with four years in a supervisory capacity.

These options imply that extensive professional experience can substitute for formal higher education degrees.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description lists a specific requirement of "Ten (10) years of professional financial experience," with a focus on certain types of facilities or business operations, or an equivalent combination of experience and higher education credits. A bachelor's degree equates to six years of experience, and a master's degree equates to five years. Therefore, a candidate without a degree would need to demonstrate a full ten years of relevant professional financial experience, four of which must be in a supervisory capacity, to qualify. This requirement could pose a barrier to applicants who have less experience but hold a degree, potentially limiting opportunities for those without formal higher education credentials.

name: Research Analyst 1

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a Juris Doctor degree or bachelor of laws degree from an accredited law school

alternativeQualifications: Five (5) years of professional experience in legal or legislative research, which shall have included the preparation of basic research and technical reports.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job as applicants can qualify with five years of professional experience in legal or legislative research. However, a bachelor's degree with at least one year of relevant experience or a Juris Doctor degree can also meet the requirements.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
- The job description requires either five years of professional experience in legal or legislative research or a bachelor's degree in addition to one year of professional experience. This may be a barrier for applicants without a college or university degree unless they have accumulated five years of specific professional experience.
- The emphasis on "professional experience" being analytical, evaluative, and interpretive, along with requiring informed decision-making, may favor individuals with formal education credentials who meet these criteria more explicitly.
- Thirty semester-hour credits counting as a year of relevant experience implies a preference for college credits, which could disadvantage those without any post-secondary education or related credits.

name: Manager 1 Insurance

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
a Master's degree in Public Administration, Business Administration or Accounting
a professional designation of Juris Doctor (JD)

alternativeQualifications: Nine (9) years of professional experience for Level 1, Ten (10) years of professional experience for Level 2

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for this job, but it can be an alternative pathway to meet the eligibility criteria. For Level 1 and Level 2 positions, instead of possessing a bachelor's degree and a reduced number of professional experience years, candidates can qualify solely based on having a longer duration of relevant professional experience, with some years in a supervisory capacity. Therefore, while a bachelor's degree can reduce the years of experience required, individuals without a degree can still qualify through a combination of extensive professional experience and supervisory roles.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Applicants must possess any one of the following certifications or other credentials. Life Office Management Association (LOMA), Member of the Society of Actuaries, Member of the American Academy of Actuaries, a Master's degree in Public Administration, Business Administration or Accounting, a professional designation of Juris Doctor (JD) or Certified Public Accountant (CPA), completion of the Chartered Property Casualty Underwriters (CPCU) program, the Chartered Life Underwriter (CLU) Program, Certified Insurance Examiner (CIE), Certified Financial Examiner (CFE) or Accredited Financial Examiner (AFE), Fellow, Life Management Institute, or any of the following National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) designations: Associate Professional in Insurance Regulation (APIR), Professional in Insurance Regulation (PIR), Senior Professional in Insurance Regulation (SPIR), Investment Professional in Insurance Regulation (IPIR); or any of the Insurance Regulatory Examiners Society (IRES) Designations: Accredited Insurance Examiner (AIEÂ®), Certified & Certified Insurance Examiner (CIEÂ®), Certified Insurance Consumer Service Representative (CICSRÂ®), Market Conduct Management (MCMÂ®), Advanced Market Conduct Management (AMCMÂ®).
professionalLicenseRequirement.issuingAuthority: Various including Life Office Management Association, Society of Actuaries, American Academy of Actuaries, National Association of Insurance Commissioners, Insurance Regulatory Examiners Society

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description includes a barrier that may be challenging for applicants who do not have a college or university degree. Specifically, there is an educational requirement that applicants must meet, which is stated as: 

- For Level 1: "Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and five (5) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, two (2) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity."
- For Level 2: "Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and six (6) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, three (3) years of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity."

Although there is an alternative path through extensive professional experience, the outlined requirements favor those who possess a bachelor's degree, thereby suggesting a potential barrier for those without such a degree.

name: Assistant Chief Of Office Services

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and four (4) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

Possession of a master's degree in Public Administration or Business Administration; and three (3) years of the above-mentioned professional experience, one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

alternativeQualifications: Eight (8) years of professional experience involving general administrative support services and procurement activities, at least one (1) year of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity.

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Assistant Chief of Office Services job. The job description allows for candidates with a combination of experience and education, where thirty semester-hour credits are equal to one year of relevant experience. Specifically, the position requires either eight years of professional experience (with at least one year in a supervisory capacity), a bachelor's degree with four years of relevant experience (including one year in a supervisory capacity), or a master's degree with three years of relevant experience (including one year in a supervisory capacity). Therefore, the job can be accessed either via significant professional experience in lieu of a degree or with a relevant degree combined with professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description outlines a requirement of eight (8) years of professional experience involving general administrative support services and procurement activities, with at least one (1) year in a supervisory capacity, as one of the criteria. It also states that possession of a bachelor's degree is another criterion along with four (4) years of relevant professional experience, or a master's degree with three (3) years of relevant experience. This implies that an applicant without a college or university degree must have significant professional experience (eight years) to compensate for the lack of formal education, which could be seen as a barrier to those without the degree and without substantial equivalent experience.

name: Customer Service Information Specialist 1
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


CUSTOMER SERVICE INFORMATION SPECIALIST 1 TOURISM WELCOME CENTER

DEFINITION:

Under the supervision of supervisory official, provides routine 
information and answers tourist-related questions of visitors at 
a welcome center; utilizes publications and electronic sources to 
access and provide information; promotes all New Jersey tourism 
destinations such as historic and cultural sites, parks, attractions, 
resorts and shopping; does other related duties.

NOTE:  The examples of work for this title are for illustrative 
purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not 
perform all duties listed in this job specification.  Conversely, 
all duties performed on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Determines visitor's needs through questioning and listening.

Confirms understanding of visitor's questions before providing 
answers.

Provides courteous, accurate and timely answers to visitor 
requests.

Locates and provides traffic and weather information which 
may impact travel plans.

Documents and reports unusual activity on a timely basis.

Contacts facilities and attractions to verify hours of operation, 
site availability, admittance fees if appropriate, restrictions 
and/or other tourist information; may make and/or confirm 
visitor arrangements and reservations.

Records and processes visitor information necessary to transact 
welcome center business.

Provides materials such as pamphlets, brochures, directions and 
maps to visitors.

Ensures that brochures and other collateral materials are stocked, 
organized and visible to visitors.

Monitors and maintains state tourism brochure inventory by 
reporting shortfalls and requesting deliveries through state 
contractor. 

Collaborates with facility partner for cleaning, repair and general 
maintenance needs.

Reports visitors' complaints.

Develops a monthly work calendar.

Completes and submits monthly activity report, including visitor 
and motor coach counts to visitor center.

Provides and responds to feedback as requested by visitor center 
manager.

Hosts events at welcome centers.

Contacts tourism partners to participate in events, activities and 
exhibits.

Participates at meetings and conferences as requested.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic 
and/or manual recording information systems used by the 
welcome center.

REQUIREMENTS

EXPERIENCE

Successful completion of the six (6) month training period as an 
Agency Services Representative Trainee. 

OR 

One (1) year of experience in providing information and/or 
customer service to the general public.  

LICENSE

Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license in 
New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than 
employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential 
duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of customer service techniques and practices.

Ability to listen, understand and interpret requests for information 
and assistance.

Ability to acquire knowledge about New Jersey's tourism destinations 
such as historic and cultural sites, parks, attractions, shopping and 
resorts.

Ability to listen to inquiries and confirm understanding before 
providing information.

Ability to locate necessary information utilizing on-site publications 
or electronic sources.

Ability to discern when to refer non-routine visitor questions to 
supervisor.

Ability to communicate effectively and courteously with the public.

Ability to be patient with visitors.

Ability to provide accurate directions, traffic and weather conditions 
of import to visitors.

Ability to make lodging, attractions and other reservations.

Ability to keep written materials stocked and visitor area neat and 
inviting.

Ability to utilize tourism partners for exhibits and events at welcome 
centers.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual 
recording and information systems used by the welcome center.

Ability to read, write, speak and understand or communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American 
Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable 
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible if they can 
perform essential functions of the job with or without reasonable 
accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made because 
it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may 
not be eligible.


This job specification is applicable to the following title code:JobSpecCodeVariantState,Local orCommonClass ofServiceWorkWeekStateClassCodeLocalClassCodeSalaryRangeNote62131DTourism Welcome CenterSC3509N/AA08-This job specification is for state government use only.Salary range is only applicable to state government.Local salaries are established by individual local jurisdictions. 8/17/2019

alternativeQualifications: Successful completion of the six (6) month training period as an Agency Services Representative Trainee
One (1) year of experience in providing information and/or customer service to the general public

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the position of Customer Service Information Specialist 1 at a Tourism Welcome Center. The requirements focus on either successful completion of a six-month training period as an Agency Services Representative Trainee or one year of experience in providing information and/or customer service to the general public. While certain skills and abilities are necessary, such as customer service techniques, communication skills, and knowledge of New Jersey tourism, there is no mention of needing a higher educational degree.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description for the Customer Service Information Specialist 1 Tourism Welcome Center does not explicitly list a college or university degree as a requirement, presenting no direct educational barriers to applicants without such degrees. The listed requirements focus on either the completion of a training period as an Agency Services Representative Trainee or one year of experience in providing information and/or customer service to the general public.

name: Senior Animal Health Technician

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with twenty-one (21) credit hours concentration in animal science, animal science technology, veterinary technology, or other related biological sciences

alternativeQualifications: Six (6) years of professional laboratory examination, analysis, and testing experience and twenty-one (21) credit hours concentration in relevant fields

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the Senior Animal Health Technician position. The job description allows for a combination of experience and education. Specifically, candidates can qualify with six years of professional laboratory and regulatory experience in animal health and 21 credit hours in relevant biological sciences, or with a bachelor's degree and two years of experience, suggesting that extensive relevant experience can substitute for a formal degree. Therefore, while a degree may enhance qualification, it is not mandatory if the applicant has sufficient professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description presents barriers to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree, as it specifies the following requirements:

1. "Applicants must meet one of the following or a combination of both experience and education":
   a. Six years of professional laboratory examination, analysis, and testing experience with specific credit hours in relevant fields.
   b. Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with specific credit hours.

This requirement suggests that the position can be filled either through significant professional experience combined with specific educational credits or by obtaining a bachelor's degree, both of which could prevent applicants without a college or university degree from qualifying.

name: Principal Engineer Geotechnical
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification
10454


 PRINCIPAL ENGINEER GEOTECHNICAL

  DEFINITION:

  Under the direction of a Project Engineer Geotechnical or other
  supervisory officer, performs, reviews, and supervises employees in 
  all designs pertaining to soils, checks foundation designs for structures
  pertaining to soils, designs pavements and makes recommendations 
  for acceptance of soils materials for construction projects; does related
  work as required.

  EXAMPLES OF WORK:

  Supervises or performs the complex roadway designs pertaining to
  soils, structural foundation design pertaining to soils and pavement
  design.

  Reviews and/or supervises the review of foundations of all types
  of structures as requested.

  Performs and/or supervises the more complex design work in
  determining the structural makeup of pavements.

  Determines the need for and evaluates the results of all testing
  programs involving soils.

  Prepares and/or supervises the preparation of geotechnical
  specifications pertaining to soils and foundations.

  Investigates and makes recommendations to construction forces 
  in regard to the soil problems which occur during construction.

  Maintains a constant review of current developments in the field
  of soil design.

  As directed, supervises and administers soils and materials
  testing programs for buildings and construction, specifically
  pertaining to soils.

  Gives professional guidance to field and/or personnel and
  supervises the performance of their work.

  Supervises construction of roadways and other site improvements
  involving soils.

  Prepares and supervises the preparation of specifications
  pertaining to soils and foundations.

  Investigates and makes recommendations to construction forces 
  in regard to all soil problems which occur during construction.

  Maintains a constant review of current developments in the field
  of soil design and construction.

  Maintains close liaison with all consulting engineers employed by
  the department in order to ensure the submission of acceptable 
  designs and specifications.

  Prepares and presents papers on technical matters.

  Plans, organizes and assigns the work of the organizational unit
  and evaluate employee performance and conduct, enabling the 
  effective recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and 
  disciplining of subordinates.

  Establishes and maintains the essential records and files.

  May be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
  and/or manual recording and information systems used by 
  the agency,  office or related units.

  REQUIREMENTS:

  EDUCATION:

  Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor's degree
  in engineering, including or supplemented by three (3) college 
  credits in soils mechanics.

  NOTE: Possession of a valid license as a Professional
  Engineer issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers
  and Land Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in
  engineering.

  NOTE:  A Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering Technology 
  (BSET) in a field related to civil engineering from an accredited 
  college having a curriculum approved by the Accreditation Board 
  of Engineering Technology (ABET) including or supplemented by 
  three (3) college credits in soil mechanics meets the above 
  education requirements.

  NOTE:  Possession of a valid license as a Professional Engineer 
  issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers
  and Land Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree 
  in engineering.

  EXPERIENCE:

  Three (3) years of professional experience in soils engineering.

  NOTE:  A Master's degree in soils mechanics may be substituted 
  for one (1) year of the required experience.

  LICENSE:

  Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid 
  in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than
  employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential 
  duties of the position.

  KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

  Knowledge of the fundamental, theoretical, and practical
  concepts of soils mechanics as applied to highway and 
  building design and construction.

  Knowledge of the laboratory and field test procedures as 
  applied to soils and pavements components.

  Knowledge of the problems implicit in the design of pavements,
  including the materials and construction methods to be used.

  Knowledge of the principles of engineering geology.

  Ability to organize assigned technical and supervisory soils
  engineering work, analyze soils engineering problems, and 
  develop appropriate work methods.

  Ability to assign and instruct employees, effectively preparing 
  and/or overseeing their performance appraisal.

  Ability to establish cooperative working relationships with
  contractors, outside engineers, and others.

  Ability to prepare realistic and sound cost, personnel,
  materials, time and other estimates, reports and records.

  Ability to review all plans and specifications to determine
  their adequacy in regard to soils and subdrainage design, 
  pavement components, quantities, and payment.

  Ability to prepare correspondence in the course of official
  duties.

  Ability to prepare clear, technically sound, and comprehensive
  engineering and other reports and files containing findings,
  conclusions, and recommendations.

  Ability to supervise the maintenance of the essential records,
  plans, and files.

  Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or
  manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
  office or related units.

  Ability to read, write, speak, understand, or communicate in
  English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American
  Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable 
  forms of communication.

  Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long
  as they can perform essential functions of the job with or without
  reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be 
  made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, 
  such persons may not be eligible.

  NOTE:  FOR PROMOTIONAL PURPOSES ONLY

  Employees hired by the Department of Transportation on or before 
  July 1, 1999, who do not possess the Bachelor's degree listed above, 
  may substitute education and experience as indicated below to meet
  the education requirement:

  EDUCATION:

  An Associate's degree in Engineering or Engineering Technology.

  OR

  Completion of forty-five (45) semester hour credits of specialized college 
  level/non-remedial  engineering education from an accredited college in 
  an engineering or engineering technology program.  Acceptable specialized 
  education must include a minimum of 24 credits in Engineering/Engineering 
  Science and a minimum of 21 credits in general science and higher-level 
  math courses.  Information regarding acceptable courses may be obtained 
  from DOT/Human Resources.

  You must attach a copy of your transcript(s) to your application.  Foreign 
  degrees/transcripts must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service.  
  Failure to do so will result in rejection from the examination process.

  AND

  Three and one half (3 1/2) years of full time experience in engineering 
  related work.

  Applicants who have more than the required forty-five (45) engineering 
  related credits may substitute additional credits for the required experience 
  on a pro-rated basis, thirty (30) credits equaling one (1) year of experience, 
  up to a maximum of two and one-half (2 1/2) years.

  CODES:  R26-10454           MER       7/18/09

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: For the position of Principal Engineer Geotechnical in New Jersey, a higher educational degree is not strictly mandatory if the candidate possesses a valid Professional Engineer license from the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors. This license can substitute for a Bachelor's degree in engineering. Additionally, a Bachelor's degree is not required for those hired by the Department of Transportation on or before July 1, 1999, if they have the necessary combination of an Associate's degree or specified semester hour credits and experience. However, possessing at least a Bachelor's degree in engineering, including coursework in soil mechanics, is otherwise necessary. A Master's degree can also substitute one year of required professional experience. Therefore, while a higher educational degree is heavily emphasized, equivalent professional credentials and experience can fulfill the requirement in some cases.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Possession of a valid license as a Professional Engineer issued by the New Jersey State Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree in engineering.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: The job description for Principal Engineer Geotechnical outlines education requirements that could pose barriers to applicants without a college or university degree. Specifically, it requires a Bachelor's degree in engineering with three college credits in soil mechanics, or a valid Professional Engineer license as a substitution. For promotional purposes only, existing employees before a specific date may have alternative qualifications, including an Associate's degree or specific college credit hours with additional work experience. Without such educational credentials or a Professional Engineer license, an applicant may face barriers in being hired for this position.
