name: Human Resource Specialist 1 Time And Leave Administration
Supervisor Of Nursing Services 10 Months
text:
Job Specification 03849C 











	
		
	    
	
	
		
			
				
					
				   
				
		  
	  
	
	
		 
	
	
		You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
	
	
		
	
	
		
	  
	
	
		
  
    
Job Specification 03849C 

SUPERVISOR OF NURSING SERVICES, 10 MOS DEAF LANGUAGE: SPECIALIST

 

DEFINITION


 Under direction of a Director of Nursing Services or other supervisory
 official in the Department of Education, has charge of the general
 nursing care of patients in an assigned building; does related work as
 required.

 NOTE: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative
 purposes only. A particular position using this title may not perform
 all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties
 performed on the job may not be listed.

 
EXAMPLES OF WORK:


 Organizes assigned supervisory nursing work and develops effective
 work methods.

 Assigns and instructs professional nursing and other employees
 assigned to the unit and supervises the performance of their work.

 Accompanies physicians on their rounds, assists them with examinations
 of patients, and takes the measures needed to see that their orders
 are carried out by the nursing and attending staff.

 Sees that the patients of the building or other areas are properly
 bathed and fed and that individual treatments are carried out as
 ordered by the physicians.

 Instructs student nurses and members of the attending staff in the
 approved hospital routines, methods, procedures, and precautions,
 including the setting up of trays, the serving of meals, the feeding
 of patients, the bathing and dressing of patients, the changing of bed
 linens, the sterilization of equipment of varied types, the taking and
 recording of temperatures, and the giving and recording of medication
 and treatment.

 Plans, organizes, and assigns the work of the organizational unit and
 evaluates employee performance and conduct, enabling the effective
 recommendation of the hiring, firing, promoting, and disciplining of
 subordinates.

 Admits and discharges patients into and from the building or area and
 supervises and personally keeps the required records.

 Assumes the responsibility for the care, physical and mental well
 being, safety, and in some instances, the custody of patients and/or
 inmates.

 Assists the Instructor of Nurses in planning and carrying out student
 work assignments.

 Supervises the cleanliness, sanitation, order, safety, and discipline
 within the building.

 Prepares reports.

 Maintains and supervises the maintenance of records, reports, and
 files.

 Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic
 and/or manual recording and information systems used by the agency,
 office, or related units.

 REQUIREMENTS:

           EDUCATION:

           Graduation from an accredited School of Nursing.

           EXPERIENCE:

      Two (2) years of experience as a professional nurse in a
 hospital, clinic, school system, or other institution. (Private duty
 experience is not acceptable experience).

           LICENSE:

           Registration as a professional nurse in the State of New
 Jersey.

      Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid
 in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee
 mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the
 position.

      SPECIAL SKILL

      Applicants must be able to communicate effectively in the
 language of the deaf, particularly American Sign Language,
 sufficiently to perform duties of this position.

      SPECIAL NOTE: A School Nurse Certificate issued by the New Jersey Department of
 Education will be required for appointment to educational facilities
 identified by the New Jersey Department of Education.

 KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

 Knowledge of modern nursing techniques, routines, and methods used in
 hospitals and other institutions.

 Knowledge of the standards, rules, regulations, policies, and
 procedures of the department and of the particular institution after a
 period of training.

 Ability to organize assigned supervisory nursing work and develop
 effective work methods.

 Ability to assign and instruct individuals and groups of professional
 nurses and attending employees and to supervise the performance of
 their work.

 Ability to supervise the proper care and custody of patients and
 inmates and to see that the orders of the medical staff are carried
 out.

 Ability to instruct and supervise the training of student nurses,
 Psychiatric Technician Trainees, and therapists of several types in
 approved routines, procedures, and precautions.

 Ability to encourage the development of a proper professional attitude
 among the members of the nursing staff.

 Ability to prepare and supervise the preparation of accurate and
 detailed clinical, medical, and other records and reports.

 Ability to maintain essential records and files.

 Ability to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording
 and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

 Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English
 sufficiently to perform duties of this position. American Sign
 Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of
 communication.

 Ability to communicate in sign language and AMSLAN.

 Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as
 they can perform essential functions of the job after reasonable
 accommodation is made to their known limitations. If the accommodation
 cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship,
 such persons may not be eligible.

 CODE: 20/S21 - 03849            AG             10/18/03

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: For the job of Supervisor of Nursing Services, 10 MOS Deaf Language: Specialist, a higher educational degree is not explicitly required beyond graduating from an accredited School of Nursing. However, the position requires specific professional credentials, such as registration as a professional nurse in the State of New Jersey and possibly a School Nurse Certificate, depending on the assignment. Additionally, applicants must have two years of relevant professional nursing experience in a hospital, clinic, or similar institution, and demonstrate proficiency in American Sign Language. These credentials and experiences are essential for performing the duties outlined, but a higher educational degree is not mandated.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Registration as a professional nurse in the State of New Jersey.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants: Graduation from an accredited School of Nursing is required, which typically involves obtaining a college or university degree.

name: Loading Dock Coordinator State Capitol Joint Management Commission
Director Of Clinical Nutrition
text:
You are reading the State of New Jersey Job Descriptions. This is not a Job Vacancy Announcement.
Job Specification


DIRECTOR OF CLINICAL NUTRITION

DEFINITION

Under general direction has responsibility for coordinating, directing, 
and evaluating the services provided by all nutritionists of lower grade; 
provides consultation to institutions in correcting deficiencies and meeting 
federal, state and departmental standards; serves as an advisor to the 
Department and high level Division Directors regarding programs for the 
Department; does related work as required.

NOTE:  The definition and examples of work for this title are for illustrative 
purposes only.  A particular position using this title may not perform all 
duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties performed 
on the job may not be listed.

EXAMPLES OF WORK

Coordinates and/or supervises the professional activities of nutritionists 
of lower grade throughout the Department.

Coordinates implementation of the Department's nutrition program in 
context to the overall departmental health plan and budget.

Formulates the Department's nutrition program policies.

Analyzes data, summarizes conclusions, and utilizes these in 
administrative decision making.

Coordinates evaluation of nutrition program activities to establish 
the validity of program objectives and the effectiveness of programs, 
operational policies, and procedures in accomplishing these objectives.

Coordinates investigation and preparation of detailed recommendations 
relating to proposed expansion, continuation or elimination of 
programmatic needs and functions as well as positions and groups of 
positions.

Advises administrators on nutrition program plans, policy requirements, 
staffing recommendations, and organizational structure of nutrition 
departments.

Prepares a policy and procedure manual for use by personnel 
delivering nutrition services.

Serves as the representative for nutrition services on the Department's 
policy making and administrative team.

Interprets federal and State standards and assists institutional 
nutrition service departments in clarifying objectives and procedures 
for compliance.

Provides leadership and assists in the development and presentation 
of training programs for professional staff of Nutrition and Food Service 
Departments.

Confers with physicians, administrators, and Central Office professional 
staff regarding institutional program needs.

Serves as a resource person to provide up-to-date information in the 
area of normal and clinical nutrition.

Reviews requests for the hiring, transfer, and promotion of clinical 
nutritionists, and provides recommendations for the use of the 
Supervising and clinical nutritionists.

Coordinates activities of clinical nutritionists within State institutions, 
and serves as consultant when requested for State and county nutrition 
programs.

Promotes effective public relations.

Prepares clear, accurate reports containing findings, facts, and 
recommendations.

Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or 
manual recording and information systems used by the agency, 
office or related units.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION	

A Doctorate in Nutrition with a graduate course in Food, Biochemistry, 
Physiology, Biostatistics and Community Nutrition.

EXPERIENCE

Five (5) years of full-time professional experience in the field of 
Nutrition or Dietetics, at least three (3) years of which must have 
been as a Nutritionist in an administrative, consultative, or supervisory
capacity in the State, federal, or community nutrition program.

CERTIFICATION:

NOTE: Appointees must possess a current and valid Certification as 
a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) 
issued by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics.

LICENSE

Appointee will be required to possess a driverï¿½s license valid in 
New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee 
mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of the current science and practice of Nutrition and 
of the standard of practice in Clinical Nutrition.

Knowledge of policies, procedures, standards, and regulations 
basic to health care facilities.

Knowledge of training aids, methods, and practices used in 
professional-level training programs.

Ability to assimilate a broad spectrum of information in order to 
conceptualize relevant elements of program management.

Ability to implement plans and execute decisions.

Ability to use a problem solving approach to decision making, 
while considering the impact of alternative solutions.

Ability to interpret, evaluate, and utilize pertinent, current research 
related to nutritional care.

Ability to compile or develop educational materials and to present 
formal and informal nutrition education for professionals.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships 
with those interested or involved in the work of the unit.

Ability to maintain essential records and files.

Ability to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual
 recording and information systems used by the agency, office or 
related units.

Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in 
English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.  American 
Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable
forms of communication.

Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as 
they can perform the essential functions of the job with or without 
reasonable accommodation.  If the accommodation cannot be made 
because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons 
may not be eligible.

Additionally, the job specifies the necessity of Certification as a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN). These educational and certification requirements ensure the candidate has the in-depth knowledge, skills, and professional credibility needed for the responsibilities outlined in the job description.

This requirement explicitly stipulates a high level of educational attainment, which cannot be bypassed by an applicant who does not hold at least a doctoral degree in the specified fields. Additionally, the requirement for a valid Certification as a Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) may be challenging for applicants without a college or university degree.

name: Supervisor Employment And Training Programs

educationRequirements.evidenceQuote: Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
Possession of a Master's degree in Political Science, Education, Economics, Sociology, Psychology, Public Administration, or Human Resource Development from an accredited college or university

alternativeQualifications: Nine (9) years of professional experience in the development, implementation, or coordination of multiphase employment and training programs in a large public or private agency, one (1) of which shall have been in a supervisory capacity

mandatoryStatusExplanations.degreeRequirementExplanation: A higher educational degree is not absolutely required for the job of Supervisor Employment and Training Programs, but it can significantly influence the qualifications needed. The job allows for either professional experience or a combination of experience and education to fulfill the requirements. Applicants can qualify with nine years of relevant professional experience, including one year in a supervisory capacity, or with a bachelor's degree and five years of experience (including one year supervisory). Possession of a master's degree in certain fields requires four years of professional experience, including one year supervisory. Thus, while a higher degree can reduce the required years of experience, it is not a strict necessity if the candidate has sufficient relevant professional experience.

professionalLicenseRequirement.licenseDescription: Appointees will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.

degreeAnalysis.barriersToNonDegreeApplicants:
The job description presents a barrier to hiring an applicant without a college or university degree. It requires applicants to meet one of the following conditions:

1. Nine years of professional experience in the relevant field, with one year in a supervisory capacity, which is a high threshold for those without a degree.
2. Possession of a bachelor's degree along with five years of relevant experience, including one year in a supervisory role.
3. Possession of a master's degree with four years of relevant experience, including one year in a supervisory role.

The requirements equate 30 semester hour credits to one year of experience, but the high level of experience needed without a degree remains a substantial barrier.
